loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es: Norma Luz O. D. S. vive en Soyapango departamento D. San Salvador  junto a su esposo y dos hijas, Norma se dedica a la elaboración negativos para cuadernos, Norma tiene muchos clientes en la zona D. San Salvador, donD. ella distribuye todos los negativos que produce; pero a veces su producción no alcanza a cubrir las demandas D. sus clientes;  es por ello que  Norma solicita un nuevo crédito, para la compra D. suficiente materia prima, para la elaboración D. estos negativos; ya que necesita producir más para llegar a mas lugares con su producto y cubrir las necesidades D. sus clientes. Cabe mencionar que Norma ya ha obtenido créditos anteriormente en los cuales ha sido puntual es sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Norma Luz O. D. S. lives with her husband and two daughters in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. She operates a business making prints for notebooks. Norma has lots of customers in San Salvador which she sells all the prints that she makes and sometimes she can't keep up with customer demand. That's why she's applying for a new loan. She wants to buy enough of the basic materials she needs to make the prints. She needs to make more so that she has enough to meet customer demand. It should be mentioned that Norma has received loans before and she has always been punctual in repaying them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for business.

loans.name: Tuisuesue

texts.en:
Tuisuesue V., 42, is married with 8 children. She has five years of experience in the pancakes business. She sells to the villagers and the general public five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (about $150).

SPBD loans are Tuisuesue’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her second SPBD loan. She will purchase ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder, and cooking oil. Part of the loan will also be used to pay for the children's school fees and to buy school supplies.

Tuisuesue's husband is a farmer and he works in the plantation to earn extra income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder, and cooking oil, as well as to help pay the children's school fees and buy school supplies.

loans.name: Paea

texts.en:
Paea L., 62, is married and the mother of eight children. She is starting a pancake business. She will be selling to the village people and the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 130 Tala (about $42).

SPBD loans are Paea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. She plans to use her loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, etc., in order to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, etc.

loans.name: Olaiala

texts.en:
Olaiala U., 36, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the bingo business. She runs bingo games five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala (about $220).

SPBD loans are Olaiala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her second SPBD loan. Her loan will be used solely to support her business, specifically to purchase bingo prizes such as snack foods, lollies, frozen goods, ramen, milk, flour, and sugar.

loans.use: To purchase bingo prizes such as snack foods, lollies, frozen goods, ramen, milk, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Papaya production is the main livelihood of Mrs. Cristita A., a 54-year-old resident of Garang, Tangub City. She is a member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC- Tangub City Satellite Office. Her husband is a farmer and her partner in cultivating this tenanted papaya plantation. Sometimes her husband performs some labor jobs.

Regarding their business, her main customers are fruit-stand owners and that is why it was not hard for them to sell their products. Now she is applying for PHP 5,000.00 to finance her papaya production, specifically to purchase commercial fertilizers. It is her third loan in our co-op. Her hopes and aspirations for her family are to have their own lot and to give a better future to their only child.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer for papaya production

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina T., 64, is married with six children. She has one year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers four days per week. 

This is her first loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala.  SPBD loans are Lina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives, an axe, a ranging pole, a wheelbarrow and a knapsack sprayer

loans.name: Seutaatia

texts.en:
Seutaatia T., 42, is married with 1 child. She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala.

SPBD loans are Seutaatia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives, knapsack sprayer, chemical, spade, ect.

loans.name: Timoteo Antonio

texts.es: Timoteo Antonio M. O. vive en San Luis Talpa departamento La Paz, junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Timoteo se dedica a la crianza de pollos, aproximadamente produce 200 pollo mensuales para vender, la esposa de Timoteo al igual que sus hijos ayudan en el cuido de estos pollos; también Timoteo trabaja eventualmente de albañil. Timoteo y su esposa son dueños de la casa donde residen, la han ido ampliando poco a poco y ahora necesitan introducir energía eléctrica a su hogar, es por ello que solicitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Timoteo Antonio M. O. lives with his wife and two young children in San Luis Talpa in the La Paz district. Timoteo works raising chickens, and sells approximately 200 chickens per month. His wife and children also help care for these chickens. Timoteo also works as a mason on occasion. Timoteo and his wife own their own home. They have been adding on to their house little by little and now need to install electricity in it. It is for this reason they request this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install electricity in his home

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta T., 39, is married with 4 children. She has 5 years of experience in the Elei Printing business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~50 USD). SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase paint, brush, cotton materials, design board, paints and varnish

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~110 USD). SPBD loans are Repeka’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fishing equipment such as googles, spear, torch, cooler and a fishing net for a fishing business.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala. SPBD loans are Mauilevao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bagged sugar, plastic cups, paper, milk, vanilla,

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala (~120 USD). SPBD loans are Filomena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.name: Ema

texts.en:
Ema M., 32, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 270 Tala. SPBD loans are Ema’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase wire, knapsack sprayer, chemicals, pipes, etc

loans.name: Mairamchon

texts.ru: Майрамчон молодая женщина 28 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Майрамчон очень много страдала в своей жизни. Перенесла много болезней, одна из болезней, которая она перенесла, это рак груди. Ей сделали операцию.Её муж занимается производством детских национальных колыбелек. Производство национальных колыбелек это ручная работа и не требует никакого  оборудования. Муж Майрамчон учился у старца 2 года этому ремеслу. Теперь он мастерит колыбельки самостоятельно и отвозит их на рынок. А Майрамчон продает их.  На сумму займа они хотят закупить сырьё.
texts.en:
Mairamchon A. is a young woman of 28, married and has 3 children. Unfortunately she has already endured a lot of suffering, having gone through a lot of illnesses including breast cancer, for which she had surgery. Her husband makes traditional children's cribs. This is a very hand-intensive process that does not require any special equipment. He studied the craft under an old craftsman for 2 years. Today he makes the cribs entirely on his own and transports them to market, where Mairamchon sells them. They would like a loan to buy raw materials for making the cribs.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make traditional children's cribs

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Liên Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20213030008) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo 2- 09 (9).


L. is married and has 3 adult children.  To make a living, L. operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.186.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3.360.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Chu Thị T. (20213030009) is a 32 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


2.  Đỗ Thị L. (20213030010) is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Đinh Thị L. (20213030011) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


4.  Đào Thị T. H. (20213030012) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


5.  Nghiêm Thị T. (20213030013) is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 4.256.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn Thị (20213030008) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Gạo 2- 09 (9).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng tre cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.360.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Chu Thị T. (20213030009) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  Đỗ Thị L. (20213030010) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  Đinh Thị L. (20213030011) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


4.  Đào Thị T. H. (20213030012) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  Nghiêm Thị T. (20213030013) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất L. & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Shuhratchon

texts.ru: Шухратчон – мужчина средних лет (36 лет), женат и отец 4-х детей. У Шухратчона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состоящее примерно из 30 овец и 20 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Шухратчон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Шухратчона пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Шухратчон за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Шухратчон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Shuhratchon G. is a middle aged man of 36, is married and has 4 children. He has a herd of about 30 sheep and 20 goats. His wife is a housewife who in her spare time spins yarn. Shuhratchon takes his herd out every morning into the mountains to graze and returns back with it in the evening. Right now he has a small herd. He would like to use the new loan to buy two average sized bulls. He will feed and fatten them up for about 3-4 months and then sell them at a profitable price. Shuhratchon appreciates being a member of our credit society, the loans have made a big difference for him.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bulls to feed and sell

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal is a widow and lives with her daughter in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is a nineteen-year-old student at a local university. Otgonjargal has a small business making processed milk products, such as cheese and ice-cream. She was briefly trained in making milk products in 1981. In 1998, she decided to use her previous training and to pursue a business making milk products.

She started the business with 400,000 MNT of working capital ($1 USD=1,500 MNT) and sells her products from outside her house, which is located next to the road. An advantage of selling her products outside her home is that there is no rent. Her business capital has increased to 1,600,000 MNT. The business usually peaks during the summer time. As the summer approaches, she is requesting a loan to purchase more milk.

loans.use: To purchase milk

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone F., 56, is married with 7 children. She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala. SPBD loans are Leone’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for home improvement and school needs.

loans.use: Purchase school uniform, school fees, chemicals, fertilizer, bushknives, wheelbarrow

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер мужчина , который кредитуется в Микринвест с 2005 года.Он продаёт на рынке города Костакоза запасными частями для домашнего обихода и автомашин.Далер очень энергичный и способный на продвижение бизнеса.он два раза ездит за товаром в г.Истаравшан, на оптовый рынок.Также у него есть поставщики , которые сами привозят товар на место его деятельности.Далер следующий займ планирует использовать также на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Daler is a man who has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2005. He sells parts for household appliances and automobiles at the Kostakoz city market. Daler is very energetic and capable of developing his business. Twice he has traveled to Istaravshan to purchase goods at the wholesale market. He also has a supplier, who delivers goods to his place of business. In a similar fashion, Daler plans to use his next loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: Tupea

texts.en:
Tupea T., 55, is married with 9 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the school children and public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 210 Tala (~180 USD). SPBD loans are Tupea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, wheel barrow, electric chain saw and knives.

loans.name: Sulufaga

texts.en:
Sulufaga E., 48, is married with 9 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~115 USD). SPBD loans are Sulufaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, a rake and fertilizers

loans.name: Sumya

texts.en:
Sumya T. is 51, married and the mother of one. Her family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2002, she opened a grocery story right next to her house and on the plot of land she owns. Her store is located in a good location and there are no other competitors in the area. She has many repeat clients including her neighbors. Increasing numbers of customers has driven working capital from 800,000 tugrugs to 4,200,000 tugrugs during the last seven years.

Sumya's husband, Boris, is a cab driver and her only daughter, Handmaa, is studying at a university to become a medical doctor. Sumya is requesting a loan to buy a variety of food products such as flour, rice, vegetable, sugar and candies. Her dream is to have her own supermarket downtown.

loans.use: To buy a variety of food products such as flour, rice, vegetable, sugar and candies

loans.name: Leone

texts.en:
Leone P., 57, is married with 11 children. She has 5 years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and school children 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 Tala (~100 USD). SPBD loans are Leone’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds, a spade, knives and a wheel barrow

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз - молодой мужчина лет 30. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. У него среднее образование. Он занимается продажей обуви и хлопчатобумажной ткани на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Его жена помогает ему. Абдуазиз продает обувь а его жена продает ткань. Абдуазиз с женой закупают товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Они ездят за товаром раз в месяц. Абдуазиз уже год берет кредит в нашей организации. По началу он продавал только обувь. Теперь он расширил бизнес и закупил партию хлопчатобумажной ткани, чтобы жена тоже занялась делом. Теперь на новый займ они хотят закупить новую партию товара.
texts.en:
Abduaziz is a young 30 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education. He sells shoes and cotton fabrics at the “Farovon” market in Gafurov. His wife helps him. Abduaziz sells shoes and his wife sells fabrics. Abduaziz and his wife purchase their products from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. They travel for their products once a month. Abduaziz has been taking credit from our organization for a year. In the beginning he only sold shoes. Now he expanded his business and purchased a stock of cotton fabrics so that his wife can also be involved in the business. Now he would like to use his new loan to purchase a new stock of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: shoes and cotton fabrics

loans.name: Bikenja

texts.ru: Бикенча женщина 44 лет, замужем имеет троих,кредитуется уже пятый год.Её муж уехал на заработки в Россию,каждый месяц посылает деньги на жизнь.Но Бикенча со своими сыновьями тратит деньги заработанные мужем на стройку дома.Поэтому её очень помогает на семейные расходы доход с её бизнеса, продажи в розницу носков и нижнего белья.Она благодарна всем инвесторам за поддержку и понимание, за возможность поддерживать товарооборот в кредит.
texts.en:
Bikenja is a 44 year old woman; she is married and has three children. This is her fifth year as a borrower. Her husband went to Russia to earn money and every month he sends money to live on. But Bikenja with her sons spends the money earned by her husband to build a house. Because of this her business, selling socks and underwear at retail, helps her a lot with family expenses. She is grateful to all the investors for their support and understanding, for the opportunity to maintain turnover with credit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of socks and underwear

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Tsend-Ayush L. is 59, married and the mother of three daughters. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two of her daughters are university students. In 2004, Tsend-Ayush started running a shoe making business. She makes traditional Mongolian shoes and sells them to local customers.

When she began to run her retail business, she had many competitors who were running similar businesses. To attract clients, Tsen-Ayush focused on quality and price. Her shoes were cheaper than others and had higher quality. Her working capital has increased from 200,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT) to 500,000 tugrugs. Her daughters are always helping with their mother's business when they have free time.

Tsend-Ayush sells shoes from home and dreams of owning her own shoe shop. She requests a loan to buy raw materials.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Toli

texts.en:
Toli F., 33, is married with 4 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village and the general public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~58 USD). SPBD loans are Toli’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a knife, a rake, a spade and weed killer

loans.name: Davaadechin

texts.en:
Davaadechin S. is 27, married, and the father of one. Their son is attending kindergarten. Davaadechin’s family lives in a condominium that they own in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Davaadechin has been running a mobile phone and accessory sales business in Tedy, the biggest cellular phone sales center in Ulaanbaatar. Once every month Davaadechin goes to Beijing, China, to buy mobile phones at a cheap price to resell them in Mongolia. His wife Urantamir looks after his shop sometimes when he goes to Beijing. Besides helping her husband, Uranchimeg runs her own grocery store.

Davaadechin requests a loan to buy more mobile phones to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia L., 33, is married with 6 children. She has 5 years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 110 Tala (~62 USD). SPBD loans are Telesia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase a rake, a knife, vegetable seeds, fertilizer and a spade

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.ru: Абдугафур - мужчина 28 лет. Женат и отец  3-х детей. Работает парикмахером на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Он арендует там помещение. Он работает парикмахером уже 5 лет. Год он учился и работал в качестве ученика. Теперь он занимается эти делом самостоятельно. Жена Абдугафура домохозяйка. Она сидит дома, занимается домашними делами и нянчит своих детей. Абдугафур планирует расширить свой бизнес. Он хочет взять ученика и поставить оборудование рядом. Для этого нужны деньги и поэтому он хочет взять кредит.
texts.en:
Abdugafur is a 28 year old man. He is married and is a father of three children. He works as a barber on the Farovon market of the town of Gafurov. He rents a space there. He has been a barber for five years now. He has been an apprentice for the first year. Right now he is running his own business. Abdugafu's wife is a housewife. She stays at home and does the housework and looks after children. Abdugafur plans to expand his business. He wants to hire an apprentice and place equipment close by. He needs money for this and this is why he needs a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business barbershop

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
"oàn Trần Thị (20213030001) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N..  H. is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo 2 - 10 (10).


H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, H. operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Chu Thị

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Obidchon

texts.ru:
Обидчон удачно без проблем закончил свой очередной займ и хочет получить следующий кредит, который хочет использовать на закуп угля и мяса.У него хороший поток клиентов, которые на обед покупают у него шашлык.Шашлык Обидчона очень вкусный и качественный, он готовит шашалык из бараньего мяса и говяжьего.
Обидчон за время своей кредитной истории отремонтировал свой ларёк, который выглядит как летняя столовая.
texts.en:
Obidchon has successfull completed his previous loan and wants to get a new loan which he wants to use to buy coal and meat. He has a high stream of customers who buy his shish kebab for lunch. Obidchon makes very delicious and good quality shish kebab which he makes from lamb or beef. During his credit history Obidchon has repaired his stand which looks like a summer cafe.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and coal

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt D. is 43, married, and the mother of two. Both her children go to an elementary school.

Since 2006, she has been running a clothing sales business at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband, Tuvshinjargal, helps her and sews women's topcoats. Erdenetsogt sells only women's apparel sewn by herself and her husband. With their business profit, the couple has bought a plot of land to live on. They now live in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent), and are planning to build a house.

With this loan, Erdenetsogt will buy raw materials such as cotton, zippers, and buttons. Their dream is to expand their family business and have their own large tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as cotton, zippers, and buttons

loans.name: Fanaufouina

texts.en:
Fanaufouina F., 26, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the school children and public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~132 USD). SPBD loans are Fanaufouina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase twisties, ice cakes, lollies, German buns and cream buns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag G. is 32, married and the father of two daughters. His family moved from the countryside to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They now live in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian housing tent) district. His eldest daughter, Namuuntsetseg, goes to elementary school and the youngest daughter, Namuundari, goes to kindergarten.

In 2005, Ganhuyag leased a vehicle to run a taxi service. By 2006 he had fully paid for the vehicle and continued working as a cab driver. With the profit, he has built a small house on the plot of land he owns.

He requests a loan to expand his small house and also buy spare parts for his vehicle. His car is his family’s only source of income. His spouse, Narantsetseg, is unemployed and stays at home to take care of the two children.

"When I moved to the city from the country, I had nothing. As a result of my hard work, I own a plot of land, my own little house and also my own business. I'm really satisfied with my life here," Ganhuyag says.

loans.use: To expand his small house and also buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Pisila

texts.en:
Pisila L., 46, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 140 Tala (~98 USD). SPBD loans are Pisila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a pick, a bush knife, fertilizer and weed killer

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana P., 46, is single with two children.  She has two years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the people of the village and the neighbourhood, three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 tala (~$60 US).  SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase cotton materials, a sewing machine, needles and thread

loans.name: Vaelua

texts.en: Vaelua I., 74, is married with seven children.  She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 130 Tala (~$45 US).  SPBD loans are Vaelua’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knife, fertilizer, axe and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Lilya

texts.ru: Лиля - женщина 47 лет , замужем, имеет четверых детей.Она купив свежую рыбу,каптит её и продаёт на рынке.Она уже много лет занимается этим бизнесом, у неё большой опыт в этой деятельности.Кредитуется она уже второй год.Для закупа рыбы, которую она хочет законсервировать на продажу.Она пунктуально , аккуратно работает с кредитами.
texts.en:
Lilya is a 47 year old woman; she is married and has four children. She purchases fresh fish, smokes it and sells it at the market. She has been in this business for many years; she has a lot of experience in this area. This is her second year as a borrower in order to purchase fish that she wants to preserve for sale. She works punctually and accurately with lenders.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira L. sells used-clothing in her village. She retails ready-to-wear (RTW) items in order to have enough income to support her family. Aside from clothes, she also sells fish to supplement her income. Elvira is 25 years old. She was a sales clerk before in Tagbilaran Bohol but stopped working there because of low compensation. She is married and has two children.

Elvira is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy RTW items to sell. In addition to clothes, part of the loan will be used to buy fish to sell. The loan will help Elvira's family to grow her businesses.


CEVI is reaching out to small entrepreneurs to sustain their livelihood. It provides not just loans, but also credit, training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing and fish to sell

loans.name: Leala

texts.en: Leala O., 60, is married with ten children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to the villagers and public, two days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$165 US).  SPBD loans are Leala’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans with the traditional banks. This loan will be used to meet her business needs.

loans.use: To purchase Gramoxone, wheelbarrow, bushknives, pesticides, water hose and water gallon tank

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20201050006) is a 38 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 07 (7).

T. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2006000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201050008) is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

2.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20201050009) is a 26 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  Nguyễn Thị Hoà (20201050062) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

4.  Đặng Thị N. (20201050063) is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Dương Thị Hà (20201050064) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Making & selling food.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta S., 21, is married with two children.  She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public, one day per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 tala (~$25 US).  SPBD loans are Ruta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, weed killer, spade, electric chain saw and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Laupama

texts.en: Laupama S., 49, is married with three children.  She has many years of experience in the vegetable business. She sells to the villagers and public, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 tala (~$135 US).  SPBD loans are Laupama’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvement and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, cement and timber and to pay school fees

loans.name: Tufaina

texts.en: Tufaina F., 38, is married with four children.  She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 tala (~$35 US).  SPBD loans are Tufaina’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, an axe and an electric chain saw

loans.name: Luavalu

texts.en: Luavalu I., 31, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the villagers and public, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 tala (~$115 US).  SPBD loans are Luavalu’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks

loans.use: To purchase kava bowls, fine mats, tapa cloth, earrings and other Samoan handicrafts

loans.name: Seepa

texts.en:
Seepa V., 33, is married with 6 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 1 day a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~ 60USD).

She had 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Seepa’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools and materials for her plantation

loans.name: Maseiga

texts.en:
Maseiga I., 42, is married with 6 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

She had 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Maseiga’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools and supplies

loans.name: Losa

texts.en:
Losa M., 28, is married with 1 child. She has 3 years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 1 day a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~50 USD).

She had 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Losa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools and supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela Apango is a scrap buyer. She is 30 year old  hard working mother who loves to sing and has 3 children. Her husband, Nemesio Apango is helping her manage their scrap buy and sell business.

Rosela is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more scrap items to grow their business. She will sell her scrap items with 40% mark up value. This is what she uses to feed and clothe her family.

CEVI is reaching out more people especially the poor to start and have their own business. CEVI provides all their clients not just credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional scrap materials for sale

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese T., 42, is married with eight children.  She has many years of experience in the fresh fish business. She sells to the villagers and public, two days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 tala (~$165 US).  SPBD loans are Akenese’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvements and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase cement, timber, a new fishing net, new canoe, iron roofing and to pay school fees

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela A. is a scrap buyer. She is 30 years old, hard working mother who loves to sing and has 3 children. Her husband, Nemesio A. is helping her manage their scrap buy and sell business.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more scrap items to grow their business. She will sell her scrap items with 40% mark up value. This is what she uses to feed and clothe her family.

CEVI is reaching out more people especially the poor to start and have their own business. CEVI provides all their clients not just credit but trainings and insurance coverage as wel

loans.use: to buy scrap items to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana A. C., 38, is married with three children. She has three years of experience in the vegetable-garden business. She sells to the people of the village and the neighborhood two days per week.

She has had one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 140 Tala (about $65). SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers, a spade and an electric chain saw

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili T., 31, is single with no children.  She has many year(s) of experience in the general store business. She sells to the villagers/public 7 days per week. She has 4 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Pili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.All will be used to maintain business needs.

loans.use: Purchase box of herring, box of noodles , laundry powder, bar of laundry soap , lollies , twisties , toilet rolls etc.

loans.name: Lisete Venâncio

texts.pt:
Lisete Venâncio B. é natural de Boane província do Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 1 filho com 13 anos de idade. Apenas sustenta o seu único filho.

Lisete estudou até 7ªclasse e paro por falta de condições financeira da família, desde a sua infância nunca mudou de cidade. Lisete vive de negócio que consiste na compra e venda de roupa usada no mercado local da vila de Boane, deste negócio consegue mensalmente 4800,00mt e consegue poupar 1500,00mt.

Para Lisete este é o quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku, sempre aplicou neste negócio, antes obtinha na associação Gueguegue. Com este empréstimo de 10000,00mt pretende aumentar o seu volume de negócio, futuramente Lisete pretende construir um estabelecimento de venda de roupa dado que neste momento trabalha numa Banca.
texts.en:
Lisete Venâncio, 36, married, was born in the Maputo province of Boane, Mozambique. She is the mother of a thirteen year-old boy. Due to her family's financial constraints Lisete's studies were interrupted in 7th grade. She's lived in Boane all her life. Her business of buying and selling used clothes at the local market brings in an income of 48000,00 mt per month, of which amount she is able to save 1500,00mt. This is her fifth loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. Before Hluvuku, she worked with the Gueguegue Association, having always invested all her loans in the business. Currently a street vendor, she plans to invest on building a store, in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell used clothes

loans.name: Vaileta

texts.en:
Vaileta P., 52, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to the villagers/public two days per week.

She has had two previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166). SPBD loans are Vaileta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, gromozones (herbicide), weed killer and bush knives

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда заёмщица в Микроинвест с 2007 года.Она использует деньги на закуп свежей рыбы , которую она сама каптит и продаёт на рынке г.Гафурова.Также она имеет клиентов из столицы города Душанбе.Как все знают в Душанбе дефицит рыбы.Её рыба очень вкусная и качественная.Следующий кредит она хочет потратить на увеличение товарооборота.Хуршеда на снимке в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Hursheda has been a MicroInvest borrower since 2007. She uses the money to purchase fresh fish which she smokes herself and sells at the Gafurov market. She also has clients from the capital, Dushanbe. As everyone knows, Dushanbe has a fish deficit. Her fish is very tasty and is of high quality. She would like to use her next loan to increase turnover. Hursheda is in the photo on the day that she received her loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Mataomaile

texts.en:
Mataomaile G., 27, is married with 3 children. She has 5 years of experience in the Pancake business. She sells her pancakes in the public market 5 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (~ 160USD).

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Mataomaile’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her pancake business

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.ru: Тухфанисо 51 год Она замужем и имеет 2-х детей. Сын уже женился. Он живет с Тухфанисо. А дочь вышла замуж и живет отдельно с мужем. Муж Тухфанисо уехал в Россию работать. Тухфанисо занимается продажей хлопчатобумажной ткани на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Она привозит товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Её сын помогает Тухфанисо. Отвозит товар на рынок и привозит по окончанию дня. Тухфанисо берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is 51 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son has already married and lives with Tuhfaniso. Her daughter has also married and lives separately with her husband. Tuhfaniso's husband has went to Russia for work. Tuhfaniso is in the business of selling cotton fabrics on the market Farovon in the town of Gafurov. She brings her merchandise from the wholesale market of Istaravshan. Her son also helps her. He delivers the merchandise to the market and back at the end of the day. Tuhfaniso needs a loan to increase the assortment and to expand business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Tauia

texts.en:
Tauia A., 32, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Tauia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy tools and supplies

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia Polestico owns a furniture shop. She is 46 years old and has 5 children. She sells beautiful sofas made of rattan, tables and other furniture. Her husband, Jaime Polestico, is the one who makes most of the furniture that she sells. Aside from making chairs, she also owns a tricycle. It is a common transport in their village. Someone is renting their tricycle and she just collects the rent as additional income for their family.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy furniture accessories to be used in her shop. The loan will help her family get better income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. It provides people credit to run their business. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage to make their business grow.

loans.use: To buy furniture accessories

loans.name: Majed Khan Group

texts.en:
Majed Khan is the group leader of the Majed Khan group. There are four members in this group, and they all live in 15th district. Each of them are requesting a loan for their separate businesses. The total amount of the group loan is 20000 Afghani for the term of 10 months.

Majed Khan wants a loan for his tailoring business, so he can buy a new machine for his shop. M. Karam needs a loan to buy materials for his fresh fruit shop, and Bibi Zakara and Bibi Mazaery would like to borrow money for their quilt-making business. They all want to expand and improve their businesses. They are all happy about the loan process and want to tell you how pleased they are about the support the loans provide entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Expand and inprove their businesses

loans.name: Tailua

texts.en: Tailua F., 38, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the taro and bananas business. She sells to the villagers and public, three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 tala (~$165 US).  SPBD loans are Tailua’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy an electric chainsaw, weedkiller, axe, Gramoxone and pesticides

loans.name: Nasibahon

texts.ru: Насибахон- женщина, которая занимается куплей и продажей свежей рыбы.Она закупает товар с рыбного рынка, а также её поставляют её знакомые рыболовы.Она занимается этим бизнесом уже много лет.По бизнесу ей помогает её муж.Она хочет использовать следующий кредит на закуп рыбы по оптовой цене.У неё в ассортименте имеются рыбы:камбала, сазан,сом.На снимке Насибахон в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Nasibahon is involved in buying and selling fresh fish. She buys fish at a fish market and also has it supplied by her fisherman friends. She has been in this business for many years. Her husband helps with the business. Nasibahon wants to use her next loan to purchase fish at wholesale prices. Her fish assortment includes dab flounder, carp and catfish. The photograph shows Nasibahon on the issuance day.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish at wholesale prices

loans.name: Tabita

texts.en:
Tabita J. is 31 years old.  She deals in the business of selling food stuffs at a restaurant in Munuki's second market which is considered as one of the third largest markets in Juba. and requests these loan of 400USD to buy sands and cement to plaster the wall of the resturant.  Tabita is married to a farmer who grows crops at the river bank of river Nile since two years. In the family's background, they produced four children who are all boys and they attend school at Gudele primary school.  In the future, she aims at building a house for rental purposes.  

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy cement and sands to plaster the wall of the resturant building

loans.name: Estêvão Fernando

texts.pt:
Estêvão Fernando Z. é natural de Boane província do Maputo, tem 27 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 7, 5, 3 e 1 ano respectivamente, apenas o primeiro é que vai a escola. Para alem da sua família sustenta dois irmãos que vive com eles.

Estêvão estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras da família, onde muito cedo viu se obrigado a procurar emprego para a sua sobrevivência, desde a sua infância nunca mudou se de cidade.

Estêvão vive de negócio que consiste na venda de electrodomésticos com maior destaque aos aparelhos sonoros, tendo o seu estabelecimento na zona comercial, tem rendimento mensal de 15000,00mt e consegue poupar 1500,00mt por mês. 

Estêvão solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva com qual pretende melhorar o seu estabelecimento, sendo no aumento do estoque e na reabilitação do estabelecimento. Futuramente pretende adquirir outro empréstimo apenas para aumentar o estoque. 

o estevao aparece na foto com o construtor do estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Estêvão Fernando Z., 27, was born in the Boane district of Maputo, Mozambique. He is the father of four kids, ages 7, 5, 3 and 1 (the older one is enrolled in school). In addition to providing for his family, he supports two brothers who live with him. His studies were interrupted in 5th grade, due to financial constraints, which forced him to work and support himself from an early age. Estêvão owns a store in the commercial part of town, where he sells home appliances and electronics (in particular sound systems). His monthly income is of 15,000,00mt, which allows him to save 1500,00 mt. He plans to use this loan, his first with Kluvuku and Kiva, to increase inventory and make physical improvements to the store. Estêvão appears in the photo with the contractor who is working on the space.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances and electronics to sell at his store

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru:
Точинисо женщина - косметолог в городе Худжанде, которая имеет большой опыт по предоставлению косметологических услуг.Она каждый свой займ использует для увеличения своего бизнеса , продажи различных парфюмерных средств.У неё имеется витрина , где она рекламирует продукцию парфюмерных товаров.
 Точинисо начале имела возможность только предоставление услуг косметолога, а на сегодня она уже стала иметь дополнительный доход с реализации парфюмерной продукции.
texts.en:
Tojiniso lives in Khujand. She is an experienced cosmetologist. Tojiniso took her earlier loans to expand her cosmetology salon business. With the money she borrowed, Tojiniso added a product display in the window of her salon. Today, Tojiniso earns additional income by selling perfumes and cosmetics in addition to providing cosmetology services.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store inventory (cosmetics)

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Naimchon

texts.ru: Наимчон - мужчина 32 года. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Он работает уличным фотографом по городу Чкаловску. Его жена работает учительницей в средней школы города Чкаловска. Она учитель математики 5-6-х классов. Наимчон ездит в разные организации и учреждения и предлагает свои услуги. Он ездит в профилактории и фотографирует отдыхающих там людей. Фотографии он распечатывает в частной студии и приносит своим клиентам. Он кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Наимчон планирует открыть свою собственную  студию.
texts.en:
Naimchon is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. He works as a street photographer in the city of Chkalovsk. His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school in Chkalovsk. She teaches 5th and 6th grade math. Naimchon travels to different organizations and companies and offers his photography services. He also travels to resorts and takes photos of people vacationing there. He prints his photographs at a private studio and delivers them to his clients. Naimchon has been receiving credit at our organization for 1 year. He plans to open his own studio.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Opening a photography studio

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гульсара женщина , которая занимается продажей мужской одежды.Она привозит товар с Бишкека каждый месяц.Гульсара пунктуально погашает свои кредиты.Каждый свой займ она использует для завоза сезонного ассортимента товаров. Она торгует на рынке города Чкаловска на видном месте.У неё хороший поток клиентов, потому что товар разнообразный.За время кредитования у неё оборотный капитал заметно увеличился.
texts.en:
Gulsara is involved in the sales of men’s clothing. She brings the goods from Bishkek every month. Gulsara timely repays her loans. She uses every loan to bring seasonal goods assortment. She sells at a market in the city of Chkalovsk, in a prime location. Gulsara has a good consistent clientele because she has a variety of goods. Since Gulsara started borrowing, her working capital noticeably increased.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of men's clothing

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
Fatuma Z., 34, is married with two children, ages 17 and 5. She has had a food business for six years. She works daily from 5 a.m. until 4 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $148.

This will be Fatum’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She wants to use this loan to increase capital and buy a big stock of food.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Puma, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is first on the right, with a head covering of white material.

loans.use: To increase capital and buy a good stock of food

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.ru: Хуринисо-кредитор в фонде с 2003 года.Она занимается бизнесом продажи мужского товара, обуви и одежды. Она привозит товар в Бишкека и Истаравшана, но с сезоном ей не хватает весеннего ассортимента.Поэтому Хуринисо хочет на следующий кредит закупить весенний ассортимент товара.Хуринисо за время кредитной истории ни разу не нарушила политику фонда.Микроинвест рад предоставлять кредит таким клиентам, как Хуринисо. Потому что она целенаправлено использует каждый свой кредит.
texts.en:
Huriniso is a customer of this fund since 2003. She has a business of selling mens wear, shoes and clothing. She brings the merchandise from Bishkek and Istaravshan, but this season she does not have enough of spring assortment. This is why Huriniso wants to use her next loan to buy a spring collection of clothing. Huriniso has never broken any loan term policy during her crediting history. MicroInvest is very happy to present loans to such customers and Huriniso. She is purposefully using every one of her loans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a spring assortment of goods

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel S. manages a small air conditioning shop. She is 35 years old and has 4 children. She has workers who repair damage to the air conditioning units. This is her only source of income since her husband abandoned her.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy new tool kits for her shop. The loan will help Hazel continue her business. She is also interested in starting another line of business to supplement her income. 

CEVI provides her the loan that she needs to run her business. She also receives trainings and insurance coverage services from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy new tool kits for her air conditioning shop

loans.name: Rona Group

texts.en:
Rona is the group leader of the Rona group. There are four members in this group. Each member of the group has a business that will benefit from this loan. The money will be used to purchase materials for these local businesses.

Rona's loan will provide necessary materials for her business of carpet weaving. Shapaeray wants a loan for her business of carpet weaving. Nasema and Gull Shan want to take loans for their business of bead-working.

They are all very happy with this opportunity to borrow money in Afghanistan. With this loan, they can collectively expand their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn thị (20201050010) is a 39 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a 3-member group L. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn 1 - 02 (2).


L. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 - 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 2.006.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new L. of 3.894.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The L. will be the 4th L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20201050012) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 3.894.000 VND L. to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


2.  Đặng Thị B. (20201050015) is a 46 year-old female who is requesting a 3.186.000 VND L. to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nguyễn thị (20201050010) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phú Mẫn 1 - 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 - 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.894.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị N. (20201050012) là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.894.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


2.  Đặng Thị B. (20201050015) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.186.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been a tomatoes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Nuru Njema group loan (Group code 2026). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day, she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mary is 37 years old, married, and has a 14-year-old child. She also cares for two additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale, to expand her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda Torrejos is a pig grower. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She was a Brgy. treasurer before. Now, she raises pigs to earn a living for her family. Aside from pigs, she also sells coconut wine. Coconut wine, "Tuba" as it fondly called, is very popular in the Philippines.

Merlinda would like to have a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She has been a client for a long time already and she wishes to grow her business by obtaining another loan.

CEVI helps her sustain her business. Merlinda receives not just loans from CEVI, but also receives training and insurance coverage to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru: Саиднисо женщина , которая кредитуется с 2007 года.Сначала своего бизнеса у Саиднисо оборотный капитал составлял не большую сумму.А на сегодня его оборотный капитал увеличился в несколько раз.Это вывод того, что она использует кредит на расширение своего бизнеса.Саиднисо  живёт в городе Чкаловске, и торгует также на рынке города Чкаловска.Привозит товар с Бишкека сама два раза в месяц.Параллельно с улучшением её бизнеса у неё улучшилось семейное состояние.Муж работает на заводе специалистом- механиком, но его заработная плата не хватает на полное хорошее проживание.Поэтому в помощь ему Саиднисо каждый день сидит и торгует на рынке.
texts.en:
Saidniso is a woman who has been a borrower since 2007. When she started her business her working capital was not large. Today, her working capital has increased several times over. This is the result of her using credit to grow her business. Saidniso lives in Chkalovsk and sells at the Chkalovsk market. She brings her products from Bishkek herself twice a month. In parallel to improvements in her business her family situation has improved. Her husband works at a factory as a specialist-mechanic, but his salary is not enough for a full, good lifestyle. This is why Saidniso helps him by sitting and selling everyday at the market.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Sieb

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 28 years old and married, with two minor children who are enrolled in school. For the past eight years, she has been sewing clothes for her neighbors. In the business, she sews kinds of clothes like modern and traditional clothes and those made from silk.

As another source of family income, her husband makes a daily revenue by selling oxen. He usually goes to buy oxen from faraway places to fatten them at his home and later re-sell them to gain income.

Due to the family's hope to improve their businesses, C. and her husband have decided to seek a US$ 1000 loan to buy tailoring materials and more oxen for fattening.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials and more oxen to fatten

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.ru: Обидчон - мужчина 39 лет, который уже четвёртый год кредитуется в Микроинвест.Он закупает в Бишкеке товар и продаёт на рынках города Худжанда.В основном его товар состоит и товаров из меха и кожи, но т.к. сейчас не сезон этих товаров, он хочет пополнить весенний ассортимент мужской одежды.У него пока маловато весеннего ассортимента сорочек.Обидчону во время его отсутствия помогает торговать его жена, которая благодарна инвесторам за финансирование и доверие.
texts.en:
Obidjon is a 39-year-old man, who has been a loan customer of MicroInvest for four years. He buys goods in Bishkek and sells them in the Khujand city markets. Generally he carries fur and leather products, but since it is not the season for such goods, he wants to expand his assortment of men's clothing for spring. At present he does not have enough men's shirts. When Obidjon is away, his wife takes over the selling, and she is grateful to the investors for their trust and funding.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of leather jackets and men's clothing

loans.name: Bennah's Group

texts.en: A. Bennah is the leader of Luwayo group in Lugazi, where she has been a member for 9 years. She is one of the founding members of the group, with 8 years experience in her local brew making business. Her first loan was 50,000 shillings which she was able to invest in her current business to the extent that now it has grown to a profitable level. Bennah is a married mother with 1 child still in school as she cares for 3 dependents. Her success story is so much related to her continued hard work and good character. She still has a dream of expanding her business and also to be able to own a personal house. She has acquired a new plot of land and plans to have construction started on it. Bennah needs a new loan to be able to buy more materials for making her local brew.

loans.use: Buying more bananas and yeast for making local brew.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru: Башорат, женщина , которая живёт и торгует в Худжанде.Она привозит товар с Бишкека и Ташкента.У неё большой разнообразный ассортимент плащей и костюмов.У неё много клиентов оптовиков , которые покупают у неё и продают на рынках районов.Также Башорат продаёт товары сшитые частными портнихами на дому.Поэтому у неё есть стабильная торговля.Для увеличения весеннего ассортимента костюмов Башорат подала очередную заявку на кредит.
texts.en:
Bashorat is a woman who lives and sells in Khujand. She brings the merchandise from Bishkek and Tashkent. She has a large assortment of overcoats and suits. She has many wholesale customers who buy from her and resell on the markets of other regions. Bashorat also sells goods made by local seamstresses at home. This is why she has steady sales. To increase the spring assortment of suits Bashorat has applied for another loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a spring assortment of goods

loans.name: Akutwala Ekiko Group

texts.en: Florence is a wholesale fish seller. She travels to Bbaale, a landing port for fishermen, and buys large amounts of fresh fish. She then packs them into her fish truck and transports them to Bwaise, where she sells to her customers at wholesale prices. When Florence is busy with other things her brother runs her business. Florence has 8 children.  Three of them are still in school and she is able to pay all of their school fees from the profits from her fish business.  Florence is married to a farmer. The farm that her husband works is so large that he is able to employ some people from the community. Florence would like to buy an additional transport vehicle some day because her customer base is now exceeding the amount that she can supply with her currently vehicle.  Now Florence is requesting a loan of 6 million USH to buy fresh fish from Bbaale.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary N. is one of the executive members of the Luwayo group in Lugazi. She has been in the group for 5 years and has a retail shop business with 7 years experience. She is a single mother with a family of six children and 1 dependent, of which 2 are still in secondary school.  Before she started the shop, she was a farmer that sold bananas (matooke), and waragi (local brew) from which she got her start up capital to open up a retail shop. As a result, she has been able to construct a house of her own and some of her children have completed school. She has been able to achieve this because she is patient, persistent and has an pleasant character to others and her customers. She needs a loan to help with restocking her shop with more goods.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, bread, etc. for her shop's expansion.

loans.name: Ganiyu

texts.en:
Ganiyu is 50 years old and married with five children. She sells bags of yam flour.

She is requesting for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more bags of yam flour to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more  bags of yam flour to sell

loans.name: Godfrey's Group

texts.en:
G. Godfrey is the leader of Luwayo sub group in Lugazi. He has a retail shop business that has been able to expand as a result of injecting money from loans every now and then. He has five children that he has been able to pay school fees for, as he gets profits from his shop sales. He has also bought three cows out of his profits and hard work and these are now giving him milk for sale. Godfrey has also benefited from joining his lending group by being able to save and increase his savings time and again.

Godfrey needs another loan to be able to buy more shop products, so as to have more sales.

loans.use: To buy more more stock for his shop

loans.name: Phong

texts.en: Phòng Thị Ngô was born in 1965 ( no: 010105040021). Her main job is farming and in addition she is also a shift worker. She has a income daily of about 60.000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,436.000 VND ( or 140 usd) over a six month period to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм мужчина 31 года, работает механиком по ремонту автомашин.проживает в городе Костакоз.
