Кроме своей работы он имеет дополнительный доход с откорма и продажи скота.Также у него небольшой земельный участок с которого он получает урожай капусты и болгарского перца.Его жена занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев.Абдукаюм узнав , что можно в кредит увеличить бизнес животноводства, решил подать заявку.Сейчас у него две коровы и 8 баранов.
texts.en:
Abdukayum is a 31 year old man. He works as an auto mechanic and lives in Kostakoz. In addition to his job he earns additional income from fattening and selling livestock. He also has a small plot of land from which he gets a harvest of cabbage and Bulgarian peppers. His wife sews traditional women’s dresses. Abdukayum having found out that he could grow his livestock business via credit, decided to apply. Currently he has two cows and 8 sheep.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and sale of livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Sokyoeurn Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 19 members, is located in Chhea Teal village in the Kandal province. They plan to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sokyoeurn C. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She sells fish and is also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to breed to earn more income.

Her husband, Mr. Deap Saret, is a musician who is hired by people to play during wedding ceremonies, parties and so on. Mrs. Sokyoeurn C. is a 29-year-old mother of two children who are too yoU. to work or study. Mrs. S. Vannak, who is a group guarantee, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

Seven members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Чураев Шавкат- мужчина 32 лет. У него есть жена и трое детей. Шавкат начaл работать  самостоятельно с 18 лет. Он каждый год на заработки ездил в Россию из за финансового кризиса в этом году он не поехал. Он узнал о нашей программе кредитования у соседей и решил попробовать,  он очень доволен нашими условиями. Шавкату помогает отец и жена. Свой скот Шавкат реализует у мясников. Также жена продает молоко соседям. Шавкат очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
Shavkat J. is a 32 year old man. He has a wife and three children. Shavkat started to work independently when he was 18 years old. He traveled every year to earn money in Russia, because of the financial crisis this year he did not go. He found out about our credit program from neighbors and decided to try it, he is very happy with our terms. Shavkat’s father and wife help him. Shavkat sells his livestock to butchers. Also his wife sells milk to neighbors. Shavkat is very grateful to our organization and would like to develop further.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding livestock

loans.name: Sotiboldi

texts.ru: Сотиболди мужчина 55 лет , женат имеет семерых детей.Работает в колхозе по поливу земли.Сотиболди мужчина , который с молодости занимается уходом за скотом.Сотиболди по откорму помогают его сыновья, которые снабжают его скот кормом.Жена Сотиболди работает техничкой в школе Сомгара.Её заработная плата хватает лишь на оплату коммунальных расходов.Поэтому весь груз семейной жизни на плечах Сотиболди и его двух старших сыновей. для увеличения бизнеса животноводства Сотиболди хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Sotiboldi is a 55 year old man, married and has seven children. He works in a collective farm as a land aerator. Sotibildi has been taking care of cattle since youth. Sotiboldi's sons help him feed the cattle and supply the fodder. His wife works as a technician in the school of Somgor town. Her salary is enough only to cover the bills. This is why the weight of family life is laid on Sotiboldi's shoulders and his two older sons. Sotiboldi wants to get a loan to increase his animal husbandry business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1959. ( no:010105050020) She lives with her husband and 2 children. Her main job is farming. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. Daily, she buys eggs from other farmers in the surrounding villages to resell at the market. She wants to borrow 2,436,000 VND ( or 137 USD ) to increase her operating funds for her business. There are 4 fund participants in her group.

Thành Thị Phạm was born in 1954. (no:010105050023) She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy bamboo to make brooms.

Thụy Thị Nguyễn was born in 1974. (no:010105050022). She wants to borrow 1,090,000 VND ( or 65 USD ) to breed pigs and poultry. 

Minh Thị Tuyết C. was born in 1977. (no:010105050025). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 235 USD) to start a small business.

loans.use: to have more money for her business

loans.name: Jowena

texts.en:
Jowena C. is a farmer. Her main crop is rice. She sells most of her harvest to the village to earn a living for her family. She also reserved some of her harvest for family consumption. She is 31 years old and has no children yet. In addition to rice farming, she raises pigs to supplement her income.

She wants to avail a loan from CEVI. ( First Filipno MFI partner to go active in KIVA microfunds). She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will be a great help to her family farm to increase their yield.

Based on research, Philippines has land area of 30 million hectares, 47% or 13 million hectares of which are use for agriculture. CEVI is reaching more farmers to sustain their livelihood. It not only provides loans, but also gives training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm necessities

loans.name: Mrs. Surn Oum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people living in Kab Leav village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Surn O. is a forty-one-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Ros Torn, is a commune chief who has a small salary. This couple has three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Surn O. is requesting a loan to buy a bicycle for her children drive to work.  

Fifteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for her children drive to work.

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Абдумалик -мужчина ему 56 лет. Женат отец 6-х детей. Занимается купле-продажей скота.Ему этом деле помогают жена и дети. Старший и средний сын находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации и они помогают родителям. Наступление весны для Абдумалика-это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево.Скот у пастухов. Второй год как Абдумалик сотрудничает с нами и он очень благодарен.
texts.en:
Abdumalik is a 56 year old man, married and is a father of six children. He buys and sells cattle. His wife and children are helping him in this business. His older and middle sons are now working in the Russian Federation and are helping their parents. The arrival of the spring is the season for buying cattle for Abdumalik because at this time cattle costs cheaper. The shepherds have the cattle. This is Abdumalik's second year working with us and he is very grateful.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is 48 years old, married, and has eleven children. They live in the town of Sto. Niño, Pagadian, Zamboanga Del Sur. She started her business 3 years ago with the help of her daughter when she bought three computers.

And now she has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 for the maintenance of their business. At present, her business is still growing and, because of that, she would like to buy more computers to gain more income from her business.

She has a vision of having a concrete house someday and another vision for the future of her children finishing their studies.

loans.use: To buy more computers for her business

loans.name: 40 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hường T. Thị (277) is a 42 year-old woman living in the town of Phường, Thanh Hoa province, Viet Nam. Hường is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 40 Nam Ngạn (17.02.40).

Hường is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hường owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. Hường has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hường is requesting, for the first time, a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 1.626.900 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by this borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị H. Nguyên (272) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  B. Thị H. Tươi (275) is a 23 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

3.  Ngô Thị Hương (276) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Lê Thị Thanh (278) is a 47 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Ngô Thị Tự (279) is a 55 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  Đỗ Thị Phương (280) is a 44 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Fishing nets

loans.name: Annete

texts.en:
Annette P. operates a small piggery business. She started her business last 2004. Currently, she has 3 pigs and a sow, which she raises at the back of her house. She used to be a vegetable vendor but stop selling vegetables because of low sales. "Having a piggery is much better business", she said. "Meat is constantly in-demand in the market and expensive. I have been raising pigs for 5 years already", she added.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed and additional piglets. The loan will help considerably with increasing the size of her business and meeting family needs..

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI provides loans, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Maritina's Group

texts.en: L. Maritina is the leader of the Bakusekamajja loan group in Jinja. She is married with four children and 8 dependent children that she cares for. Maritina has a bar where she sells local brew like malwa and waragi. She also makes her own brews for sale. Maritina also sells dried fish from her home. By operating both businesses, she has been able to pay school fees for her children with ease, as well buy necessary household items. Having repaid her loan over 4 months, Maritina again needs another loan to be able to buy more materials for making malwa, more supplies of dry fish for her stall and more sodas and beers for her bar.

loans.use: Buying more malwa materials like yeast and bananas, dry fish for resale and more sodas and beers for the bar.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion S. is a woman who hails from Hamtic, Antique. She is a 38 year old mother to an 18 year old son. She is married to Leoterio S., who is a farmer.

Before, Salvacion was engaged in poultry, hog raising and general store businesses. But since she has a rice field to cultivate, they decided to give priority to farming. Now, she proposes to use her next loan to buy one head of carabao to be used for plowing the farm.

She is positive that their business will succeed and will provide proceeds for bigger investments and for her family's needs. Education of her son is her greatest dream, and she hopes to send her son to college so that he will be able to find a job. She dreams of building a more secure and durable house.

loans.use: To buy one head of carabao to be used in farming.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mr. Sambath Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Chher Teal village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sambath B. is the 40 year old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and this is badly affecting his crop. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and he will use the rest of the loan to purchase fuel to pump water to support the field and make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Keo Phanith, is a housewife who is a good cooker and a good mother. Mr. Sambath B. has seven children, one of whom is a construction worker, while another two are waiters in the restaurant, three others are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.    

Five members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and purchase fuel to pump water.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita O. owns a small rice field. She is 47 years old and has three children. Her husband is the one managing their farm. Most of their harvest is sold to the market; some is intended for family use. Presently, Clarita is the CEVI-cluster treasurer in their village. She has already been a client for almost three years.

Clarita is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. She is also interested in looking for other possible income areas to supplement their income.

CEVI helps people start and have their own business. Like Clarita, all CEVI clients receive not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mrs. Sareourn Saoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sareourn Saoem is a 38 year old village bank president. She owns a small business as a vegetable middlewoman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell and earn more profit to support her family. Mrs. Sareourn Saoem is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local school. 

One member in this group loan is an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо Мамурова 1976 года роджения замужем,  имеет 3 детей.  Она работает учителем математики в средней школе . По совместительству торгует детскими вещами на рынках разных регионах. Она ездит за товаром за пределы страны и по мере возможности отвозит по регионам для продаж. На рынке она почти 11 лет. В Микроинвест обратилась для  расширения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Marhabo M. was born in 1976, is married with 3 children. She works as a mathematics teacher in middle school. In addition to this she sells children's clothing in various regional market places. Marhabo travels out of the country to get her goods and then travels around the region selling them. She has been doing this for almost 11 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Mr. Moung Thee Group

texts.en: Mr. Moung T. is a group leader of four members who all live in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. He is a construction worker who only earns a small salary. His wife, Mrs. Oun Thy, is a housewife and now she wants to start a small business to earn more income for her family. Thus, Mr. Moung T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fruit for his wife to start a new business. He hopes to increase their income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. He is a 59 year old father of four children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fruit for his wife to start a new business.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mr. Srey R., age 43, has lived with his five family members for years in a medium-size wooden house along the village road of the province of Siem Reap. Mr. R. currently makes his daily income by buying and selling piglets. He normally buys the pigs from farmers who live in the rural area. He uses his motor to transport them to the customer's house. To meet the family's foods needs, his wife makes skewers for sale.

They have been married for years and blessed with four single children who help them in the business of making skewers. Mr. R.'s pigs are commanding better prices that make it easier for them to gain more income. Mr. R. would like a loan to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора - молодая женщина 33 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. Но она не работает по своей специальности, потому что у учителей очень маленькая зар.плата. Чтобы хорошо обеспечить своих детей и обучать их в хорошей школе Гулнора старается работать и зарабатывать больше денег. Она занимается продажей женской обуви в торговом центре "Бадри Мунир" города Худжанда, а по пятницам выходит на рынок "Джума-базар". Гулнора закупает товар из города Бишкек Республики Киргизия. Гулнора кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. За это время она расширила свой ассортимент. За новый займ Гулнора хочет закупить новую партию летнего товара.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a young, 33-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She has a higher teacher education. However, she does not work in her profession because teachers receive very little pay. In order to better provide for her children and educate them at a good school, Gulnora tries to work more and make more money. She is involved in women’s shoe sales at the “Badri Munir” shopping center in the city of Khujand and at the “Djuma-bazar” market on Fridays. Gulnora buys her goods in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic. Gulnora has been a borrower at our organization for 1 year. During this time, she expanded her goods assortment. Gulnora wants to use the new loan to purchase summer assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase summer goods assortment

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn G. has been managing a small rice farm for 19 years. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She married her childhood friend, Ronald G.. They have been together for 20 years already. In addition to farming rice, Annelyn supplements their income by selling food in the school canteen. By grace from God, she was able to support the needs of her family, especially in managing the budget for her children's school and books.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. Fertilizer is important to improve soil condition of her farm. The loan will help her and the whole family increase their yield.

CEVI is reaching out to farmers like Annelyn to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm necessities.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité le commerce de chaussures, elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1989 ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce commerce, elle fait son activité au grand marché de Lomé. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock et souhaite se réapprovisionner. Elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter son premier crédit afin d’acheter 132 paires de chaussures. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady sells shoes. She began this business in 1989 so she is very knowledgeable. She makes her sales in the big market of Lomé. She is presently out of shoes and wants to replenish her stocks. She has come to WAGES to request her first loan so as to buy 132 pairs of shoes. She is married and the mother of 4 children. With the income from her business, she helps her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Mrs. Hon Soam Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of eighteen members, is located in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province and they plA. to use the loA. which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Hon S. is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5 hectares of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest the rice. Thus, she decided to ask for a loA. for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Rath Chhin, is a construction worker. Mrs. Hon S. is a 49 year old mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers, while the other three are employed in a garment factory, and the remaining one attends the local school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest rice.

loans.name: Saniya's Group

texts.en:
Saniya N. is the leader of the Kisakye group in Mpunge. She is a married lady with a farming business. She grows food crops for sale. She grows matooke, beans, cassava, egg plants, green pepper, and so on and sells her crops to traders in Lugazi, Jinja, and sometimes in Kampala.

The group is taking its 24th loan and it is grateful that the loans have been helping them so much. Saniya dreams of owning a stall in all the markets to which she supplies so that she can sell like a retailer and a wholesaler. But finding a stall is not something you will wake up and achieve. She again needs a new loan to be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops to grown high quality yields.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe E. is a mother to four children. She is married to Jose E., who is a rickshaw driver and also a farmer. Her eldest son, Jose, is a graduate of Hotel and Restaurant Management. The youngest is an 18 year old high school graduate.

Fe's life has not been easy. She ventured in different businesses like growing corn and backyard poultry. Now, they realize there is demand for firewood for students and at the market. In her loan application she proposes to use the loan for additional capital to buy firewood and rice for retail sales.

She is hopeful that these businesses will grow and will bring them back enough proceeds for sustainability, and can support their family's needs. In the future, she is looking forward to selling her products in other markets in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy firewood and rice for retail sales.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Mrs. Ky S. is a villager in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Phan Cheav, is a cow middleman. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Ky S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more cows for her husband’s business. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's life. She is 40 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more cows for her husband’s business.

loans.name: Buston

texts.ru: Бустон  Набиева 1961 года рождения, замужем имеет 1 ребенка. Высшего образования не имеет. После замужества долгое время сидела дома. Вскоре начала торговать мелочами на рынке находящейся не далеко от дома.Сейчас торгует пластиковыми пакетами на большом рынке. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2002 года. За это время улучшила своё  состояние. Она торгует на улице не смотря на холод и палящее солнце. Благодаря поддержки со стороны КИВА и Микроинвест она расширила свой оборот от розничных до оптового базара.
texts.en:
Born in 1961, Buston N. is married and has 1 child. She does not have a higher education. After her she married, she spent a lot of time at home. Then, she started selling small things at a market not too far from her home. Now Buston sells plastic packages at a large market. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2002 and has been able to improve her state of being since then. Thanks to the support from Kiva and MicroInvest, Buston was able to increase her turnover from both retail and wholesale markets.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding assortment

loans.name: Rohila

texts.ru: Рохила – женщина 50 лет. Вдова и мать 4-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Так как ее муж умер, она растит 4-х детей в одиночку и конечно же ей очень трудно. Рохила откармливает скот а сын продает их на рынке. Рохила хотела, бы увеличить количество своего скота для своих сыновей. Для этого она предпочла взять займ.
texts.en:
Rohila is a 50-year-old woman. She is a widow and a mother of 4 children. She has a higher education. Rohila is involved in raising and selling livestock. Because her husband passed away, she raises her 4 children by herself, which is, of course, very difficult. Rohila feeds the livestock, and her son sells it at a market. Rohila wants to increase her livestock headcount for her sons. For this, she decided to obtain a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Mrs. Saron T. lives in Ro Teang village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Eang Chheang, are farmers who own a plot of land where they grow vegetables to earn a living. They are facing some problems with their cultivation, because they do not have enough money to buy vegetable seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Saron T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 57 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others stay at home to help with the housework and help with their parents' work. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field.

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en: Mr. Saroen S. is 29 years old and he now lives in Krasang village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Sorn Thary, is a tailor in her house. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still can't earn enough income to build a suitable house for their family. Thus, Mr. Saroen S. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to buy timber to build the house. He has two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy timber to build a house.

loans.name: Ergashali

texts.ru: Эргашали - мужчина средних лет (43 лет), женат и отец 4-х детей. У Эргашали есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 45 овец и 15 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Эргашали каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. Эргашали за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Эргашали очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Ergashali is a middle aged man (43 years old), he is married and is the father of 4 children. Ergashali has a flock of small livestock composed of around 45 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a homemaker and in her free time she processes wool and knits a variety of warm clothing. She sells this clothing to neighbors and relatives. Ergashali every morning takes his flock out to the mountains, tends to it and in the evening brings it back. Ergashali would like to use this new loan to purchase two medium-sized bulls. After fattening them for 3-4 months he will be able to resell them for a very good price. Ergashali is very happy to work with us, because the credit helps him very much.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and sale of livestock

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Mr. Yong Y. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. He is a cow middleman. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more cows for his business. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's lifestyle. His wife, Mrs. Some Sory, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where she cultivates rice. Mr. Yong Y. is a 35 year old father of two children who are three years old and one month old. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more cows for current business.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба Усмонова 1976 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Матлуба имеет среднее образование. После распада Союза осталась без работы. Торгует на рынке 4 года продуктами питанием. От сюда приобретая товар ездит в Душанбе для продажи. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2006 года. До сих пор  получает  кредит и во время погашает. Благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Matluba U. was born in 1976, she is married and has 2 children. Matluba has a high school education. After the fall of the Soviet Union she was left without a job. She has been selling food products at the market for 4 years. She purchases her products here and travels to Dushanbe to sell them. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2006. Until now she has taken out credit and paid it back on time. She is grateful to KIVA for its support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Ruth Saana's Group

texts.en:
Ruth Saana N. is the leader of the Nezikokolima Kitega group. She is a tailor with a tailoring business in Kitega. Ruth makes clothes of all kinds, mostly making ladies and children's clothing for sale. She also sells clothing material from her business.

How Ruth’s business operates is that she buys materials from Kampala and brings them to her business in Kitega Some customers come and choose which ones to sew for them, while others come with their own materials for the same sewing.

This is her third loan with the group and she has been able to rise from 300,000 shillings to a million now. She is seeing the change in her business because now she has more clothes for sale, more customers, and more profits. She needs a new loan to buy more clothes and threads for sale. Ruth dreams of having many sewing machines and employing other people and, in the end, forming a sewing and tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and threads for sewing.

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: Ахмадова Ситора проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 26 лет. Замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Кроме ее семьи с ними живут родители мужа . Семья большая , обеспечивает семью только один муж. Поэтому Ситора решила  купить корову , которая будет давать молоко. Получаемое молоко сможет продавать соседям. Кроме этого она сможет обеспечить семью свежим молоком. Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит , поэтому она и обратилась к нам.
texts.en:
Sitora A. lives in Rudaky. She is 26, married, and has one child. Sitora's family lives together with her in-laws. The family is large, but only Sitora's husband is currently able to support it. This loan Sitora will use to buy a milk cow, so she can provide fresh milk to her family and sell the rest to her neighbors.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn T. is 50 years old and she lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a widow with nine children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are cow middlemen and the remaining are attending the local school.

Mrs. Morn T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She is applying for a loan to buy more cows to expand her children’s business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Mrs. Uy R. is 45 years old, married, and blessed with five childR.. Four of Mrs. R.'s childR. are single and the other one is married. Three of her single childR. are employed, working in different jobs. Mrs. R.'s husband, Mr. Pay, is 50 years old and works as a community consultant adviser and as a local farmer as well.

Presently, Mrs. R. raises animals for sale in a stall behind her house. Besides her work, she is also the best housewife. She cooks tasty meals for the family and cares for the childR.. Mrs. R. will use the loan for the business operations, to buy piglets to raise and to pay for plowing farmland. The family lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and to pay for plowing farmland.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok L. lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Toeur Orn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. This couple has four children, one of whom is a policeman while another is a grocer and the remaining two are enrolled in the local school.

Although Mrs. Sok L. family’s members have different careers, they still earn insufficient income to support their living. Thus, Mrs. Sok L. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to start a cow-breeding business to earn more income. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a cow breeding business to earn more income

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina B. is a food vendor. She is 43 years old and the hard working mother of five children. She works very hard to support her children in paying for school tuition, books and other fees.

She started her business when she was 23. Since then, she has had her small food business from which she gets the money to pay their daily needs. She earns a reasonable profit from selling food.

Divina is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy food items like vegetables and meat. The loan will help a lot in growing her business, especially because she plans to have a food stall.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to enable them to have their own livelihood. CEVI gives access to those who don't have access to start a business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items for her business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Ms. Angela N. is from Purok Sandayong, Sto. Niño, Pagadian, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is a widow with 2 kids. Having started her sari-sari (variety) store business from a very small capital, she is coping well with the challenges of her business. The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand to gain more income.

She joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to access a loan. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to further capitalize her business. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future. She also dreams of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of her children.

loans.use: to expand her little variety store

location.town: Purok Sandayong, Sto. Niño, Pagadian City

loans.name: Abdudjabor

texts.ru: Сохибназаров Абдуджабор проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает в бизнесе . Торгует мясом на центральном рынке. Покупает бычков , сам режет и реализует жителям района.Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, то есть купить бычка для продажи на мясо.
texts.en:
Abdudjabor S. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He is an entrepreneur and sells meat at the central market. He buys cattle, cuts it himself and sells the meat to the residents of the district. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Abdudjabor plans to obtain this loan to increase turnover by buying an additional bull to sell for meat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme A. Afi est née le 31/12/1973 à Tsévié. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de riz préparée grâce à laquelle elle subvient aux besoins de la famille. Afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du riz en vue de satisfaire régulièrement sa clientèle et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afi A. was born on December 31, 1973 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her principal business is selling cooked rice, which allows her to cover family expenses. So as to increase her turnover, she is requesting a loan to stock up on rice which will allow her to regularly satisfy the needs of her clientele and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of cooked rice

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом – мужчина 48 лет. Женат. Отец 5-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Жена – домохозяйка. Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает. Рынок находится далеко от его дома, поэтому он должен нанимать машину, чтобы довезти скот до рынка. Пока у Гулом нет машины. Но он надеется, что когда у него будет большой товарооборот и большая прибыль, он купит себе машину. Он надеется что кредит ему поможет в достижении его цели.
texts.en:
Gulom P. is 48 years old and is a father of 5 children. He has a university degree. He makes a living by buying and selling livestock. His wife is a housewife. Gulom buys livestock, feeds it for 2-3 months to fatten it up and then sells the animals. The market where he sells the livestock is far from his home and so he has to rent a vehicle to transport the animals there. Gulom wants to have his own vehicle. He is asking for a loan to expand his sales so as to increase profits, to help him get closer to his goal of owning a vehicle for transporting his livestock to market.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock sales

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Гозиев Анвар житель района Рудаки. Возраст 56 лет, женат и имеет пятеро детей. Работает вместе со своей женой. Торгуют на рынке овощами и фруктами. Обратился к нам за кредитом. Деньги хочет использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Таким образом он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара и провлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Anvar G. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 56 years old, married and has five children. He works with his wife. They sell vegetables and fruits at a market. He reached out to us for a loan. Anvar wants to use the money in order to increase his product turnover. He can, consequently, increase his goods assortment and attract new clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a new motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Гозиев Диловар проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 24 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Женился совсем недавно. Работает на рынке. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Товар скупает у дехкан по низким ценам , а затем продает на рынке по выгодной ему цене.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погашать  кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilovar G. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 24 years old, married and does not have children. He got married very recently. Dilovar works at a market, selling vegetables and fruits. He buys his products from dehkan farmers at low prices and then sells them at the market at more profitable prices. Dilovar plans to obtain this loan in order to increase his product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.en:
A. Abdujalil has always been hard-working man, who has made sure, from his young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with 4 children.

Abdujalil has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. With a starting capital of 500 USD, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Abdujalil began this enterprise 5 years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today this business has become a family business with his whole family engaged in this business.

Today Abdujalil needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1950 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Tausi's Group

texts.en:
N. Tausi is the chairperson of the Bugolo Zibulatudde Group in Kikondo, Lugazi. She is 43 years old, married with six children, and also cares for two more kids, all in school. She is a business lady with a business selling fish (mukene) for a living. She buys the fish from fishermen at a wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices.

She has successfully completed the repayment of her previous loan and with this new loan, she intends to buy more small fish for sale to her ever-increasing customers. Her customers are in and around Lugazi district and she intends to look for additional customers as long as she can.

loans.use: Buying more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kwami

texts.fr: Né le 18/03/1973 à Tsévié dans la Préfecture de Zio, Mr K. Kwami est soudeur de formation. Il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de portes en tole. Il sollicite un financement pour ouvrir un atelier de soudure. Le bénéfice tiré de cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de veiller à l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Born on March 18, 1973 in Tsévié in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Kwami K. is a licenced welder. He is specialized in making corrugated iron doors. He is requesting a loan to open a welding workshop. The profit from this business will allow him to improve his living conditions and assure the education of his child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a welding workshop

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Life is what we make it! That’s what Felma R. says. No matter what we want, we have to work for it! Everything she does is for the sake of her family. She is 33 years old, married and lives at Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a baker, receiving only a monthly salary of PHP 3,000. She really must find ways to earn a living. She has been engaged in different economic activities such as snack vending, buying and selling goods, and even hog raising . As of today, she has also ventured into “copra buying” (whole coconut fruit). 

The copra-buying business is doing very well right now; she earns more than she expected. She also maximized her presence in the market and invested in buying and selling other stuff. Both then and now, Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative supported Felma. She applied for a loan of PHP 50,000. The amount will be used to buy additional coconuts and feed for her pigs and other merchandise.

She aims to own a piggery someday and a store for copra buying in the heart of the municipality or near the public market. She also hopes that all her children will finish their studies and have successful careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra-buying and feed for pig raising

loans.name: Tulkun

texts.ru: Тулкуну 42 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Тулкун занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Тулкуна – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Тулкун экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Тулкун продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Tulkun is 42 years old. He is married and is a father of three children. His wife does not work anywhere. She stays at home and does housework and feeds the cattle. Tulkun raises and sells cattle. With the arrival of spring for Tulkun it's the season of buying cattle because the price is low during this time. It's not expensive to feed the cattle. It eats mountain grass and Tulkun saves on the fodder. With the arrival of autumn Tulkun sells part of the fed cattle, but he does not buy any. He buys fodder for feeding of the remaining cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Mehriddin

texts.ru: Назаров Мехриддин проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей.Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того имеет продуктовый магазин.Магазин собственный , находится в кишлаке , где он и проживает. в среднем в месяц магазин приносит 1000 сомони. В данный момент для развития бизнеса планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Это привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Mehriddin N. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 49 years old, married and has five children. He works as a teacher at a secondary school. Besides this work, he owns a food market. His market is located in a village where he lives and brings in an average monthly income of 1000 somoni. Currently, Mehriddin plans to obtain a loan and expand his merchandise assortment. This will allow him to attract new clients and result in an additional income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
H. Ahmad is 44 years old and is married with two children. He runs a jewelry shop and has been in this business already for 12 years. Ahmad produces jewelry like earrings and silver and gold rings. As a rule, he purchases the input materials from the general public.

So that Ahmad is able to purchase the input materials, like fragments, precious and semi-precious stones, and reagents for producing the jewelry, he requests a loan of $2000. Ahmad is a repeated client of IMON with a positive credit history, and he promises to pay this loan on time.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy input materials like fragments, precious and semi-precious stones and reagents

loans.name: Dodaroy

texts.en:
Dodaroy M., 50, along with her husband, a doctor, has raised four children. Dodaroy has been running a drug store for 12 years, selling only certified medicines, and because the store in located in a hospital, she has many clients and customers. She is now requesting a loan of $1500 USD in order to expand the business, with the increased income helping to finance higher education for the children. Dodaroy would like to assure Kiva lenders that she will repay the loan in nine months. Your generosity can change the lives of this family. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase medicines to expand the business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Mrs. Luz P., 43 years old, is married and a resident of San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children. Her husband is an ambulance driver of the Municipality of Jimenez. In her desire to help her husband, she ventured into pig raising with a start-up capital of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (about US $62) from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She is a MIGS member (member in good standing) of the co-op and has take out loans several times already. She's thankful that Paglaum Cooperative is always there in times of need.

Now, she is applying for a 14,900 peso loan to buy sacks of feeds and a piglet. She plans to build a cage for her pigs. She aims to repair their house and hopes that she'll be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Chem's Group

texts.en:
One of the members of the two borrower group loan is Mrs. Chem Y., age 41, the leader. Mrs. Y. generates her daily income by braiding thatch out of her home for sale. Almost all of her clients come to buy at her home. Y. is a widowed mother who has four teenage children: one is a fish seller, one sells firewood, and the other two are students who help her work when they are not studying.

Y.'s investment is going well, and she is trying to group up with a number of the users. Unfortunately, she has run out of raw materials; thus, she has decided to seek for a loan in order to buy additional raw material for braiding.

The other one borrower is Mrs. C., a fish seller who requests a loan to purchase more fish to sell. The borrowers live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy additional raw material for braiding

loans.name: Komlavi Juste

texts.fr: Agé d’une trentaine d’années, Mr W. Komlavi Juste est frigoriste de formation. Son activité est la réparation des congélateurs et frigidaires à ses clients. Il sollicite donc un financement pour ouvrir un atelier afin de répondre aux besoins de plus en plus grandissant de ses clients. Les bénéfices lui permettront de s’épanouir et de fonder un foyer digne de ce nom.
texts.en:
Around 30 years of age, Mr Komlavi Juste W. is a licenced refrigeration technician. His business is repairing the freezers and refrigerators of his customers. He is requesting a loan to open a workshop so as to meet the ever-growing needs of his clientele. The profit will permit him to flourish and to found a household worthy of the name.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a workshop to repair freezers and fridges

loans.name: Shodikhon

texts.en:
Shodikhon is a hard working person and he makes an effort to give his beloved son the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 11 years in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to purchase the cattle that can create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests US $1300. Shodikhon thanks you very much for your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Radjabgul

texts.ru: Саидова Раджабгуль жительница района Рудаки.Возраст 47 лет , замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Старший сын работает таксистом , и он один является кормильцем семьи. Но Раджабгуль занимается земледелием и в сезон зарабатывает неплохие деньги. Поэтому сейчас она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Деньги планирует получить и использовать для закупки семян овощей и удобрений.
texts.en:
Radjabgul S. lives in the Rudaki district. She is 47 years old, married and has five children. Her oldest son works as a taxi driver and is the only one who provides for the family. However, Radjabgul is involved in agriculture and makes fairly good money in season. This is why she requested a loan from us now. She plans to use the money to purchase vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
"Simple woman" describes Mrs. Cesaria M., 54 years old, who is married and lives at San Isidro,Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with two children. Cesaria thought of a livelihood project in which she could help her husband. She ventured into buying & selling of RTWs (ready-to-wear clothes). Her primary customers are neighbors, friends and members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

Having a mark-up of 20% per item sold is an additional income for her family. In this way, she can support her husband financially. Being a member of the cooperative is a big help for her project.

Now, she is applying for 14,900 Philippine Pesos to buy additional RTW's for sale. She aims to build a house someday. It would be a great achievement for her, if she sees all her children successful in their chosen careers.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.en:
S. Fakhridin is 34-year-old married man with 3 children. Fakhridin has successful business of selling flour at the local market of Dushanbe. Fakhridin sells an assortment of good quality flour. Fakhridin has been engaged in this type of business for 12 years and during that period he become a very successful entrepreneur. While his business is doing very well, he sees the opportunity to increase his sales by maintaining a larger inventory of goods. Therefore, Fakhridin is requesting a loan of $1900 USD to purchase more goods for resale.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase inventory of flour for sale

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma (toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo une préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments alimentaires,  d’habits, de  bouillie,  de chaussures, et de beurre de karité.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 3 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 sacs de 100 kg de sorgho(pour en faire la bouillie), 2 sacs de noix de karité,   5 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants et 3 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues, en détail au marché de Kadiolo ville et souvent en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 13.750FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouma are all married and average 28 years of age and 2 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Noumousso, a district in the city of Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding ones have been repaid without difficulty.

The group members do a diversity of work, including selling condiments, clothing, porridge, shoes, and shea nut butter. With this new loan, they intend to buy three packets of condiments, two 100-kg sacks of sorghum (for making porridge), two sacks of shea nuts, five dozen pieces of children's clothing, and three dozen pairs of plastic shoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Kadiolo City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold retail in mostly cash transactions to customers composed of men and women, at the marketplace of Kadiolo City and often within the family.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 13,750 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for day-to-day needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A. is 36 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a hardworking farmer. Julieta lives with her family in Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. Her children go to school, so she works hard for their education.

Julieta is involved in the buying and selling of bananas and rice in their place. Through this, she is able to supply the needs of the people in their village in exchange for money. Due to excessive demand from her customers, Julieta plans to improve her business. She's in need of extra income for her to realize her plans.

Julieta now is seeking from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00 for the improvement of her business. Her assessment is that if she could gain a higher income, she will be able to support fully the needs of her family and have extra money to pay their electric bill. Julieta is looking forward to the positive response from the organization.

loans.use: Money will be used to procure additional stock

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: назарова Мухае . Проживает в районе Рудаки. Работает в средней школе -учителем. Кроме того имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота путем покупки молодого бычка. Это даст возможность заработать дополнительно .
texts.en:
N. Muhayo lives in the Rudaki region. She works in the high school as a teacher. In additions she has a plot where she raises livestock. She has been doing this for 10 years now. She plans to get credit in order to increase her livestock headcount by buying a young bull. This will allow her to earn an additional income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Зебинисо - женщина 39 лет. Она вдова. Воспитает 3-х детей. Занимается продажей мужской одежды на рынке "Афганбазар"  города Худжанда. Она арендует магазин. Зебинисо привозит товар из города Бишкека Киргизской Республики. Она раз в месяц ездит за товаром. Зебинисо кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. В начале кредитования она закупала товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Сейчас она расширила бизнес. Зебинисо планирует дальше расширять бизнес и потихоньку перейти и на женскую одежду.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a 39 year old woman. She is a widow, she raises three children. She sells men's clothing on the market Afganbazar of the town of Khujand. She rents out a store. Zebiniso brings the merchandise from Bishkek of the Republic of Kyrgyztan. She travels for the merchandise once a month. Zebiniso has been taking out loans in our organization for two years. At the beginning of her credit history she was buying the goods from a wholesale market of the town of Istaravshan. She has now expanded her business. Zebiniso plans to further expand her business and slowly start selling women's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Baglon

texts.en:
E. Baglon is a widow who on a daily basis seeks the betterment of her dearest son. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a little girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and has been a stable source of income until this day. For more than 12 years Baglon has been growing some production on her land with the help of her son. To continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality of crops Baglon wants to borrow money for growing potatoes and onions on her land. For that she needs to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Let’s show solidarity to this selfless mother that looks out for what is best for her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: opening up a workshop and purchasing necessary tools for it

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Soutoura (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo une préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres, la restauration, la vente de fruits et légumes,  de condiments,  de pâtes d’arachides et de gombo.
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 paquets de condiments, 1sac de 100kg de riz (pour la restauration), 5 paniers de légumes, 1sac de 100kg de graine d’arachide(pour en faire le pâte d’arachide), 1 sac de haricot et 20 litres d’huile. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Kadiolo ville  et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes  au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Soutoura are all married and average 35 years of age and 3 children each. They live mainly in monogamous families in Noumousso, a district in the city of Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members do a diversity of work, including food catering, selling fruit and vegetables, condiments, peanut butter, and okra.

The group members are on their third collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. All of the preceding loans were settled. With this new loan, they intend to buy three packets of condiments, a 100-kg sack of rice (for catering), five baskets of vegetables, a 100-kg sack of peanuts (to make into peanut butter), a sack of beans, and twenty liters of oil. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Kadiolo City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted, at the marketplace of Kadiolo City and within the family.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 12,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for day-to-day needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Abdu's Group

texts.en: K. Abdu is the leader of Bugolo group. He has a retail shop that has been operational for over 10 years. He sells essential items that are needed by the locals in his area and he says that although there are many shops next to his, he has many customers that he has managed to win because of the good care he offers them as well as having sufficient stocks of goods. This is also possible because of the loans he gets from Pearl microfinance that enable him to stock more bags of sugar, salt, maize flour, and others from Jinja town.

loans.use: Restocking retail shop with more products.

loans.name: Mustafokul

texts.en:
K. Mustafokul is a loving and self-sacrificing father. Ever since he was very young, Mustafokul has been around people raising animals, and thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Mustafokul harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests $700 USD to buy more cattle to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.en:
K. Lutfillo is 38 years old. He is married and the father of 5 children. Lutfillo is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Lutfillo is in agribusiness for more than 13 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. His loving wife is also engaged in this business. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni. With the desire to realize his plan, Lutfillo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
