Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yakoubou

texts.fr: Mr M. Yakoubou est né à Tsévié vers 1980. Très déterminé, il s’est vite engagé dans la vente de viande de bœuf, chèvre, mouton, porc… dans le marché de la ville avec la collaboration des vétérinaires. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en grande quantité en viandes. Ainsi, il pourra contribuer efficacement à son épanouissement.
texts.en:
Mr. Yakoubou M. was born in Tsévié around 1980. A very determined young man, he quickly got into the sale of beef, goat meat, and pork, etc., in the town market, watched over by veterinarians. Today, he is requesting a loan so that he can procure large quantities of meat for sale. Thus he will be able to contribute efficiently to his well-being.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying larger quantities of meat for re-sale

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.en:
M. Amonullo is 26 years old. He is married and has a son. For 5 years Amonullo has been growing agricultural products on his land with the help of his wife. He is planning to sow potato on his land. He wants to borrow the loan for purchasing potato seed and mineral fertilizer for processing the land. Amonullo is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni. You could become an important part of Amonullo family's life, he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of potato seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Bobo

texts.ru: Кодиров Бобо житель города Куляб. Возраст 44 года , разведен . Один воспитывает четверых детей. Имеет собственный магазин , где торгует продуктами питания , а так же хозяйственными товарами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. так же он сможет увеличить ассортимент товара . Что привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
K. Bobo is a resident of the city of Kulob. He is 44 years old and is divorced. He raises four children on his own. He has his own store where he sells food products and also household goods. Bobo plans to get a loan in order to increase his turnover, he will also be able to increase his product assortment. This will attract new customers and provide additional income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Djamadjigui  (L’Espoir Des Hommes) Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Djamadjigui toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, et sont  mères d’au moins 6  enfants .Elles vivent dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou
Elles mènent différentes activités telles, la restauration et la  vente de  condiments alimentaires. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant de ce  sixième  prêt solidaire  (prêt de groupe)  est  de 200.000 FCFA par cliente et tous les cinq prêts précédents ont été correctement  remboursé. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de riz et toutes sortes de condiments alimentaires. Les femmes du groupe Djamadjigui vendent du riz bien cuisiné au carrefour de  Kimparana. Elles ont des tables pour la vente de condiments devant les gargotes. 
Elles se procurent des marchandises à partir de Sikasso et de San auprès des grossistes. 
Elles comptent réaliser chacune  160 000 FCFA. de bénéfice au cours de ce cycle. En plus  du remboursement des prêts elles  feront face  aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djamadjigui are all married and average 37 years of age. They are the mothers of at least 6 children and live in the village of Kimparana, in San prefecture, Segou region. They do different kinds of work, such as food catering and selling condiments.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. The loan amount of the sixth solidarity loan (group loan) is 200,000 francs CFA per client. All five preceding loans were correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice and all sorts of condiments. The merchandise is acquired from Sikasso and San from wholesalers. The group members sell nicely-cooked rice at the crossroads of Kimparana. There, they have tables for selling condiments in front of the eateries.

The women of the group each plan to realize 160,000 francs of profit in the course of this cycle. In addition to the loan payments, they will address common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and condiments for catering

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат - молодая женщина 27 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет высшее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды в торговом центре "Бадри Мунир". В пятницу выходит на рынок "Джума-базар" а в воскресенье на рынок "Якшанбе-базар".  Малохат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Малохат кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она старается расширять свой бизнес и поэтому она собирается взять кредит для расширения своего ассортимента.
texts.en:
Malohat is a young, 27-year-old woman. She is a married mother of two children. She has a higher education. Malohat is involved in sales of children’s clothing at the Badri Munir shopping center. She comes out to the Djuma-bazar market on Fridays and to the Yakshanbe-bazar market on Sundays. Malohat buys her goods at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She has been a client at our organization for 1 year. Malohat is trying to grow her business and plans to obtain this loan in order to expand her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Balemaya (La Parenté) Group

texts.fr:
Balemaya est un regroupement de quatre femmes du  village de Kimparana (région de Ségou). Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 2  enfants vivant dans des foyers polygames. 
Elles mènent différentes activités telles la vente de produits de beauté, de fruits et légumes etc.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 200.000 FCFA pour le sixième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des produits cosmétiques et des légumes et fruits.  
Les femmes du groupe Balemaya se procurent de leurs marchandises à Bamako et à Kimparana  et vendent leurs articles à la  maison, au marché et aux foires des villages environnants.
En plus du remboursement des intérêts du prêt,  elles utiliseront une partie de leur revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Balemaya is a group of four women of the village of Kimparana (Ségou region). They average 31 years of age and 2 children each, and they are all married mothers living in polygamous households. They work in different businesses, such as selling beauty products, fruit, vegetables, etc.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 200,00 francs for the sixth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. The current loan will be used to buy cosmetics, vegetables, and fruit.

The group members procure their merchandise in Bamako and in Kimparana, and they sell their goods at the house, at the marketplace, and at the fairs of surrounding villages. In addition to making loan interest payments, they will use a portion of their revenues to address common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is married. She owns a small business selling children’s clothing in a local mall in Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. The favorable location of Angela’s venture adds to her good sales rates. Angela has been in the trade for five years. Presently, she has about 60,000 Hryvnia in merchandise. Her income amounts to 6,000 Hryvnia.

Some of the major characteristics of Angela’s business are stability and consistency. Partly this is due to financial assistance she received in previous years. This time Angela is requesting a loan of 11,000 Hryvnia to stock a new vending location she has just opened. Angela is very optimistic and cheerful which has helped her fulfill her dreams in the past. We believe these characteristics will help her implement her plans now, too.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Мирзоходжаев 1977 года рождения. Женат имеет 2 детей. Он дома содержит скот. Раньше во время советского союза  работал мастером в цеху. После распада Союза остался без работным и занялся скотоводством. Сейчас более 15 лет дома ухаживает за скотом и разводит. По совместительству мастерит неисправленные  холодильники.  Семья помогает   ухаживать за скотом.  В Микроинвест обратился 1 год назад.
texts.en:
Yusuf Mirzohodjaev was born in 1977. He is married and has two children. He keeps cattle at his home. During the Soviet Union times she used to work as a repairman in a shop. After collapse of the Soviet Union he became unemployed and started an animal husbandry business. At this time it has been more than fifteen years since he has being taking care of and breeding cattle. He also repairs broken refrigerators with a partner. His family helps him to keep after cattle. He first came to MicroInvest one year ago.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru: Асрор Кахоров 1980 года рождения . женат имеет 2 детей. Кахор закончил всего лишь 10 классов в школе. закончив школу он учился у дяди  мясника. Откормив скот он продавал мясо по рыночной цене.  Сейчас он  продолжает  своё дело. Покупает корову или быка через пару месяцев продает мяса.  Также его приглашают резать коров. Дома содержит скот  около шести лет. На кредит от КИВА и построил расширил свой коровник.
texts.en:
Asror K. was born in 1980, he is married and has 2 children. Asror finished just 10 grades in school. Having finished school he studied with this uncle, a butcher. After fattening livestock he sold meat at market prices. Right now he continues his business. He purchases a cow or a bull and after a few months sells the meat. He is also invited to butcher cows. He has been keeping livestock at home for around six years. He used his KIVA loan to build/expand his cow shed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening livestock

loans.name: Panama (Name Of An Honored Person In Their Village) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes  du groupe P. sont âgées en moyenne de 39 ans avec une moyenne de 4  enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Kimparana préfecture de San région de Ségou.
Unies par des liens essentiellement professionnels, les membres du groupe P. font de la teinture et la vente d’habits. Elles ont appris la teinture avec les parents féminins qui le faisaient auparavant. Elles mènent  d’autres activités secondaires telles la vente d’encens et de henné. Elles sont sollicitées  dans leurs  activités tant principales que secondaires. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles ont rejoint  Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans de cela. Après avoir correctement remboursées les  5 prêts précédents, ce groupe est à son sixième prêt solidaire. (prêt de groupe).
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter des bazins blancs Bamako (capitale du Mali). Le bazin est très prisé et recherché par toutes les catégories sociales. Elles font passer les bazin dans les différentes couleurs. Les bazins ainsi teintés sont vendus  au comptant et à crédit.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 250 000FCFA au cours  de ce cycle qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et faire face aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
The four women of the group P. have an average age of 39 and have 4 children on average. They live in large traditional extended families in the village of Kimparana, in San prefecture, Segou region. United essentially by professional ties, the group members do dye work and sell clothing. They learned how to dye cloth from their mothers, who used to do it before. They also have secondary businesses, such as selling incense and henna. They are in demand for their primary, as much as their secondary, businesses.

Concerned about satisfying their definitely growing customer base, they joined Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having correctly repaid the five preceding loans, this group is now on its sixth solidarity loan (group loan). This loan will be used to buy white damask fabrics in Bamako (capital of Mali). Damask is highly prized and sought after by people from all walks of live. The fabric is treated with different colors. Thus dyed, it is sold in cash or credit transactions.

The group members each hope to realize a profit of 250,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to make loan interest payments and to address family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy white damask fabrics for dyeing

loans.name: Essolisam

texts.fr: Mme D. Essolisam est née en 1980 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de famille, elle vend devant un établissement scolaire des articles scolaires. Afin de pérenniser son activité, elle sollicite un financement pour faire des stocks d’articles scolaires et ouvrir une boutique. Avec les revenus, elle pourra subvenir au maintien et à l’entretien de toute sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Essolisam D. was born in 1980 in Tsévié. Married and the mother of a family, she sells school supplies in front of a school. In order to make her business viable for a long time, she is requesting a loan to stock up on school supplies and open a shop. With the income, she will be able to help support her family and assure their well-being.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying school supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: bolstering his working capital

loans.name: Sinignessigui (Préparer L’Avenir) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sinignessigui est composé de six femmes du village de Kimparana (préfecture de San région de Ségou) qui ont en moyenne 39 ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames. 
Les femmes du groupe Sinignessigui sont toutes des restauratrices. Vu la situation géographique de leur village qui est un carrefour très peuplé,  elles vendent sur place dans des gargotes du riz, haricot, viande, fonio etc.
 Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 200.000 FCFA pour le sixième prêt solidaire. Tous les autres prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des sacs de riz, des seaux de pâte d’arachide et  autres ingrédients pour la restauration.
 Ainsi avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 230 000 FCFA. de bénéfice chacune au cours du cycle.
 En plus du remboursement des prêts elles comptent faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Ces femmes ont des gargotes ou des hagards pour la restauration. Elles comptent avoir dans l’avenir des restaurants et diversifier leurs marchandises en y ajoutant des boissons glacées.
texts.en:
The group Sinignessigui is composed of six women from the village of Kimparana (San prefecture, Ségou region) who average 39 years of age and six children each. They live in polygamous households. The women of this group are all restauranteurs. Given their village's location, at a highly populated crossroads, they sell rice, beans, meat, fonio (a kind of millet), etc. locally in eateries.

To expand their businesses, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan to 200,000 francs for the sixth solidarity loan. All the other loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy sacks of rice, buckets of peanut butter, and other ingredients for catering. Thus, with this new loan, they each plan to realize an average profit of 230,000 francs in the course of this cycle. In addition to the loan payments, they intend to address common family expenses. These women have eateries or stalls as restaurants. They intend have restaurants in the future and to diversify their offerings by including cold drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for catering

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат - женщина 48 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детских аксессуаров, сумочек, фотоальбомов, и прочих аксессуаров. Саломат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Она торгует на Рынке "Панчшанбе" на втором этаже магазин № 197. Саломат хочет расширить свой ассортимент и закупить партию детской одежды. Поэтому Саломат взяла кредит чтобы закупить новую партию.
texts.en:
Salomat is a 48 year old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She sells children’s accessories – purses, photo albums and other accessories. Salomat purchases her products from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She sells at the “Panchshanbe” market on the second floor, store #197. Salomat would like to grow her product assortment and purchase a stock of children’s clothing. This is why Salomat took out a loan in order to purchase a new stock of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's products

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is married and lives in Vinogradovo. She sells women’s lingerie in the central marketplace of her home town. Her vending location is a kiosk is located at the entrance to the market which makes it attractive to customers who are passing by. Tetyana has been in the trade for four years. Currently, she has about 25,000 Hryvnia in inventory. Her income is about 5,000 Hryvnia.

Tetyana is seeking a loan of 7,000 Hryvnia. She is hoping to see her business expand even more. Tetyana is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. We believe her commitment to her venture and personal characteristics will help her repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mme S. Awa est née en 1958 à Sokodé. Mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants avec cinq (05) autres personnes à sa charge, elle a pour activité principale la vente de piment rouge séché et du piment rouge écrasé mis en plastique. Elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du piment afin d’assurer un stock permanent et rentabiliser ses affaires. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. S. Awa was born in 1958 in Sokodé. She is married and the mother of seven children and has five other people to support. Her main work involves selling dried red chili peppers and crushed red chili peppers placed in plastic. She’s requesting financing to stock up on chili peppers in order to ensure a continuous stock and to make her business profitable. Thus, she will be able to care for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell chili peppers

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov, married with two grown daughters, graduated from a college of commerce and used to work as a store vendor. However, perestroika times hit her hard and she was forced to find new ways to provide for her family. Today she runs a small business selling artificial flowers, dishware and other retail items in the city marketplace. Lubov’s venture is unique in its way, and she has a loyal clientele who help keep her sales high. Lubov has been in this business niche for nine years. Presently, she has 50,000 Hryvnia in stock, and her average income is about 8,000 Hryvnia a month.

Lubov is seeking a loan of 13,620 Hryvnia to purchase new merchandise for the spring/summer season. She believes it will promote further expansion of her business and ensure a stable source of income for her family and herself. Lubov is very sincere and serves each of her customers with a smile. Her warm individual approach earns her many return customers, which helps her keep a leading position in this business.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.ru: Шарипова Курбонби проживает в городе Куляб. Одна воспитывает четверых детей. Разведена. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города. Привозит товар из города Душанбе. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Бизнес развивается неплохо , но для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот она планирует получить кредит. Таким образом она планирует увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
S. Qurbonbi lives in the city of Kulob. She raises four children on her own. She is divorced. Qurbonbi works in sales. She has a sales location at the city market. She brings her products from the city of Dushanbe. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her business is developing well, but in order to increase her turnover she plans to get credit. This way she plans to increase her product assortment and attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with a three-year-old child. He lives in Kamenka and runs a technical store selling spare vehicle parts, tires and lubricants. His little vending facility is favorably located in downtown Kamenka. His business is very prospective and flourishing. Ruslan has an individual approach to each of his customers which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 10 years. His working capital amounts to 150,000 Hryvnia.

Ruslan is seeking a loan of 12,127 Hryvnia to purchase summer tires as they always sell well at the end of spring – beginning of summer. Ruslan is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. Ruslan’s business is developed and settled. One of his other business plans is to open a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To purchase summer tires to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To raise goats and sheep

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benso sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kadiolo (Noumousso) dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de beurre de karité, les jus de fruits et d’habits.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les  prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 2 sacs de 100kg de noix de karité (pour en faire le beurre de karité) et 3 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, au marché de la ville de Kadiolo le jour de foire et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante les autres jours à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 7.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Benso are all married and average 23 years of age and 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso) in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They do a diversity of work, including selling shea nut butter, fruit juices, and clothing.

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their third solidarity loan. All the preceding ones were settled.

With this new loan, they intend to buy two 100-kg sacks of shea nuts (to make into shea nut butter) and three dozen pieces of children's clothing. Supplies are gotten at the Kadiolo City marketplace and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold to customers composed of men and women in cash transactions at the Kadiolo City marketplace on market day and in the districts going door-to-door on the other days.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 7,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Husunbonu

texts.ru: Хусунбону Шарипова проживает в городе Куляб. Разведена . Осталась одна с тремя детьми.Уже год как занимается шитьем. Принимает заказы на пошив национальной женской одежды. Дело приносит хороший доход, так как ее продукция пользуется спросом. Сейчас к лету она планирует шить платья для реализации их на рынке. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом. Закупит хлопчатобумажный материал и пошьет летние платья.
texts.en:
Husunbonu S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is divorced and was left alone with three children. For a year now she has been doing sewing. She takes orders to sew traditional women’s clothing. The business brings good income since her products are in demand. Right now she plans to sew dresses for the summer in order to sell them at the market. This is why she has turned to us for credit. She will purchase cotton fabrics and will sew summer dresses.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Hoji

texts.ru: Хочи 51 год. Она замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается продажей мужских сумок и мужской обуви на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда, магазин № 8. Она арендует магазин. Ей помогает её муж. Он поставляет Хочи товар из города Истаравшан. Муж Хочи каждые две недели ездит за товаром. Хочи кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Сначала она продавала  только сумки, потом расширила бизнес и стала продавать мужскую обувь. Теперь Хочи планирует расширить свой ассортимент и закупить партию мужской одежды.
texts.en:
Hoji is 51 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells men’s purses and men’s shoes at the “Panchshanbe” market in Khujand, store #8. She rents the store. Her husband helps her. He supplies Hoji with products from Istaravshan. Hoji’s husband travels for products every two weeks. Hoji has been a borrower with our organization for 1 year. At first she sold only purses, later she grew her business and started to sell men’s shoes. Now Hoji plans to grow her assortments and to purchase a stock of men’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase men's clothing for sale

loans.name: Yalama Yalama Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Yalama Yalama sont toutes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Kadiolo (Noumousso) dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pommades, d’habits, de jus de fruits et  d’huile alimentaire.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, tous les antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 3 colis de pommades, 5 pièces de pagnes wax et quelques complets en bazin. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et à Kadiolo ville. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de la ville de Kadiolo, dans les quartiers de façon ambulante et souvent sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne.
Certaines femmes du groupe Yalama Yalama ambitionnent d’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Yalama Yalama are all married and average 35 years of age and 3 children each. They live in monogamous families in Kadiolo (Noumousso) in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They do a diversity of work, including selling ointments, clothing, fruit juices, and cooking oil.

The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their third solidarity loan. All the previous ones have been correctly repaid.

With this new loan, they intend to buy four 20-liter drums of oil, three packages of ointments, five bolts of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and some suits made of damask fabrics. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in Kadiolo City. The merchandise is sold to customers composed of men and women in mostly cash transactions at the Kadiolo City marketplace, door-to-door, and often by special order.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be put into savings. Some of the women of the group have the ambition to buy a plot of land on which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a child. She is an entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze. Irina sells household items in the central marketplace of her home town. A wide assortment of merchandise and loyal clientele help her keep up a high demand. Irina launched the venture six years ago. Currently, she has 16,000 Hryvnia in turnover. Income amounts to 2,200 Hryvnia a month.

Irina has a good credit history and a positive reputation among other market vendors. This time she is seeking a loan of 9,000 Hryvnia to purchase additional merchandise in bulk for her vending kiosk. She is achievement oriented and has confidence in her abilities and powers. We believe these crucial characteristics that Irina possesses will secure further growth of her trade and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Shukrona

texts.ru: Шарипова Шукрона проживает в горде Куляб.Возраст 20 лет, не замужем . Живет в родительском доме. Работает портнихой на дому.Занимается этим видом услуг один год. В данный момент хочет купить современную швейную машинку , для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых услуг-таких как вышивка. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом, который сможет дать ей эту возможность.
texts.en:
S. Shukrona lives in Kulob. She is 20 years old and is not married. She lives in her parents’ home. Shukrona works as a seamstress at home. She has been providing this service for a year. At this moment she would like to purchase a modern sewing machine in order to increase the types of services that she offers – such as embroidery. This is why she has turned to us for a loan which will be able to give her this ability.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru: Иззатой Ганиева  1961 года рождения. Имеет средне специальное образование. Она разведена.  Торгует  в магазине  различными материалами и  занавесками.  На рынке торгует почти 19 лет. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2006 года. Первый кредит получила за аренду помещения. Со временем выкупив магазин, и расширила ассортимент.
texts.en:
Izzatoi G. was born in 1961. She has a secondary specialist education. She is divorced. Izzatoi sells fabric and curtains at a store. She has traded at the market for almost 19 years. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2006. She got her first loan for space rental. Over time she has purchased the store and expanded her assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand assortment

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Balimaya  est  constitué de quatre femmes  mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali, dans des foyers monogames. 
Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles et augmenter leurs revenus. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de pagnes wax, de condiments et de produits de beauté. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  50 pièces de pagnes wax, 60 paniers de condiments  et 60 cartons de produits de beauté.
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et en république de Côte D’ivoire pays frontalier du Mali. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville et souvent de façon ambulante dans les domiciles à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant, en détail et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider leur mari, à entretenir les enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Balimaya ambitionnent agrandir et diversifier leurs activités.
texts.en:
Balimaya is composed of four married women who average 33 years of age and 3 children each. They live in monogamous households in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their seventh collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers and to increase their revenues.

The group members do a diversity of work, including the sale of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), condiments, and beauty products. With this loan, they intend to buy fifty bolts of Wax pagnes, sixty baskets of condiments, and sixty boxes of beauty products. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire, a country bordering Mali. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted, at grand marketplace of Sikasso City and while going home-to-home.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 27,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for helping their husbands to care for the children, and the other portion will be invested in business. The women of the group have the ambition to expand and diversify their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles

loans.name: Wiyou

texts.fr: Mme BANAWAÏ Wiyou est née en 1971 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes en charge, elle pratique le commerce de la vente de pagnes.  Elle sollicite un financement pour s’installer, ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagnes et se ravitailler en pagnes. Les bénéfices seront mis à la disposition de la famille pour un avenir meilleur.
texts.en:
Ms. BANAWAÏ Wiyou was born in 1971 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of three children and has two other people to support. She does commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She’s’ requesting financing for getting situated, for opening a shop for selling pagnes, and for resupplying her self with pagnes. The profits will be put to use for a better future for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth

loans.name: Oulimata

texts.fr: Mme Oulimata G. est une femme marié qui a 42 ans. Elle habite au quartier Grand Thiès et a 5 enfants en charge. Elle fait le commerce depuis 6 ans qui consiste à vendre des tissus, des chaussures, des produits cosmétiques au marché. Son activité marche bien et elle a décidé d’intégrer l’institution de micro finance de l’IMCEC. Elle est à son premier prêt avec laquelle elle veut renforcer son activité. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000 f CFA sur l’ensemble des produits (tissus , chaussures et produits cosmétiques ) qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Oulimata G. is a married woman who is 42 years old. She lives in the Grand Thiès district and has five children in her care. She has been doing commerce for six years that involves selling cloth, shoes, and cosmetics in the marketplace. Her business is doing well, and she decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC. She is on her first loan, which she wants to use to bolster her business. She hopes to realize a profit of 200,00 francs CFA on the whole with these goods (cloth, shoes, and cosmetics). The profit will be used to make loan interest payments, to help her husband with family expenses, and to invest the rest in her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes  du groupe  Danaya  qui sont toutes mariées ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la restauration, la vente de tissus wax, de  pomme de terre, de fruits  etc.
Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter et d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaires.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 paniers de condiments,  200 kg de riz pour la restauration, 25 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges ,15 panier de fruits (mange et orange) et 30 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre . Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et au Burkina Faso pays frontalier du Mali. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant et en détail.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour subvenir aux frais de scolarité et de santé  des enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group Danaya are all married and average 36 years of age and 2 children each. They live in monogamous families in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali. They do a diversity of work, including food catering, selling Wax cloth, potatoes, fruit, etc.

The group members are on their seventh collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing customer base and to increase their turnover.

With this loan, they intend to buy ten baskets of condiments, 200 kg of rice for catering, twenty-five 100-kg sacks of oranges, fifteen baskets of fruit (mangoes and oranges), and thirty 100-kg sacks of potatoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in Burkina Faso, a country bordering Mali. The merchandise is sold retail, in cash transactions, to customers composed of women and men, at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and often door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 28,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used to meet schooling and health care costs for the children, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Nasimjon

texts.ru: Насимчон - молодой человек 32 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Жена Насимчона помогает ему. Насимчон кредитуется у нас уже 1 год. Он решил расширить ассортимент своего товара и взять кредит для этой цели.
texts.en:
Nasimjon is a young 32 year old man. He is married and is the father of 3 children. He sells children’s clothing at the Panchshanbe market in Khujand. He purchases products at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Nasimjon’s wife helps him. Nasimjon has been a borrower with us for 1 year now. He decided to grow his product assortment and to take out a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Бобожонова 1985 года рождения, замужем, имеет 2 детей. Имеет высшее образование. Но имея высшего образования по специальности устроиться не  смогла, вышла замуж. Муж на работу не пускал, но не смотря на невзгоды она с ним разошлась. Ее родственница пожалела и дала на некоторую сумму товара. Со временем она расплатилась с родственницей  и на первый кредит открыла свою лавку.
texts.en:
Firuza B. was born in 1985, she is married and has 2 children. She has a college education. But having a higher education she could not find a job in her field and got married. Her husband did not let her work, but despite the misery she separated from him. Her relative took pity on her and gave her a quantity of products to sell. With time she paid back her relative and used her first loan to open a shop.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand assortment

loans.name: Sinjiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Sinjiya  est  constitué de quatre femmes  mariées (dont deux sont polygames et  les deux autres monogames) qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de pouvoir combler le vœux de leur clientèle et augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire.
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’habillements,  de pomme de terre, et de   fruits.
 Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter  40 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges, 20 paniers  mange. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes et des producteurs. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant, en détail et à crédit au grand marché de Sikasso ville   et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour aider les maris à subvenir aux charges de famille et  l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Sinjiya is composed of four married women (two are polygamous, and the other two are monogamous). They average 36 years of age and 2 children each and live in Médine, a district in Sikasso City, third administrative region of Mali.

The group members are on their third collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to fulfill the wishes of their customers and to increase their turnover. They do a diversity of work, including the sale of clothing, potatoes, and fruit.

With this loan, they intend to buy forty 100-kg sacks of oranges and twenty baskets of mangoes. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City from wholesalers and producers. The merchandise is sold retail to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted, at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and often door-to-door.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for helping their husbands to meet family expenses, and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Mukim

texts.ru: Муким Вахидов 1985 года рождения, женат имеет 2 детей.  Дома содержит скот более 15 лет.  Сам он водитель автобуса. Узнал о кредите от пассажиров. Год назад получил кредит на откорм скота. Купил корм и несколько голов скота.  Дома дети помогают  ухаживать за скотом. Во время выгуливают на пастбище.  Планирует расширить коровник  после откорма скота.
texts.en:
Mukim Vahidov was born in 1985, he is married and has 2 children. He has been raising livestock at home for more than 15 years. He is a bus driver. He found out about the credit from passengers. A year ago he received a loan to fatten livestock. He purchased several heads of livestock. At home his children help to take care of the livestock. They take it out to pasture when it is time. He plans to expand his cow shed after fattening the livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Momisafar

texts.ru: Каракулова Момисафар проживает в одном из дальних кишлаков города Яван. Возраст 52 года , замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Всю жизнь занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет 10 гектаров земли. Пять гектаров засеяно пшеницей. Остальные пять гектаров планирует засеять тыквой . Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы закупить семена тыквы и удобрения. Она сажает тыкву очень хорошего сорта. Поэтому реализация происходит очень быстро и она получает хороший доход.
texts.en:
Q. Momisafar lives in one of the outlying villages of the city of Yavan. She is 52 years old, is married and has six children. She has worked in agriculture her entire life. She has 10 hectares of land. Five hectares are planted with wheat. She plans to plant pumpkins on the other five hectares. This is why she has turned to us for credit, in order to purchase pumpkin seeds and fertilizer. She plants a very good type of pumpkin. As a result her sales go very fast and she earns a good income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pumpkin seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: ЗАМИРА Монадкулова 1973 года рождения, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. В   Микроинвест обратилась для расширения бизнеса. Она продает в киоске, журналы газеты, а также сладостями и другими мелочами. Ее киоск находиться  возле остановки и большого магазина. Планирует в будущем расширить свой  киоск.Благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zamira M. was born in 1973; she is married and has 4 children. She has a high school education. She turned to MicroInvest to grow her business. She sells magazines, newspapers and also sweets and other miscellaneous items at a kiosk. Her kiosk is located next to a stop and a large store. She plans to expand her kiosk in the future. She is grateful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow product assortment

loans.name: Biadolat

texts.ru: Биадолат Хайдарова 1966 года рождения. Замужем имеет 4 детей. Окончила только 8 классов. В селе работы нет, население в основном перепродает скот. Муж  помогает перепродавать скот. В рыночные дни  он выводит на продажу скота. Ее брат получал кредит в одном из банков , он также посоветовал получить кредит. Биадолат послушав советы брата, посоветовалась с мужем получить кредит. Теперь она кредитуется в Микроинвест  почти год.
texts.en:
Biadolat H. was born in 1966. She is married and has 4 children. She only finished 8 grades. There are no jobs in the village, the population mostly resells livestock. Her husband helps to resell livestock. On market days he takes the livestock to sell. Her brother received credit from one of the banks, he also recommended getting credit. Biadolat having listened to her brother’s suggestions also discussed it with her husband. Now she has been a borrower of MicroInvest for almost a year.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resell livestock

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Махмадаминов Хасан житель города Яван. Женат и имеет десятерых детей. занимается животноводством , а так же производством муки. Имеет минимельницу , где производит муку. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить зерно пшеницы. Переработав его в муку сможет продать и получить прибыль.Таким образом он будет иметь оборотную сумму , которая даст возможность зарабатывать деньги.
texts.en:
M. Hasan is a resident of the city of Yavan. He is married and has ten children. He raises livestock and also makes flour. He has a mini-mill where he produces flour. Hasan plans to get credit in order to purchase wheat grain. After processing it into flour he will be able to sell it and earn a profit. This way he will have working capital that will allow him to earn money.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr: Mme A. Bintou est née en 1961. Mariée et mère de huit (08) enfants, elle exerce le commerce de la vente de maïs. Elle sollicite un financement pour stocker du maïs pendant la période d’abondance et le revendre en période de soudure. Les revenus pourront lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. A. Bintou was born in 1961. She is married and the mother of eight. She does commerce in corn and is requesting financing to stock up on corn when abundant and to sell when scarce. The revenues will enable her to improve the family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and to sell corn

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Пирматов Бахтиер проживает в городе Яван. возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет троихъ детей. Всю жизнь занимается разведением и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает их и перепродает их на рынке. Процесс откормки занимает около 50 дней. сейчас планирует получить кредит и купить еще двоих бычков. Покупка принесет ему хороший доход, так как в данный момент нет проблем с кормом.
texts.en:
Permatov Bahtiyor lives in the city of Yavan. He is 37 years old, is married and has three children. He has been raising and selling livestock for his entire life. He purchases young bulls, fattens them and resells them at the market. The fattening process takes around 50 days. Right now he plans to take out a loan and to purchase two more bulls. The purchase will bring him a good income, because right now there are no problems with feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two bulls

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Mme K. Odette est née en 1978 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études après le secondaire par faute de moyens financiers. Elle s’est lancée donc dans le commerce par la vente des produits cosmétiques. C’est une activité qui lui réussit très bien. Elle sollicite un financement pour louer une grande boutique et élargir encore plus son étalage. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux rentabiliser son commerce et veiller aux mieux être de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Odette was born in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of five. She didn't have the chance to pursue her studies following the 10th grade due to a lack of financial means. So she got started in the commerce of cosmetics. This is a business that is very successful for her. She's requesting financing to rent a large shop and to expand her display some more. She will thus be able to make her business more profitable and to look after the well-being of the entire family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cosmetics

loans.name: Bahavodinqul

texts.ru: Бахаводинкул Юсупов  житель города Яван. Возраст 50 лет.Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Занимается животноводством. Имеет дойную корову. Планирует получить кредит и закупить несколько голов овец и коз. При хорошем уходе эти животные смогут дать хорошую прибыль. А так же он сможет обеспечить рынок полноценным мясом.
texts.en:
Bahavodinqul U. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 50 years old, is married and has six children. He raises livestock. He has a dairy cow. Bahavodinqul plans to get credit and to purchase several sheep and goats. If well taken care of, these animals will be able to give him a good profit. He will also be able to provide the market with quality meat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increaese livestock count

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy M. est une jeune débutante dans le commerce avec un an d’expérience.  Son activité consiste à vendre des habits pour bébé, du cosmétique, et divers.  Avec le financement elle va acheter la marchandise afin de mieux servir ses clients et gagner un profit.  Elle est mariée, âgée de 25 ans, et elle habite a Silmang, un quartier de Thiès.  C’est le premier crédit qu’elle a sollicité auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva, et elle va utiliser les revenus de son activité pour aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Amy M. is a young beginner in commerce with one year of experience. Her work involves selling baby clothing, cosmetics and various goods. With financing, she is going to buy merchandise in order to serve her customers better and to earn a profit. She is married, 25 years old, and lives in Silmang, a district of Thiès. This is her first loan she's requesting from IMCEC and Kiva. She'll use the revenues from her business to help her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby clothing, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Gulchin

texts.ru: Катабекова Гульчин проживает в городе Яван. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Работает парикмахером и косметологом в свадебном салоне. Обратилась к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить инструменты , необходимые для работы.Современный инвентарь даст возможность улучшить качество обслуживания. Этим она сможет привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Gulchin K. lives in the city of Yavan. She is divorced and has one child. She works as a hairdresser and cosmetologist at a wedding salon. She has turned to us for credit in order to purchase tools necessary for her work. Modern inventory will allow her to improve the quality of her services. This way she will be able to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase necessary tools

loans.name: Emmanuel Jr.

texts.en: Emmanuel A., Jr. is forty-one years old and married with two school age children. He lives in Dipolog City. He is asking for a loan of $225 from the Kiva field partner, Paglaum MPC. He needs to have additional capital to finance his retail meat business.  Emmanuel is an active member of the Paglaum MPC and has taken advantage of five loan cycles in the past. Out of his sacrifices, he hopes that he can offer a better future for his family and support the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy livestock to butcher and sell

loans.name: Hokimsho

texts.ru: Искандаршоев Хокимшо проживает в городе Яван. Женат . возраст 26 лет. Занимается производством попкорна. Производит его в домашних условиях. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить кукурузу. Это даст возможность  работать без перебоев , до того пока не созреет новый урожай.
texts.en:
Hokimsho I. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 26 years old and married. He is involved in making popcorn at home. Hokimsho plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase corn. This will enable him to have uninterrupted production until the new harvest matures.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru: Мавлододов Усмон житель города Яван. Возраст 26 лет , не женат . Работает в диллерском центре. Торгует пластиковыми картами , для оплаты мобильных телефонов. кроме этого торгует запчастями для мобильных телефонов. так же производит моментальные переводы оплаты за телефон. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы  закупить карты различных провайдеров. Это привлечет новых клиентов и даст дополнительный доход.
texts.en:
Usmon M. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 26 years old and single. He works at a dealer center. He sells prepaid cards for mobile phones along with mobile phone spare parts and also provides instant payment transfers for phones. Usmon plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase cards for different mobile providers. This will attract new clients and provide additional income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone cards

loans.name: Mame Awa

texts.fr: Madame Mame Awa B. est une femme Senegalaise qui est enseignante à Hanene, un petit village.  Elle a travaillé comme enseignante depuis trois ans, et maintenant elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva pour aider son mari à renforcer son activité.  Son mari est boucher, et parce que Madame B. est salariée, elle peut l’aider avec le financement.  Elle a 28 ans et avec son salaire et les revenus de son mari, ils peuvent régler les dépenses  quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Mame Awa B. is a Senegalese woman who is a teacher in Hanene, a small village. She has been working as a teacher for three years, and now she's requesting her first loan from IMCEC and Kiva to help her husband bolster his business. Her husband is a butcher. And because Ms. B. earns a salary, she can help him with financing. She is 28 years old. With her salary and her husband's revenues, they can pay off day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help her husband bolster his business

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Ганиев Нуриддин проживает в городе Яван. Работает вместе со своей женой в магазине , где торгуют мукой. Занимаются этим бизнесом уже около трех лет. Планируют получить кредит для увеличения товарооборота. А часть кредита планируют использовать для покупки холодильной камеры. Она ему необходима для продажи мороженного. Нуриддину 59 лет , и он имеет двоих детей.
texts.en:
Nuriddin G. lives in the city of Yavan. Together with his wife, Nuriddin works at a store where they sell flour. They have been in this business almost three years. They plan to obtain this loan to increase product turnover and to purchase a refrigerator for ice-cream sales. Nuriddin is 59 years old and has two children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Ma. Evangeline

texts.en: Mrs. Ma. Evangeline S. is fifty-eight years old and married with two children. She lives at Punta, Dipolog City. She and her husband work hard for a living and for their children's education. Her husband has no regular job; that is why she is eager to help him. She has already received several loans and pays it back consistently. Recently, she asked for $125 to purchase materials for making and selling nipa (leaves used to make thatch for a roof). They have faithful customers, and that is a big help for making an income. Evangeline's wish is to send her children all the way through school.

loans.use: To buy materials for nipa-making

location.town: Punta, Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nazar

texts.ru: Ходжаев Назар житель города Яван. Возраст 29 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Вместе с отцом работает разнорабочим по найму. Живут вместе . Семья большая поэтому они вдвоем очень много работают. Кроме подсобной работы они занимаются животноводством. имеют небольшое хозяйство , где разводят скот. Сейчас хотят увеличить поголовье мелко рогатого скота. Для этого он решил получить кредит .
texts.en:
Nazar H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 29 years old, married and has three children. Together with his father, Nazar works as a handyman for hire. They live together. They have a big family which requires the father and son to work a lot. Besides the handyman work, they also have a small farm where they breed livestock. Currently, they want to increase their livestock headcount. This is why Nazar decided to obtain the loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
“Hardworking and skillful woman" describes Elsie B., who is 48, married and living in Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has eight children, four of whom are in school while the other four have their own families. Her husband is a carpenter.

Elsie used to bake bread just for her family's snacks. She knew how to bake because she used to be the “alalay” (helper) of her mother, using a native "pugon" (oven). When some of her neighbors who had tasted her bread encouraged her to bake more and sell it to them, she grabbed the opportunity. Now she continues her bread-making business, and it turns out to be profitable. In order to have additional capital, she joined the Kiva field partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, to take out a loan.

As a member in good standing, she is already on her 10th loan cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of $825 to buy flour and other ingredients for making bread, and to buy sacks of rice for her new business, which is selling rice. She plans to have mixing equipment someday and to expand her business into a bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for bread making and sacks of rice for rice retailing

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva T. is in the hog fattening business. Eva is thirty-eight years old, married, and blessed with four children. Her husband is a farmer. Eva and her family live in Lumbayao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Eva started her business with just one piglet and a small amount of money. It has been a lot of hard work, and she doesn’t underestimate the kind of work it will take to maintain it. In order to continue her business, Eva realized that she needs additional capital. Joining the Kiva field partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, is a great opportunity for her to get the financial assistance she needs. Today, she would like to borrow $250 to purchase sacks of feed, and she would like to start raising a few chicks for added income. From the income that she will gain, Eva will be able to pay her loan, and like any other parent, provide her children a good and bright future.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed and chicks

loans.name: Success Group

texts.en:
This is Aminata K. and Isha K.. They named their group "Success". This will be their third loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a tremendous impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of $325 each.

Aminata K. (right) is the leader of this group of two. Aminata was born in Moyamba in Southern Sierra Leone. She is twenty-eight years old and a divorcee with one child, who is in class five. Aminata owns a kiosk outside her house where she sells a variety of items. Some of the items she sells include: cigarettes, mints, biscuits, chewing gum, soft drinks, etc. She also sells slippers which she normally hawks around town and in neighboring villages.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Elsa es madre soltera tiene 55 años, dos hijos de 25 y 23 años que estudian en instituto 
Desde joven cosía en su casa, estudio en curso especial para hacer sabanas y edredones, hace tres años ha puesto en su casa  un pequeño   negocio donde vende todo lo que hace. 
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales, como tela para sabanas y tela para polos.  
Desde que  esta en Finca gracias al dinero que recibe, le sirve para invertir y no tiene que estar en apuros pidiendo a otros, aprendió a ser mas ordenada, a saber priorizar sus compras.   
El sueño de Elsa es ampliar su negocio y tener gente  que trabaje para  ella.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of La Fortaleza Community Bank. She is a single mother, 55 years old, and has two children who are 25 and 23 years old and study in college. Ever since she was young she has sewn in her home. She took a specialized course in making sheets and comforters, and three years ago started a small business in her home selling all that she makes. Elsa needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy materials like fabric for sheets and fabric for polos. Thanks to being a part of Finca and for the loans she receives, she has been able to invest and no longer struggles, having to ask others for help. She learned to be more organized and prioritize her purchases. Elsa's dream is to expand her business and employ other workers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for sheets and polos

loans.name: Rorunk Group

texts.en:
This is Ya Mamusu S. and Mamudu T.. They named their group "Rorunk", after the group leader’s home village. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have requested from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created a tremendous impact on the businesses and the personal lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of $600. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses, and consequently make better profits and improvements on their standards of living. 

Ya Mamusu S. (right) is the leader of this group. Mamusu is fifty-five years old. She was born in Rorunk, one of the villages surrounding Magburaka town. She is married with eight children. Five are already grown and three are still in school. Mamusu sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She will use this loan to buy as many gallons of palm oil as she can.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm-oil

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es  socia del Bancomunal La fortaleza. 
Doris es casada tienen 60 años. Tres hijos de 34, 32 y 29 años que trabajan y estudian.
Doris  de joven  estaba estudiando en la universidad pero no pudo terminar por que le dio hemiplejía y estuvo paralizada por mas de dos años, los médicos la desahuciaron pero ella puso su fe en Dios y se sano. Se puso a trabajar,  por las mañanas llevaba al colegio  a sus hijos y las  vecinas del barrio les decían que de paso lleven también a sus  hijos  que le  pagarían por sus servicios.
Fue así como ella empezó con el negocio de movilidad escolar, dejo el trabajo por que ganaba mas  con la movilidad, por la tarde se dedica a confeccionar ropa que le piden.    
Doris necesita un crédito de  1600 soles, para la compra de telas y para el arreglo de su carro.
Desde que este n Finca puede contar con los prestamos para invertir mas, aprendió ahorrar por que nunca ahorraba y aprendió a ser puntual en sus pagos y en todo lo que se compromete hacer. 
El sueño de Doris es tener una boutique para exhibir todo lo que confecciona.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of La Fortaleza Community Bank. She is married, 60 years old, and has three children who are 34, 32, and 29 who work and study. When she was younger, Doris was studying at a university, but could not finish because she suffered from hemiplegia (paralysis of half the body) for more than two years. The doctors declared it to be terminal, but she put her faith in God and was healed. She started working. In the morning she would take her children to school and the neighbor ladies told her they would pay her to take their children to school, too. In this way she started a school transportation business. She stopped working at her other job because she earned more with the school transportation. In the afternoons she works sewing clothing that people have ordered from her. Doris needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy fabric and to fix her car. Since being in Finca, she can count on loans in order to invest more. She learned how to save because she never used to save and she learned to be punctual with her payments and in everything she promises to do. Doris' dream is to have a boutique to exhibit everything she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and fix her car

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 34-year-old divorced man who lives in Bekaa. Mohamad has owned a grocery store for three years. He requested a loan of $1,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Mohamad has requested a loan.

Mohamad is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business he had financial issues and he also had health problems. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en: This is Abdul Rahman K.. Abdul was born in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is thirty-five years old and married to a businesswoman. They have four children. Abdul has been selling cosmetics for over ten years. This will be his fourth loan from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a lot of improvements in the business and the personal life of this entrepreneur. Having repaid his last loan successfully, he is requesting a new loan of $325 to help him strengthen his business.

loans.use: Invest in his cosmetics business

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim S. and Memuna T.. They named their group "Hope to God". This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have created a tremendous impact on the businesses and the personal lives of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are asking for a new loan of $600. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses, and consequently make a better profit and improve on their standard of living. 

Ibrahim S. (right) is the leader of this group. Ibrahim is twenty-three years old. He was born in Magburaka town, in Northern Sierra Leone. Ibrahim dropped out of school because his parents could not afford to pay his tuition fees. He started selling used clothes (referred to here as junks or kongo klose) five years ago. Out of his "junks" business he is able to sustain himself and support his parents.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Carmen es conviviente tiene 33 años, tiene un hijo de 3 años, ella solo pudo estudiar en la escuela primaria, por que su abuelos que la criaron falleció y tuvo que trabajar desde los ocho años. 
Carmen por seis años consecutivos reciclaba plásticos, papeles y todo lo que encontraba a la mano, hasta que junto su dinero y con la ayuda de su esposo alquilo un puesto en el mercado y puso una tienda de abarrotes.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos chinos.   
Desde que esta en Finca, ha surgido en el negocio comenzó con una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ahora tiene otro negocio, alquilo otro puesto  y puso  venta  especería, aprendió a confiar en ella misma, a ser firme en sus decisiones.      
El sueño de Carmene es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the La Fortaleza community bank. Carmen, 33, is in a common law marriage and has a 3 year old son. She could only go to elementary school because her grandparents, who were raising her, died. She had to work starting at 8 years old. For six consecutive years she was recycling plastics, paper, and everything she could find by hand. Then she got her money together, and with the help of her husband, she rented a stall in the market. She started selling groceries. Carmen needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy rice, sugar and Chinese noodles. Since she has been with Finca, her business has developed. She started with a small grocery store, and now she has another business. She rented another stall and started selling spices. She learned to have confidence in herself and to be firm in her decisions. Carmen’s dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and chinese noodles.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 27-year-old man who lives in Bekaa with his wife. Jalal has been working as an electrician for 10 years. He requested a loan of $1,200 from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase new tools for his business and purchase clothes for the new family member because his wife is pregnant with their first baby. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his financial situation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Jalal decided on doing his business because he learned it from his academy. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his business and purchase clothes for the new family member

loans.name: M.c.a Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A Primary School in Magburaka. Teachers of this school have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan. Teachers and other monthly wage earners come to SMT to seek a loan for several reasons: some use such loans to pay college fees for themselves, others use it to pay their children’s school fees, some invest it in their businesses or in their wives' businesses, some use it to buy pieces of furniture, and others invest it in building a house. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar will deduct the repayment amount of each teacher (borrower/group member) and deposit it with SMT’s cashier.
 
Amadu L. B. (left) is the head teacher at this school and head of this group. Mr. B. was born in Kamakwe town, in Northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-nine years old and married with four children. All of his children are attending schools – some in primary schools and others in secondary schools. He has been a teacher for five years now. He will invest his loan in buying pieces of furniture, like chairs, tables and a bed.

loans.use: Buy pieces of furniture

loans.name: M.c.a Primary School, Sanbaia Bendugu Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the M.C.A Primary School, Sanbaia Bendugu. M.C.A Primary School, Sanbaia Bendugu, was founded in 1955 by the Missionary Church of Africa. The school has a total of ten staff and two hundred and eighty-six pupils.

Teachers of this school have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan. Teachers and other monthly wage earners come to SMT to seek a loan for several reasons: some use such loans to pay college fees for themselves, others use it to pay their children’s school fees, some invest it in their businesses or in their wives' businesses, some use it to buy pieces of furniture, and others invest it in building a house. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar will deduct the repayment amount of each teacher (borrower/group member) and deposit it with SMT’s cashier.
 
Martin J. S. (right) is the Head Master at the school. Mr. S. was born in Kono, in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-eight years old and married with five children. All of his children are attending schools – some in primary schools and others in secondary schools. He has been a teacher for twenty-eight years. With this loan, he will invest in his house-building project. He will use it to buy bundles of corrugated iron and zinc.

loans.use: Buy bundles of corrugated iron and zinc

loans.name: Birungi Lilian‘S Group

texts.en:
Lilian is 38 years of age, a single mother of three children aged between 10 and 14. She owns a three-roomed house where she is living with four people and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Lilian sells sweet bananas in Naguru Market, in one of the city suburbs. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get them from the villages; that is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include rent for her place of work and school fees for her children.

Lilian sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for over four years now This is her tenth loan since she joined MCDT; she has been with MCDT for five years, working with the same group mates. Lilian wants to use this loan to buy more bananas and partly to pay school fees for her children. She is aspiring to see her business growing bigger and hopes to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and to pay school fees

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Gloria  es casada tiene 58 años, cinco hijos mayores que están casados.
Gloria era ambulante en el mercado vendía medias en una carreta, lo dejo por que le salio una hernia, y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, por un tiempo, hasta que decidió trabajar en su casa, puso una bodega  se llama Bodega Gloria, ya tiene dos años.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para invertidos en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, leche, saco de azúcar.
