Maye F., age 44, has been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. Her work involves commerce and fattening livestock. She sells pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and bed sheets, and she fattens sheep in order to sell them. She wants to bolster her businesses. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell "pagne" cloth and sheets and fattening livestock

loans.name: Castulo

texts.es: Castulo tiene 44 años, es padre soltero, para progresar y velar por el bienestar de su hijo tiene que trabajar muy duro dejando a su pequeño al cuidado de sus padres, con quienes vive. Al separarse de su pareja su hijo era muy pequeño, pero con el apoyo de sus padres tuvo la posibilidad de trabajar y ahora está dedicado a la venta de ropa para caballeros, y la mayoría de sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo. También viaja a algunas provincias para dejar prendas solicitadas que luego cobrará mensualmente, con el benéfico de vender aprecios que  cubran sus gastos de movilidad. Es así que desde hace 5 años esta actividad le está dando la posibilidad, no tan sólo de mantener su hogar, sino también de tener un negocio rentable que pronto estará ubicado en el mercado de su localidad. Castulo no dejará de viajar y ni dejar de atender a sus clientes, pues sus anhelos son de abrir varias tiendas de ropa para caballeros ofreciendo las mejores marcas para distintos gustos y edades. Es nuevo en su grupo, le dieron la oportunidad de ingresar, porque es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, y todas sus compañeras trabajan con suma responsabilidad logrando ganarse la confianza de MFP. Comprar mayores cantidades de prendas es ahora su prioridad, pues pronto llegará el día del padre y quiere tener el capital necesario para atender los diversos pedidos que realizan sus clientes, en ello que invertirá los 1000 soles de su crédito.
texts.en:
Castulo, 44, is a single father. He has to work very hard to progress and watch over the well being of his son. He lives with his parents, and they take care of his son when he works. His son was very little when the boy’s parents separated. But, with the help of his parents, Castulo could work. He now sells men’s clothing. Most of his customers are his colleagues from work. He also travels to some provinces to leave ordered items, and he collects monthly. He benefits from selling at prices that cover his traveling expenses. After 5 years in this business he has the possibility of not only maintaining his home, but he can also have a profitable business that will soon be located in the local market. Castulo will still continue to travel and tend to his customers. His goal is to open various men’s clothing stores offering the best brands for different tastes and ages. He is new to his group. They gave him the opportunity to join because he is a hard working, responsible person. All of his colleagues work responsibly, and they have gained MFP’s confidence. Buying bigger quantities of clothing is now his priority. Father’s Day will soon be here, and he wants to have enough capital to take care of his customers’ diverse orders. He will invest the loan of 1,000 PEN to that end.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: Delicia es una mujer muy trabajadora, ya que al tener la responsabilidad de velar por el bienestar de sus cuatro hijas tuvo que esforzarse para salir adelante, y a pesar de vivir en una casa alquilada trata siempre de brindar a sus hijas las mejores comodidades posibles. Desde muy joven se desempeñó en múltiples actividades, pero actualmente se dedica a brindar servicio de limpieza de casas, y gracias a que la mayoría de personas no cuentan con tiempo para atender sus roles domésticos, Delicia tiene la oportunidad de trabajo. Cada día, empieza su trabajo a las seis de la mañana, hasta el medio día, hora en que regresa a casa para atender sus a sus hijas. Este trabajo es muy rentable, y solo trabaja medio día, además desea incursionar en el rubro textil, pues tiene el don de realizar trabajos de bordados y de alta costura, habilidades que la llevarán pronto a contar con un negocio propio. Delicia es cliente de MFP más 5 años, este es su octavo préstamo, y en el tiempo de permanencia en su grupo puede manifestar que el trabajo es muy organizado, con algunas presiones, lo cual es bueno porque se enseña a las señoras a ser responsables en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de materiales para iniciar su negocio de costura, con la fe de que alcance sus metas con éxito.
texts.en:
Delicia is a hard-working woman. Since she is responsible for the welfare of her four daughters, she had to strive to succeed. Despite living in a rented house, she always tries to give her daughters the best comfort possible. Since she was very young, she got started in many activities, but now works cleaning house. Because most people do not have time to attend to their domestic roles, Delicia has the opportunity to work. Each day she begins her work at six o'clock until noon, then returns home to attend to her daughters. This work is very profitable, and she only works half days. She also wants to break into the textile field and has a gift working with high quality embroidery and sewing and will soon have her own business. Delicia is a client of MFP for over 5 years, this is her eighth loan, and during the time in her group she showed that her work is highly organized, with some pressure, which is good because it teaches the ladies to be responsible in their payments. The money requested is to purchase materials to start her sewing business, with the faith to reach her goals successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to establish a sewing shop

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi E. is married with 7 dependents and received an education through Junior High School. Naomi sells oil which she produces herself at Frami near Abura, as she has done for 6 years. While Naomi works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer.

Naomi uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and to help her husband when there is any other need. Naomi will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more palm fruit to produce more palm oil to meet the demand of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naomi plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in oil.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy more palm fruit to make oil

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah M. is a widow with 1 child and has received an education through Primary School. Hannah sells cloth at Abura, which she has done for 3 years.  Hannah uses her income to pay for clothing and feeding her child. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of cloth for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to save towards expanding her business.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of cloth

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: Ndèye P., 53 ans est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi Son activité est le commerce et l’élevage. Elle vend du bissap, du mil, du niébé et élève des chèvres pour les revendre Elle veut  renforcer ses activités et contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndèye P., age 53, has been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. Her work involves commerce and raising livestock. She sells dried hibiscus flowers, millet, and black-eyed peas, and she raises goats to resell. She wants to bolster her businesses and to help support her family. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell hibiscus flowers, millet, beans, and to raise livestock

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora  Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo” D. la comunidad Kajje, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 06 hijos y tiene estudios D. primaria completa.

Ella es socia del Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 18 años y fundadora D. dicho Banco Comunal. Su primer préstamo feu D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invirtió para comprar verduras, ahora también ella se dedica a la crianza D. truchas y realiza trabajos D. agricultura para ayudar a su familia.

Ahora ella desea realizar un nuevo préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invertirá para comprar alimento para las truchas y verduras, asimismo afirma que pagara en 4 cómodas cuotas.  La señora alejandrina compra sus verduras en Tacna y los venD. en las ferias D. Juli .

Ella desea construir su casa en Juli, razón por la cual realiza diferentes actividades.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the “Maria Asunción Galindo” community bank in the Kajje community, in the Juli district, in the Chucuito province, in the Puno department. She is 54, married, and has 6 children. She completed her elementary education. She has been a member of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 18 years. She founded her community bank. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy vegetables. Now, she also raises trout and helps her family by doing agricultural work. Now she would like a new loan of 500 PEN to buy trout food and vegetables. She asserts that she will repay the loan in 4 comfortable payments. Alejandrina buys vegetables in Tacna, and she sells them at the fairs in Juli. She would like to build a house in Juli; that is why she is involved in these different enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy trout food

loans.name: Deny

texts.es:
La señora Deny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 546, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 52 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia emprendió su  negocio D. Venta D. Abarrotes, que desD. sus principios le dio buenos resultados, por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y al gusto del cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son moradores D. la comunidad, vecinos y amigos.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2500.00 que cancelará a un  plazo D. 06 meses, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como sacos arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.
Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Señora Deny belongs to the communal bank "Mariscalense" and lives in the district of Juanjui in the department of San Martín. She lives with her boyfriend, is 52, and has 2 children who still are her dependents. With her first credit of 300 PEN, she started her business of selling groceries thorugh her own initiative. Since the beginning, this has given her good results because of the quality of her products, her reasonable prices, and her customer service. Currently she has her business in her own house. Her main clients are people who live in the community, her neighbors and friends. With this loan of 2,500 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase more products to supply her business such as sacks of rice and sugar, eggs, toiletries, cleaning products, soft drinks, candy, and other products to keep her clientele happy. Tody she feels very happy with her work and the service she offers and is thankful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes that they keep doing this for a long time and help a lot of families and enterprising women.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of rice and sugar, eggs, toiletries, cleaning products, soft drinks, and candy

loans.name: Ounane

texts.fr: Ounane D., 65 ans est veuve avec 01 enfant et 01 autre en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi Ses activités  sont l’aviculture et le commerce  (vente  de charbon, d’arachide, d’oignons et d’épices). Elle veut  renforcer ses activités  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ounane D., age 65, is a widow and has one child plus one other to support. She has been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. Her businesses involve poultry farming and commerce (selling charcoal, peanuts, onions, and spices). She wants to bolster her businesses and to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell charcoal, onions, spices, peanuts, and to raise poultry

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca es una madre que trabaja por el  bienestar de sus hijos, ya que desde su separación de su pareja, tuvo que asumir el rol de padre y madre en su hogar, lo cual es muy difícil, pero cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le brindaron su casa y su cariño. Con todo los problemas que tuvo que atravesar nunca dejó de ser optimista en cuanto a su porvenir, pues tuvo las fuerzas necesarias para trabajar en muchas actividades y solventar los gastos de su hogar, como también ahorrar lo necesario para tener un negocio propio que junto a su hermana se tornó realidad, pues ambas adquirieron un puesto en el mercado hace 8 años y desde entonces no paran de trabajar, y aun más ahora que tienen pensado adquirir otro puesto. Sin embargo, para lograrlo tendrán que seguir vendiendo desde las seis de la mañana, pues las madres de familia visitan los mercados en las mañanas desde tempranas horas, teniendo las tardes libres para atender las necesidades de su hogar, pues nunca deja de cuidar de sus hijos a pesar de la recargada labor que tiene durante en día. Encontrarse en su octavo crédito con MFP la ayuda a saber que su responsabilidad dentro de su grupo no es tan sólo los pagos, sino el grado de amistad y solidaridad que hay entre todas, pues no es fácil interactuar y aprender el trabajo en equipo. La cantidad que solicita es para adquirir otro puesto en el mercado, para incrementar sus productos y capital.
texts.en:
Francisca is a mother who works for the well-being of her children. Since she separated from her husband, she has had to take on the role of both father and mother in her home, which is very difficult. But she has the support of her parents, who offered her their home and their affection. With all of the problems she had to go through, she never stopped being an optimist with regard to her future. She had all of the strength necessary to work in many jobs to pay for her home's expenses and saved enough to have her own business with her sister. Now they are planning to obtain another stand in the market. However, to accomplish this, they will have to keep selling starting at 6:00 a.m. Mothers start visiting the markets very early so they can have the afternoons free to attend to the needs of their homes. She never stops caring for her children in spite of the hard work she does during the day. This is her eighth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. It helps her to know that her responsibility within her group isn't only making her payments, but also the friendship and solidarity that the members have. It isn't easy to interact and to learn how to work in a team. The amount she is requesting will go towards acquiring another stand in the market and to increase her amount of products and capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another stand in the market

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina G. is married and has 6 dependents. She has received an education through Primary School. Georgina sells foodstuffs at Frami near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. While Georgina works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a carpenter.

Georgina uses her income to pay for household expenses and to help her husband when there is any other need. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to reinvest for the further expansion of her trade.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis D. is married and has 3 children. He has received an education through Junior High School. Francis produces and sells palm oil at Frami near Abura, which he has done for 4 years. While Francis works as a petty trader, his wife is employed as a farmer.

Francis uses his income to pay for his children's school fees and clothing. Francis will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the production and sale of palm oil by purchasing more palm fruits for the production. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to reinvest back for the further expansion of his trade in oil.

loans.use: additional capital to enable him to increase the production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. is married and has 2 children. She has received an education through Junior High School. Paulina sells groceries and foodstuffs at Frami near Abura, which she has done for 10 years. While Paulina works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer.

Paulina uses her income to pay for household expenses and to help her husband when there is any other need. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Paulina plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: additional capital to enable her to buy more foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Kwaku

texts.en:
Kwaku A. is married with three children and has received no formal education. Kwaku produces and sells palm oil at Frami near Abura, which he has done for five years. He uses his income to help pay for his family’s bills and various expenses. Kwaku’s wife also works as a trader in the Abura area.

Kwaku will use the loan as additional capital to help meet the demands of his customers. He will purchase more palm fruits for the production of the palm oil. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwaku plans to reinvest in the business for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling spare parts for bikes and more

loans.name: Salvador Mauricio

texts.es: Salvador Mauricio D. reside en Zaragoza junto a su esposa María Rivera de 30 años y sus dos hijos, Andrea de 8 años y Jonatan de 5 años de edad. A sus 31 años de edad Salvador trabaja arduamente para el bienestar de su familia, él posee una panadería en la cuál ha trabajado durante 7 años, su esposa trabaja como empleada en la panadería, y trabaja junto a él para lograr entregar todos los pedidos a tiempo, ya que esta es su única entrada económica, deben esforzarse al máximo. Salvador solícita un préstamo a través de cual pueda obtener el capital de trabajo necesario para poder comprar harina y azúcar para el pan que fabrica, de manera que pueda producir más pan y aumentar sus ventas, de esta forma podrá mejorar la economía de su familia y al mismo tiempo podrá mejorar su negocio produciendo más pan y obteniendo nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Salvador Mauricio D. lives in Zaragoza with his wife Mária Rivera, who is 30 years old, and their two children, Andrea, 8, and Jonatan, 5. At 31 years of age, Salvador works hard for the well-being of his family. He owns a bakery, which he has worked at for 7 years. His wife works as an employee at the bakery and works alongside him to fill all of their orders on time. Because this is their only income-earning activity, they have to give it their all. Salvador is requesting this loan to be able to buy more flour and sugar for the bread that he makes so that he can produce more and increase his sales. This was he can improve his family's finances while at the same time improve his store, making more bread and attracting new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agriculture and rising poultry

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora, es Socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos , que está ubicado en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz Provincia del collao, Departamento de Puno.  Ella tiene 44 años, de estado civil casada, con
5 hijos, y tiene estudios primarios completos.
La señora trabaja con el Movimento Manuela Ramos desde hace 12 años, y es una de las socias fundadoras, su préstamo inicial fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo cual le permitió mejorar su negocio  surtiendolo con mas productos requeridos por sus clientes.
En la actualidad, ella requiere de un prestamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos Soles para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos asi mismo poder comercializar en las diferentes ferias de su zona,  asi tambien ella desea comprar un vehículo para poder trasladar los productos con mayor facilidad, con el apoyo de su esposo.  Tanbien nos comenta que le gusta mucho su grupo ya que son unidas y muy colaboradoras, y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por apoyar de alguna manera a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora C. M. is a member of the Communal Bank Manuela Ramos, which is located in the Mazo-Cruz district, Callao province, Puno department. She is 44 years old, is married and has five children. She completed primary school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years and is one of the founding members. Her first loan was of 300 nuevo soles, and it allowed her to improve her store, supplying it with more products needed by her customers.

Now she needs a loan of 3000 nuevo soles to be able to buy more products and b sell in different markets in the area. She also wants to buy a vehicle to be able to move her products more easily, with the help of her husband. She has also told us that she really likes her group because they are very close and co-operative. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women in many ways.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, pasta, milk and other packaged foods

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La señora Otilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 03 hijos, ella posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 03 años, se retiró un tiempo por motivos D. salud; actualmente ella se dedica al engorD.  D. animales menores y mayores, producción D. leche; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar ovejas para engorD.. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo desea adquirir ovejas y crías D. vacunos para engorD. y crecimiento; su deseo es ver a sus hijos profesionales en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Otilia P. T. D. T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“ ("Women working for development") in the district of Cabanilla, Lampa province, Puno department. She is 47 years old, is married and has three children. She has not finished primary studies, having reached only the fifth graD..

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. She retired for some time for health reasons. Now she works in raising small and large animals (fattening them) and milk production. Her first loan was of 500 nuevo soles, which she used to buy sheep to fatten.

Now she would like an additional loan of 500 nuevo soles. She promises to pay this back in 6 payments. With this loan she wants to buy calves to fatten and grow. Her wish it to see her children become professional workers soon.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small livestock (sheep) and heifers

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, madre de 02 hijos  y ella tiene estudio de primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03  años, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo comprar buzos, chompas y otros. Ella trae la mercadería de Juliaca y desaguadero y los vende en Juli e Ilave. 
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para aumentar su capital de su negocio. Ella se siente feliz por que quiere seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos y agradece por su apoyo.

La señora Justina desea comprarse una casa en Juli y que  sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Mrs. Justina M. C. is a member of the Communal Bank “María Asunción Galindo" in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 28 years old and married. She has 2 children. She finished primary school studies.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her business is in buying and selling in clothes. Her first loan was of 300 nuevo soles, with which she bought track suits, sweaters, and other articles of clothing. She brings her products from Juliaca and Desaguadero and she sells them in Juli and Llave.

Now she needs a loan of 500 nuevo soles. She promises to pay it back in four monthly payments. This loan will help her increase her business capital. She is happy because she wants to continue working with Manuela Ramos and is grateful for the support.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tracksuits, sweaters, polos, etc.

loans.name: Angelica Virginia

texts.es:
Señora Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo  y tiene estudio superior.

Trabaja hace 04 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y posee un negocio de Artesanías, su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió como capital para comprar lana y otros enseres para tejidos. Ella en la actualidad se dedica a la crianza de trucha; negocio que le va bien.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, comprará lana de alpaca y sintética al por mayor; y con las ganancias piensa darles una mejor educación y alimentación a sus hijos.  Esta comprometida a pagar de manera puntual sus 04 cuotas. 

Ella desea tener una empresa propia de trucha y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Virginia is a partner of the "María Asunción Galindo" community bank. She lives in the district of Juli, in the Chucuito province of the state of Puno. She is 29 years old and lives with her partner and son. Virginia has a higher education. Virginia has worked with Manuela Ramos for the past four years, and she owns a handicraft business. her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy wool and other inputs for weaving. Now she raises trout, and the business is doing well. With this loan of 500 soles, Virginia will buy alpaca wool and synthetic fibers in wholesale quantities. She hopes to use her earnings to give her children a better education and a more nutritious diet. She's promised to repay punctually in four installments. Virginia would like to have her own trout business and become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool and fibers as well as trout food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy large livestock to raise

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.en:
The “Renaissance” Bank is a made of fifteen people - male and female entrepreneurs. There 3 groups that make up the bank receiving a loan. After successfully repaying their 1S.and 2nd loans they are looking forward to the continuing success and growth of their businesses with their 3rd loan. Though small, the group has a wide rA. of businesses: from cosmetics to artwork. 

ClosS. G. is the president of the group. He is a husband and father of 7 children. This hardworking dad sells a variety of products including cosmetics, notebooks, and artwork.  As a result of his hard work and with the help of the previous loans, his business has increased profits. He is grateful for the experience because prior to the loan it was difficult to afford paying for the children’s food and schooling. The experience of borrowing has made these expenses more manageable.  He also contributes his strengthened relationship and faith in God to his interaction with Esperanza and the staff. He realizes that his story isn’t unique in that there are many people in the area who are experiencing more success and are able to feed and educate their children. On behalf of ClosS., Renaissance and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase lotions, cosmetics, notebooks, writing materials, artwork for their businesses.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 23 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene un hijo y posee estudios de superior incompleta ya que no pudo terminar sus estudios de “Educación”.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en su tienda de Abarrotes ya que con dicho dinero compra mercadería para su negocio.
Actualmente ella requiere otro préstamo, por tanto viene solicitando la suma de S/1500.00 nuevos soles, con el dinero piensa invertirlo en adquirir mas productos para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Juliana is a member of the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Communal Bank in the Mazo-Cruz District of Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old with a son, and lives with her domestic partner. She has attended high school but didn't graduate because she was not able to finish her studies in Education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past year. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols which she invested in her grocery store with the funds being used to buy merchandise for the business. Currently she needs another loan which she is now requesting in the amount of 1,500 New Sols. She intends to invest this in acquiring some more merchandise to stock up her grocery store. She feels very grateful for the support which Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER has provided.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 50 años D. edad, es Viuda, madre D. 05 hijos y tiene estudio D. primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 08  años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercaderías como azúcar arroz, harina y otros productos. Ella tiene un kiosco en el mercado D. Juli. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 04 cuotas mensuales; comprará mercadería al por mayor (arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.). Con las ganancias ella pretenD. construir su casa, asimismo apoyar la educación D. sus hijos.
 
Ella se muestra agradecida a Manuela Ramos y a su personal por todo lo que vienen haciendo en favor D. las mujeres.
texts.en:
Elena is a partner in the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank in the district of Juli, in the Chucuito province of the state of Puno. Elena is 50 years old and a widow. She has five children and has completed primary school. Elena has worked with Manuela Ramos for eight years. She buys and sells groceries, and her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour, and other products. She has a kiosk in Juli's market. With this loan of 500 soles, Elena will buy wholesale merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, etc). She'll repay the loan in four monthly installments. With her earnings Elena would like to build a home and support her children's education. Elena would like to thank Manuela Ramos and its staff for all that they do to support women.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es una alegre madre de familia que a raíz de su separación tuvo que mantener su hogar, que gracias al apoyo que recibe de sus padres puede solventar las necesidades de sus hijos. A ella siempre le gusto bien arreglada, tuvo el interés de estudiar cosmetología, y aprendió no sólo a realizar algunos cortes, sino que también puede hacer tratamientos de limpieza, masajes y diversos tratamientos de la piel. Desde que sus padres le brindaron un local dentro de su casa  abrió un salón de belleza, el cual tiene 2 años de funcionamiento y cada día brinda la mejor atención a sus clientas que fielmente la visitan cada mes. Gladys tiene el anhelo de instalar un Spa dentro de su local, por lo cual requiere ambientar y ampliar su espacio para brindar diversos servicios de belleza a las personas, pero por falta de capital no puede realizarlo, por lo cual se dedica todos los días a su salón de belleza desde las nueve de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, pues trata de descansar temprano para atender a su hija quien también requiere de su atención. Gladys está solicitando un crédito individual con MFP, pues no cuenta con horas libres para agruparse con las señoras que conformaban los grupos o bancos comunales. Los 3000 soles los invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza que requiere para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is a happy mother. Because of her separation, she became responsible for taking care of her home. Thanks to the support she gets from her parents, she can provide for her children. She has always liked to be well kept, and she was interested in studying cosmetology. She learned not only how to cut hair, but she also learned how to give cleansing treatments, massages, and different skin treatments. Since her parents provided a place in their home, she opened a beauty salon two years ago. Every day she offers better service to her customers who loyally visit every month. Gladys wants to put a Spa on the premises. To do that, she needs to set up and expand her space to offer diverse beauty services. But, she cannot do that due to lack of funds. To that end, she works in the beauty salon every day from nine in the morning until six in the evening. She tries to rest early so that she can see to her daughter who needs her attention. Gladys is asking for an individual credit from MFP. She does not have the free time to join the women who make up the community banks. She will use the 3,000 PEN to buy the beauty supplies she needs to take care of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
La señora Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 03 hijos.  Estudio hasta cuarto de secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, inicio su negocio de artesanías (bordados); tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió  como capital adicional, compro lana de distintos colores y bayetas, crochet y otros.

Con este crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles comprará más material (lana, accesorios, etc.) con el fin de continuar elaborando sus bordados, los mismos que los comercializa en las ferias de Juli y ella desea llevar su producto a otras zonas de la región; finalmente ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus 04 cuotas según lo acordado.

La señora Genoveva desea comprar su casa y poner una tienda de artesanía.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 47, in a common law marriage, and has 3 children. She attended school until her fourth year of high school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She started her handicrafts (embroidery) business, and she had an initial loan of 300 PEN as additional capital. She bought different colors of wool, fabric, crochet, and other items. With this loan for 300 PEN, she will buy material (wool, accessories, etc.) to make embroideries that she will sell at the fairs in Juli. She would like to take her products to other zones in the region. She promises to repay the loan in 4 payments on time, as agreed upon. Genoveva would like to buy a house and open a handicrafts store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wool and fabric

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, pues gracias a su trabajo ayudó a su pareja en la compra de la casa donde viven, junto a su hija y nieto. Al llegar a la capital se dio cuenta de la escasez de productos y los costosos precios con los que vendían, entonces tuvo la idea de traer productos de su tierra tales como: manzanas, ciruelos y diversas variedades de frutas que ella misma produce en sus terrenos de cultivos para así venderlos en la capital. Inicio su actividad como comerciante hace 15 años y la experiencia que tiene la ayuda a invertir su dinero en negocios rentables como la venta de comida, pues junto a las frutas que vende en el mercado, empezó a vender tamales. Con el tiempo espera juntar el capital suficiente para abrir una tienda en su casa donde venda los productos que produce y deje de salir a las calles. Gloria trabaja con MFP hace 5 años, este es su octavo crédito y formar parte un banco comunal donde la motivaron a seguir desarrollándose con responsabilidad y trabajo. Sus terrenos de cultivo requieren de abono y semillas para incrementar su producción y esta es la razón por la que solicita 2800 soles.
texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and is a very hard working woman. Thanks to her work she helped her partner with the purchase of the house where they live, together with their daughter and grandson. When she first arrived in the capital city, she noticed the scarcity of products and the high prices they were sold at. Then she had the idea to bring products from her own land such as apples, plums, and various varieties of fruits that she herself grows in her cultivated fields, and sell them in the capital. She started this commercial activity 15 years ago and the experience she has helps her to invest her money in profitable businesses like the sale of food since, in addition to the fruits she sells in the market, she began to sell tamales. With time she hopes to get together sufficient capital to open a store in her house where she will sell the products she produces and give up going out to the streets to sell. Gloria has worked with MFP for 5 years. This is her eighth loan. She belongs to a community bank where they motivate her to continue advancing herself through responsibility and work. Her cultivated land requires fertilizer and seeds to increase production and this is the reason she is seeking 2800 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertlizer and seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, no tiene  hijos  y estudio primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 años, inició su negocio de crianza de truchas; tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió  como capital adicional para comprar alimento para sus truchas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos, comprará alimento para truchas. Afirma que este negocio le va bien solo que las ganancias demoran (es poco lento).
Ella desea seguir trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus 04 cuotas.

La señora Flora desea comprar una casa en Ilave.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora is a member of The Community Bank Maria Asuncion Galindo, in Juli district, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, has no children, and completed primary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year and started her business of raising trout. She had an initial loan of 300.00 new soles which was used as additional capital to buy feed for the trout. With this loan of 500.00 new soles, she will buy feed for the trout. She claims that this business is going well, only that the profits are delayed (a little slow). She wants to continue working with the Manuela Ramos Movement and agrees to punctually make her four payments. Mrs. Flora wants to buy a house in Ilave.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feed for the trout

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 65 años D. edad, es casada, madre D. 04 hijos.  No tiene estudios.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 12 años.  Ella se dedica a la crianza D. truchas por lo que su primer préstamo que solicitó fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar alimento para las truchas.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará mallas y otros materiales que necesita para su trabajo; con lo cual pretenD. incrementar sus ganancias y seguir ayudando con los gastos familiares, así como en los estudios D. sus hijos. 

Ella desea seguir trabajando, y se compromete a pagar sus 04 cuotas D. manera puntual, para lo cual agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabina is a member of the communal bank “Maria Asuncion Galindo” in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito, in the Region of Puno. She is 65 years old, married, the mother of four children, and uneducated.

She has been working with the movement Manuela Ramos for 12 years. She is in the raising of trout, for which her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN helped her to buy food for the trout.

With this loan of 1500 PEN she will purchase mesh and other materials that she needs for her work, with which she hopes to increase her income and continue helping with the family expenses, such as the studies of her children.

She wants to continue working, and she commits to make her four payments punctually, and she appreciates Manuela Ramos for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase balanced food for trout

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica es esposa y madre, tiene dos hijos quienes son la prioridad en su vida y trata de  satisfacer sus necesidades, junto a su esposo, esperan tener pronto una casa propia donde vivir,  ya que por el momento se encuentra en la casa de sus padres. En el tiempo que lleva viviendo con su pareja ha tratado de apoyarlo para aminorar el gasto de mantener el hogar, hace 3 años viene trabajando como promotora de belleza de diversas líneas cosméticas que le brindan las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo, pues mensualmente tiene que buscar clientas quienes realicen sus pedidos en base a catálogos. Su trabajo es muy cansado, pues tiene que caminar largas horas por las calles con el fin de incrementar sus pedidos y obtener un buen porcentaje por la compra de cada producto. Por ello, trata de aprovechar las ofertas, para adquirir los productos en grandes cantidades y venderlos luego a sus clientes a precio normal, aumentando así sus ganancias de manera rápida. Jessica ha llegado a amar su trabajo y desea involucrarse aun más, hasta llegar a ser una empresaria de líneas de cosméticos. También es socia fundadora de su grupo que conformó en MFP, este es su octavo crédito, y todos estos años se ha dado cuenta que el trabajo que realizan la llevo a madurar y asumir retos en los negocios. Los 2500 soles solicitados los usará para adquirir grandes cantidades de productos, pues las ofertas por el día de la madre han aminorado los precios de los productos.
texts.en:
Jessica is a wife and mother. She has two children who are her priority in life and she tries to satisfy their needs. She and her husband hope to have their own house to live in soon. Right now they live in her parents' house. In the time she has lived with her husband, she has tried to support him with their home's expenses. She has worked for three years selling cosmetics. Every month she has to look for customers who will order from her catalogs. Her job is tiring. She has to walk for long hours on the streets with the goal of increasing her orders and obtaining a good percentage of the purchase of each product. Because of this, she tries to make the most of sales and acquire products in large quantities and sell them to her customers at the normal price so she can increase her profits quickly. Jessica has come to love her job and hopes to get involved in it even more, until she can hire other people to sell one of the lines of cosmetics. She is also the social chair of her group that works with Microfinanzas Prisma. This is her eighth credit, and in all of these years, she has noticed that the work they do has made her mature and take on challenges in her business. The 2,500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to acquire large quantities of products since the Mother's Day sales have lowered their prices.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es padre de familia y su deber como esposo y padre lo motivaron en salir adelante con tal de brindar lo necesario a sus seres queridos, quienes se sienten muy contentos por tener un padre quien les brindo un hogar para vivir y un amor incondicional para progresar. Para él ha sido difícil mantener un hogar, pues sólo contaba con algunos trabajos eventuales y sus pagos eran muy escasos, y con la idea de tener un negocio propio, desde hace 10 años abrió una tienda, la cual le dio la oportunidad de crecer económicamente y ofrecerles a sus pequeños hijos una educación de calidad. Pero fue muy difícil mantener su negocio por los altos costos de la mercadería y en muchas ocasiones lo desanimaron a seguir, pero con el apoyo de sus familiares tuvo la valentía de seguir trabajando a pesar de las horas de sacrificio, pues hubo días  que tuvo que  atender su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo fue ordenando sus horas de atención y ahora tiene un negocio próspero, ahora le preocupa contar con algunos productos que incrementen su clientela, es por ello que tiene pensado modificar su tienda y surtirla de otros productos adicionales para dar variedad a su bodega. Jorge es socio fundador de su grupo y está en su quinto crédito con MFP, además espera seguir manteniendo a su grupo tan unido, pues una de las características dentro de esta agrupación. Los 1300 soles que solicita los invertirá en mejorar su bodega, obteniendo nuevos productos  que aumenten sus ingresos y clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is a father, and his obligation as a father and husband motivates him to get ahead and to offer his loved ones everything they need. They feel very happy to have a father who offers them a home and unconditional love. It has been difficult to support his home, though. He only used to work in temporary jobs, which did not pay very well. Ten years ago he opened up his own store, which gave him the opportunity to grow economically and to offer his small children a quality education. It was very difficult to support his business because of the high costs of merchandise, which on many occasions made him want to quit. But with the support of his family members, he had the courage to keep working in spite of the hours of sacrifice. There were days when he had to attend to his business from very early in the morning until late at night. With time, he structured his business's hours and now has a prosperous business. Now he would like to supply his business with additional products to increase his clientele. Jorge is the social chair of his group, and this is his fifth credit with Microfinanzas Prisma. He hopes to keep his group united because it is one of the characteristics that defines them. He will invest the 1,300 PEN in improving his store and obtaining new products so he can increase his income and number of customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly es una mujer muy comprometida con sus roles como madre y esposa, pues trata de brindar lo mejor de sí, y a pesar de vivir en la casa de sus padres no deja de tener el anhelo de, algún día, adquirir su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años está dedicada a la venta de comida, lo cual realiza en la puerta de su casa, todos los días desde las seis de la tarde hasta las once de la noche, pues sus clientes son sus vecinos, quienes retornan a sus hogares por las noches deseando consumir algunos gustitos y aperitivos que doña Kelly prepara. Sin embargo, esta actividad suele ser peligrosa los fines de semana, por las fiestas que se realizan, lo cual trae granes ganancias, pero se arriesga a que algunos ladrones puedan asaltarla, es por ello que desea instalar un restaurante en la casa de sus padres para dejar de trabajar por las noches y dedicarse en las mañanas a preparar diversos platillos que vendería en el transcurso del día. El tiempo que tiene en MFP es de 3 años, época de nuevos retos, ya que su grupo es muy exigente frente al pago puntual de los créditos. Los 1000 soles solicitados la ayudaran para invertir en la compra de utensilios que requiere para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kelly is a woman who is very dedicated to her roles as a mother and a wife. She tries to give her best. Although she lives in her parents' house, she doesn't give up on the dream of some day having her own home. For ten years she has sold meals, which she does in front of her home every day from 6:00-11:00 p.m. Her customers are her neighbors, who come over hoping to eat something that Kelly has made. Her job tends to be dangerous on the weekends due to the parties that happen. She earns a lot of profit, but she risks being robbed by thieves. This is why she hopes to put a restaurant in her parents' house so she can stop working at night and prepare food in the morning that she can sell throughout the day. In the time that she has worked with Microfinanzas Prisma, it has been a period of new challenges because her group is very demanding about making punctual payments. The 1,000 PEN that she is requesting will help her invest in the purchase of utensils that she needs to attend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of utensils for her business

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor quedó viuda a los 45 años, y tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su pequeña hija a quien trata de darle las mejores condiciones de vida con el apoyo que recibe de sus padres, quienes le brindaron un lugar donde vivir. Ahora está empeñada en convertir su tienda en una librería para los escolares de la zona, donde puedan conseguir los materiales educativos que necesiten, pero por ahora está trabajando duramente en su negocio y acaba de instalar un teléfono público que la ayuda atraer a las personas a su tienda y hacerse conocida dentro de su localidad. Su problema es el costo del alquiler del local donde está instalada hace 4 años, pues su deseo es seguir creciendo con miras a conseguir  una casa propia y trasladar su negocio. Mientras tanto seguirá trabajando como siempre atendiendo a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad, brindándoles los productos necesarios en cualquier momento del día, pues su negocio está a disponibilidad del cliente desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y espera que su permanencia dentro de su grupo sea de gran provecho. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio de nuevos y necesarios productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leonor, a widow at 45, is responsible for watching over her small daughter. With help from her parents, who give her a place to live, Leonar tries to give her daughter the best living conditions. She is determined to convert her store into a book store so the school children of the zone can find all the educational materials they need. For now she is working hard in her business. She just finished having a public telephone installed, and that will help her attract people to her store. It will also make her known in the area. Her problem is the rental cost of her business location, which she has been in for 4 years. Meanwhile, she will keep working, like always, to kindly tend to her customers and offer them what they need at all times. Her business is open from seven in the morning until ten at night. This is her first loan with MFP. She hopes that staying in the group will be very beneficial. She will use the money to buy merchandise to stock her business with new and needed products for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo” de la comunidad Kajje, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, madre de 06 hijos y tiene estudios secundarios incompleto (tercero).

Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 años y es fundadora de dicho Banco Comunal. Afirma que posee un negocio de ferretería. Su primer préstamo  fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invirtió para comprar serruchos, cables de luz, desarmadores, bisagras y otros. Ella compra sus productos en el distrito de Desaguadero, Tacna y los vende en Ilave.

Con el préstamo que solicitara  de S/ 400.00 nuevos soles se proveerá de más mercadería para tener mas variedad en su negocio (candados, chapas, llaves).  Este crédito será pagado en 04 cuotas.

La señora Magdalena desea seguir trabajando para que sus hijos menores continúen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” community bank in the Kajje community, Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 51, married, and has 6 children. She attended school until the third year of high school. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 18 year. She is the founder of her community bank. She has a hardware store. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought saws, light cables, screwdrivers, hinges, and others. She buys her products in the Desaguadero, Tacna district; she sells them in Ilave. With a loan of 400 PEN she will get more merchandise to have greater variety in her business (locks, metal plates, keys). She will repay the loan in 4 payments. Magdalena wants to keep working so that her minor children can continue their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy box of locks, metal plates and keys.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer de 43 años, desde que se separó de su pareja salió adelante con sus cuatro hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y por quienes se esforzó para brindarles un techo donde vivir. Desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de diversos productos que la llevaron a conseguir un negocio propio donde ahora trabajan ella y su hermana, juntas compraron un puesto en el mercado de su localidad hace tres años. Durante todo este tiempo se esfuerza al máximo para brindar a sus clientes la mejor atención y los mejores productos para su consumo. Es por ello que todos los días se levanta de madrugada para preparar los diversos condimentos que vende, lo cual es muy trabajoso, pero con el apoyo de su hermana sus actividades son menores. Con el tiempo, ambas desean incrementar sus productos para que su puesto siga creciendo y ser  dentro del mercado muy reconocido. En MFP tiene 5 años, este es su octavo préstamo, y dentro del grupo que integra se siente muy contenta, pues entre todas se apoyan y animan cuando pasan por dificultades, además su grupo se caracteriza por ser un equipo muy cumplido con sus responsabilidades. Los 2000 soles de crédito los invertirá en la compra de mercadería para surtir y diversificar su puesto con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old. Since she separated from her partner, she has forged ahead as a single mother of four children, who are her greatest treasure and for whom she struggles to provide a roof over their heads. Since she was very young she has worked at selling a variety of products, which has allowed her to establish her own business where she and her sister work. Together, they purchased a spot in the local market three years ago. During all this time, she has striven to provide the best attention and superior products to her clients. Every day, she gets up at dawn to prepare diverse condiments to sell. It is very labor-intensive, but with the support of her sister, the work is not so bad. In the future, they both hope to expand their product selection so that their business continues to grow, and to become very well-known within the market. They have been a part of Microfinanzas PRISMA for five years, and this will be their eighth loan. They are very happy with their loan group because all the members support one other and encourage each other in difficult times. In addition, the group is known for always fulfilling their responsibilities. María will use the 2000 soles of credit to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock and diversify her business with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in new products

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora  Edith es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo” del sector Kajje de la comunidad Chucasuyo, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudio de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 años y es fundadora del dicho Banco Comunal, tuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual pudo comprar ropa de adultos y bebes; este negocio le va bien, asimismo ella compra  su mercadería en los distritos de Desaguadero, Juliaca y los vende en la comunidad y en Ilave.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará prendas de vestir como chompas, camisas, medias, etc.  De esta manera pretende ayudar económicamente a su hijo.  Este crédito será pagado en 4 cuotas. 
La señora Edith desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a su hijo y comprarse una casa en Juliaca.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank, in the Kajje section of the community of Chucasuyo, district of Juliaca, Chucuito province in the department of Puno. She is 29 years old, lives with her common-law husband, is the mother of 1 child and completed her secondary school studies. For the past 18 years she has worked with Manuela Ramos and is a founder of her communal bank. Her first loan was for S/. 300 new soles and with that she was able to buy clothing for adults and children. Her business is going well for her. She buys merchandise in the districts of Desaguadero and Juliaca and she sells it in her community. With this loan for S/. 500 new soles she will buy clothing such as sweaters, shirts, socks, etc. In this way she tries to support her son financially. The loan will be paid in 4 installments. Edith would like to keep working to help her son and to buy a house in Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, shirts and socks.

loans.name: Faaosofia

texts.en: Faaosofia S., 40, is married with 6 children.  She has 5 years experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the people of the village, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 100 Tala (~55 USD).  SPBD loans are Faaosofia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer, knives, gloves and vegetable seeds for vegetable gardening.

loans.name: Narcisa Silvia

texts.es: La Señora Narcisa Silvia Rodríguez tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Narcisa tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica es costurera. Hace más de 20 años. Dio inicio con pocas telas  por lo que elaboro sabanas, y mas tarde las comercializaba en el mercado, por lo que la ubicación de su negocio es su casa de habitación. Doña Narcisa es una mujer muy luchadora por que ha tenido que salir adelante es por eso que sus propósitos son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y escojan las diferentes opciones. Y es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas para apoyarla en capital de trabajo y además comprar materia prima como tela, agujas, tijeras, hilos y ziper. Y el sueño de Narcisa es establecer un taller de costura para apoyar a otras personas que necesitan trabajo.
texts.en:
Narcisa Silvia Rodríguez is 44 years old and is single. Doña Narcisa has 2 children and they both study. She has worked as a seamstress for more than 20 years. She started her business with a small amount of material and made sheets. Later on she sold them in the market and her business is located in her home. Doña Narcisa is a hard-working woman who has had to struggle to get ahead. One of her objectives is to improve the quality of her products and offer variety to her customers so they can choose from different options. This is why she turned to Fundación León 2000 and other related organizations to receive support for working capital and to buy supplies such as material, needles, scissors, thread and zippers. Narcisa´s dream is to set up a dressmaking workshop in order to support other persons who need work.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth Elizabeth C. de 56 años de edad, reside en colonia San Patricio junto a sus dos hijos, David de 20 y Vrenaly de 13 años de edad y junto a su compañero de vida de 72 años de edad. Ruth posee su propio negocio desde hace 20 años, en el cual comercializa ropa para niños y adultos, así también vende comida típica como lo es la yuca frita, enchiladas, entre otras más. Ruth solícita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda obtener el dinero necesario para poder construir un cuarto adicional en su lugar de residencia, ya que a pesar que su esposo y su hijo mayor trabajan, no le es necesario para poder invertir en la construcción de un nuevo cuarto, es por ello que Ruth desea obtener el capital necesario para poder ampliar su hogar y poder vivir de una manera más cómoda en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ruth Elizabeth C. is 56 years old. She lives in the San Patricio neighborhood with her two children, David, 20 and Vrenaly, 13, and with her lifeling companion who is 72 years old. Ruth has owned her own business for the past 20 years. She sells clothing for children and adults and also sells regional foods such as fried yucca, enchiladas and others. Ruth is asking for a loan so that she can have enough month to build another room onto her house. In spite of the fact that her husband and oldest son work, she does not want them to have to invest in the construction of the new room. Ruth hopes to get the funding needed to build onto her house and to be able to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi T., 38, is married and has 3 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the people in the market, 2 days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 120 Tala (~65USD).  SPBD loans are Aliitasi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used for the business and for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase timber, iron roofing, cement, vegetable seeds and sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa es socia del banco comunal “María Asunción Galindo” de la comunidad Kajje, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, madre de 03 hijos, tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 18 años y es fundadora de dicho Banco Comunal.  Inició su préstamo con S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió para comprar algunas truchas.

Debido a la demanda que tuvo en este negocio, ella desea prestarse la suma de S/. 700.00  Nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, le servirá como capital adicional para poder adquirir alimento para sus truchas; con ello contribuirá a mejorar la calidad económica de su familia y los estudios de sus hijos, por lo  mismo agradece al Moviento Manuela Ramos por la confianza y su apoyo a las mujeres.
Ella desea comprarse casa en Juli  y ayudar a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "María Asunción Galindo" communal bank in the community of Kajje, Juli district, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, is the mother of 3 children and did not complete her primary school studies (second grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 18 years and is a founder of the communal bank. She started with a loan for S/. 300 new soles with which she bought trout. Because of the demand her business had, she would like to borrow S/. 700 new soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, to use as extra working capital to buy feed for her trout. With this she will be able to contribute to her family´s economy and to her children´s education. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for their trust and for their support to women. She hopes to buy a house in Juli and to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed for trout.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: La Señora Dolores M. M. tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Dolores tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que desde muy joven ha luchado por mantener este negocio que le ayudo a educar a sus hijos. Es por eso que el propósito de Doña Dolores es mejorar la calidad de los nacatamales ya que así no perdería a sus clientes, ya que sin ellos no podría generar los ingresos necesarios para su negocio. El financiamiento que Dolores solicita es para capital de trabajo y así invertir en materia prima como maíz, carne, leña y otros. Su mayor sueño es establecer un restaurante para ofrecer sus nacatamales.
texts.en:
Dolores M. M. is 55 years old and single. Doña Dolores has 3 children, all of whom work. Her business is selling nacatamales (regional tamales from Nicaragua). She has been doing this for 10 years and from early on struggled to keep the business afloat which helped her pay for the education for her children. For this reason the goal of Doña Dolores is to improve the quality of her nacatamales so that she does not lose any customers, because without them she would not be able to generate income. The loan that Dolores is requesting is for working capital so she can buy ingredients and supplies such as corn, meat, firewood and other things. Her greatest dream is to establish a restaurant where she can serve her nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
La señora Nolberta es socia del Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno. Tiene 47 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de 01 hijo.  No tiene estudios.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, ella es artesana (bordados) y realiza crianza de truchas.  Obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que le sirvió para comprar bayetas (telas), lana y otros materiales que necesita. 

Con este crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará materia prima (lana, bayetas por mayor, etc.) con ello  incrementará sus ganancias y ayudará a mantener a su hijo y en los gastos de sus estudios.  Agradece  al Movimiento Manuel Ramos por su Confianza y su apoyo.
texts.en:
Señora Nolberta is a member of the commual bank, "María Asunción Galindo," in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno. She is 47, lives with her boyfriend, and has one son. She did not go to school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years. She does embroidery and raises trout. She received her first loan of 300 PEN and used it to purchase fabric, wool, and other materials that she needed. With this loan of 500 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy supplies (wool, wholesale fabric, etc.). With the loan, she will increase her profits and help support her son and his educational costs. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for their confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, wool, and trout food

loans.name: Noel Anselmo

texts.es:
El Señor Noel Anselmo Juárez Días tiene la edad de 66 años, su estado civil es casado. 
Don Anselmo tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Anselmo es transporte de carga. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que anteriormente no tenía trabajo y la su único medio de supervivencia. Los propósitos de Don Anselmo son de ofrecer los mejores servicios con su negocio. Ya que su edad es muy difícil encontrar otro trabajo es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para comprar repuestos de llantas para su camión, luces y algunas mejoras. Es por esto que el sueño de Anselmo es obtener las suficientes ganancias para dejar de trabajar ya que a su edad es muy difícil encontrar otro trabajo.
texts.en:
Noel Anselmo Juárez Días, 66, is married and has 4 children who all work. Anselmo transports cargo, and he has been doing this for 15 years. Before that he did not have work, and it is the only way he can survive. In his business he wants to offer the best services. At his age it is difficult to find other work. That is why he is asking for a loan for working capital to buy replacement tires for his truck, lights and other improvements. For this reason his dream is to get enough financing so that he will not have to find other work. At his age it is hard to find another job.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilria Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres progresinas”, de la comunidad Casa Blanca, distrito de Asillo, Provincia de Azángaro, en el departamento de Puno; ella tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 02 hijos y está casada.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa. 

La señora Julia Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses aproximadamente, posee un negocio de compra y venta de ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en capital para comprar animales como ovejas y cerdos, este negocio le da buenas ganancias.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, que será pagadoa en 4 cuotas, comprará ganado mayor. Ella piensa obtener mejores ganancias  para tener un buen ingreso para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is a member of the Mujeres Progresinas (Progressive Women) Communal Banks in the community of Case Blanca, Asillo District, Azángaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years of age, married and the mother of two children. She has completed her secondary education. Julia has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for about the last six months. She has a business buying and selling small livestock. Her first loan was for 300 New Sols, which provided her the capital to buy animals such as sheep and pigs. This business brings her a good income. With this loan of 1,000 New Sols, which will be repaid in four installments, she will buy large livestock. She hopes to obtain better earnings so that she will have a good income in order to help her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large livestock

loans.name: Sofia Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora Sofía Esperanza S. T. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Sofía tiene 1 hijo y estudia. La actividad económica de Doña Sofía es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que la ubicación es en su casa de habitación. Doña Sofía ha recibido varios prestamos Fundación León 2000, y esto le ha ayudado a invertir cada día en su negocio. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mantener activo este negocio para que el día de mañana pueda generarle los ingresos necesarios. Es por eso que solicita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo incrementando sus productos como gaseosas, refrescos naturales, pan, golosinas, granos básicos y otros productos de consumo en general. El sueño de Sofía es darle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda ya que se acerca el invierno y quiere estar preparada.
texts.en:
Señora Sofía Esperanza S. T. is 47 years of age and single. She has one son who is still in school. Doña Sofía's business is a local store which is located in the house where she lives. She has been running it for more than five years. Doñia Sofía has received several loans from Fundación Leon 2000 and this has helped her to invest in her business every day. Her goal is to keep this business operating so that in the future it can bring her a sufficient income. That's why she is requesting financing for the working capital to stock up on products such as carbonated drinks, natural soft drinks, bread, sweets, basic cereals and other products for general consumption. Sofía's dream is to make some necessary improvements to her house, now that winter is coming, and she wants to be prepared

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, en el distrito de Mazo-Cruz,Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo. Estudio primaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años y se dedica ala venta de artefactos asi como tanbien se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.  Su primer prestamo fue de 300.00 Nuevos Soles el cual le permitió aumentar su capital.
Con este préstamo de 800.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará animales para su crianza y posteriormente venta de los mismos.
Su deseo es construir su casa ya que ella cuenta con el terreno.  Está muy agardecida con Manuela Ramos y el apoyo que les da la promotora de crédito.  Además recibe capacitación.
texts.en:
Señora Irma is a member of the Manuela Ramos communal bank in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 25, lives with her boyfriend, and has one son. She completed primary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years and sells various items and also buys and sells livestock. Her first loan of 300 PEN let her increase her capital. With this loan of 800 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, ahd will buy animals to raise and to later sell. Her wish is to build her own home since she already has the land. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos and the support they give her. She also receives training from them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Sujayla Del Rosario

texts.es: La Joven Sujayla del Rosario A. M. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada. Sujayla tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Sujayla es la elaboración de repostería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella hornea todos los días de la semana y sale a entregar sus productos al mercado municipal a sus clientes, por lo que tiene que regresar de nuevo a recoger su ganancia. Por lo que sus propósitos son de mantener a sus clientes ya que ellos son la base para que su negocio continúe. Sujayla no posee ayudantes y trabaja sola por su propia cuenta. Es por eso que solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la inversión de materia de prima como azúcar, huevos, mantequilla y harina. El deseo de Sujayla es establecer una panadería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sujayla del Rosario A. M. is 39 years old, married and has 3 children who attend school.

Sujayla started a baking business over 7 years ago. She bakes every day of the week and delivers her products to her customers in the municipal market. She has to return to receive payment. She wants to maintain this customer base to keep her business going. Sujayla works alone without any assistants.

This is why she is requesting a loan for working capital to purchase basic ingredients like sugar, eggs, butter and flour. Sujayla’s wish is to establish a bakery in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Gladis del Carmen C. D. A. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango junto a sus dos hijos mayores D. edad, los cuales estudian en la universidad y su esposo que trabaja como comerciante. Gladis se dedica a vender ropa en el mercado D. Soyapango, ella comercializa todos los días su producto con el fin D. poder contribuir junto a su esposo a solventar los gastos del hogar, ya que sus dos hijos asisten a la universidad y esto les genera un gasto bastante alto, el cual están dispuestos a pagar por el bienestar D. sus hijos.
