Ella tiene ocho años D. vender ropa y posee muchos clientes los cuales son muy fieles a ella, es por esto que Gladis solícita un préstamo, para que a través del cual pueda aumentar los productos D. su negocio con el fin D. poder incrementar sus ventas, solventando las exigencias D. sus clientes y obteniendo nuevos y así D. esta manera obtener más ganancias las cuales contribuyan a la economía familiar.
texts.en:
Gladis del Carmen C. D. A. is 41 and lives in Soyapango with her two adult children. They are in college, and her husband works as a salesman. Gladis sells clothing in the market in Soyapango. She sells her products every day with the goal of helping her husband pay for their home's expenses since their two children are in college and this generates a rather high cost. They are willing to pay for this for the well-being of their children. She has sold clothing for eight years and has many customers who are very loyal to her. This is why Gladis is requesting a loan, so she can increase the amount of products she has as well as her sales. She will then be able to meet her customers' demand and obtain more customers so she can earn more profits and contribute to the family finances.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente un hijo, vive en el barrio José Antonio y cuenta con estudios de secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 años.  Inició sus préstamos con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió iniciar su negocio de compra y venta de carcasa de alpaca y ovino. 

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, pagaderos en 5 cuotas, el cual lo utilizará para comprar carcasas y fibras de alpaca y ovino, las mismas que ofrecerá en las ferias de la zona, lo cual le permite incrementar su capital.
Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la confianza y el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres para poder apoyar a su familia económicamente.  Su mayor deseo es comprar una casa propia, por el momento vive en casa de sus suegros, lo que más le gusta de su grupo las facilidades que ofrecen para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Delia is a member of the community bank, "Dios es Amor" (God is Love) in the district of Mazo-Cruz, in the province of Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 29, lives with her boyfriend, and has one son. She lives in the José Antonio neighborhood and completed high school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for eight years. She started with a loan of 300 PEN, which allowed her to start her business of buying and selling alpacas and sheep. Currently she is requesting her ninth loan, which is for 1,500 PEN. It will be repaid in 5 months, and she will use it to buy alpaca and sheep meat, which she will sell at the markets in the area. This will let her increase her capital. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for the confidence and support they offer to women so they can support their families financially. Her biggest dream is to purchase her own home. Right now she lives in her inlaws' house. What she likes most about her communal bank is the ease with which they are offered loans.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca meat

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Rosa Maria Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario de nombre Rosa María y esta compuesto por Mariela del Carmen A. y Rosa María M. M.. Ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como las siguientes: Doña Mariela tiene 41 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Mariela es una joyería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y poco a poco ha incrementado su negocio por lo que con la ayuda de su amiga Rosa han decidió unirse para realizar un financiamiento que sea de apoyo para ambas. La Señora Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, su estado civil es casada. Doña Rosa tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Rosa es brindar sus servicios en un salón de belleza. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que los financiamientos son el apoyo para que su negocio salga adelante y unida con Mariela solicitan un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así cada una pueda invertir en sus respectivos negocios. El sueño de ambas es que Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones siempre estén dispuestas a brindar la ayuda para mejorar la situación.
texts.en:
The Rosa María support group is made up of Mariela del Carmen A. and Rosa María M. M.. Both have different jobs. Doña Mariela is 41 and has 2 children. She has had a jewelry shop for more than 20 years and has expanded it little by little with the help of her friend, Rosa. They have come together to obtain financing that helps both of them. Señora Rosa is 42 and is married. She has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She has had a beauty salon for more than 21 years. She has the support of their loans, which have helped her get ahead. Together with Mariela, they are requesting a loan that will go towards working capital to invest in their respective businesses. Their dream is that Fundación Leon 200 and other organizations will always be willing to offer help so people can improve their situations.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal  “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito D. Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 44 años D. edad, ella es casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (tercer grado).
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace ya 10 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/300.00 nuevos  soles, monto que invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para su tienda.

Con este préstamo D. S/3000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, piensa adquirir mas mercadería para su tienda, ahora mayorista, y abrir una pollería  que le generará mas ingresos para su familia.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda mayorista y una pollería; Lo que mas le gusta D. su Banquito son las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the “Dios es Amor” community bank in the MazoCruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 44, married, and has 4 children. She has a third graD. education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy groceries for her store. With this loan of 3,000 PEN, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will buy more merchandise for her store – now a wholesale store. She will also open a chicken store to generate more income for her family. Her biggest desire is to have a wholesale store and a chicken store. What she likes best about her bank are the meetings and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, flour, canned goods, soft drinks and other basic needs items

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 25 años, es soltera, vive con su pequeña Estefany de 8 años en su casa propia, la cual le costó mucho obtener. Ella es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado mucho para lograr cubrir todos sus gastos, ejerciendo diferentes oficios como el lavar ropa, limpieza de casa, etc. Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de golosinas y espera con este negocio pueda lograr cosas mucho más grandes. Ahora quiere arreglar su casa para que en un futuro implemente un locutorio o unas cabinas de Internet, lamentablemente sabe que esto debe hacerse poco a poco y dedicarle mucho esfuerzo. Ana tiene muchas metas futuras y quiere hacerlas realidad por el bien de su pequeña Estefany, en la cual tiene plasmadas todas sus esperanzas y es por eso que siempre está pensando en brindarle lo mejor, con cada meta que persigue. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, fue aconsejada por una vecina a la cual le fue muy bien en esta institución, y ella espera que le suceda lo mismo, para invertir sabiamente en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de golosinas y también materiales de construcción para adecuar su casa para su posterior negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, 25, is single. She lives with her little 8 year old Estefany in her own home, which she obtained at great cost. She is a woman who has always worked hard to be able to cover her expenses. She has done different jobs like washing clothes, cleaning houses, etc. Now she sells sweets, and she hopes that through this business she can achieve greater things. She would like to set up her house to have a phone shop or Internet café in the future. Sadly, she knows that she needs to do this little by little and with much effort. Ana has a lot of future goals, and she wants to make these a reality for her little Estefany. All of her hopes are centered on Estefany. With every goal Ana pursues she is always thinking about giving Estefany the best. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. A neighbor who did very well with Prisma advised Ana to get involved with them. Ana hopes she does as well as her neighbor in order to invest wisely in her business. With the loan she will buy larger quantities of sweets. She will also buy construction materials for her house for her projected business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 36 años, es soltera, vive con sus hijos; Luis de 14, Gabriel de 4, Bony de 6 y Katy de 2 añitos. Se dedica a la atención de su librería, la cual implementó en su propia casa hace 4 años, felizmente el negocio le ha ido bien y espera seguir creciendo en bien de sus hijos. Angélica es una mujer muy empeñosa, es por eso que atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 o 9 de la noche para lograr las ganancias deseadas. Su hijo mayor la ayuda cuando regresa del colegio, porque sola no podría darse abasto para la atención, a Angélica le gusta mucho la interacción con al gente, pero en algunos casos le resulta muy cansado, por las largas horas de trabajo, felizmente las ventas son buenas y su negocio va creciendo cada vez más. Ella espera en un futuro consolidar su negocio y adicionalmente tener un restaurante.  Ella es una cliente muy antigua en MFP, empezó en bancos comunales, en los cuales le fue muy bien, ahora decidió solicitar un préstamo individual, en el cual promete ser tan responsable como lo fue en el pasado. Con este dinero implementará su librería con más útiles, también irá comprando algunos muebles para ir haciendo realidad sus metas de poner su restaurante.
texts.en:
Angélica, 36, is single and lives with her children: Luis is 14; Gabriel is 4, Bony is 6; and Katy is 2. She runs a book store, which she started four years ago in her house. Happily, the business has goon well, and she hopes it keeps growing for the good of her children. Angélica is a very tenacious woman; she works in her store from 6 in the morning until 8 or 9 at night to be able to get the desired income. Her oldest son helps when he gets home from school because she couldn’t get everything done all by herself. Angélica really likes interacting with people, but sometimes she gets very tired due to the long hours she works. Happily, sales are good and her business is growing more every day. In the future, she hopes to consolidate her business and add a restaurant. She has been a client of MFP for a long time. She started in community banks, and she did well. Now she is asking for an individual loan, and she promises to be as responsible as she has been in the past. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her bookstore. She will also buy some furniture to start making her dream of having a restaurant a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Reyna Pascuala

texts.es: Reyna Pascuala G. R. de 48 años de edad reside en el municipio de Tamanique, vive junto a su hijo y su nieta de cuatro años de edad. Como toda mujer soltera, ella debe trabajar arduamente día con día para poder seguir adelante, Reyna posee un comedor el cual esta ubicado en una de las playas más hermosas del país la cual es en la Bocana del Palmarcito, debido a que vende a precios muy bajos posee mucha clientela, la cual llega día con día a degustar sus platillos. Reyna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos y de esta manera poder brindar más variedad a las personas. Su mayor anhelo es poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que la única ayuda que posee es la de un hijo el cual vive en Estados Unidos y le ayuda con $50 dólares, es por esto que ella desea aumentar sus ventas, para poder mejorar su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Reyna Pascuala G. R., 48, lives in the Tamanique municipality with her daughter and her 4 year old granddaughter. Like all single women, she needs to work arduously every day to be able to get ahead. Reyna has an eatery on one of the most beautiful beaches in the country in La Bocana del Palmarcito. Because she sells at very low prices, she has a lot of customers who come every day to enjoy her dishes. Reyna is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her dishes and offer greater variety to her customers. Her biggest goal is to increase her sales. The only help she gets is from a son who lives in the United States. He helps her with $50. She wants to increase sales to be able to improve her family’s economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 56 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo menor de 18 años, ya que uno de los mayores se fue a trabajar a la Argentina y el otro ya está independizado. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas un pequeño quiosco que tiene fuera de su casa, esto en la localidad de Chancay, a una hora y media de Lima, donde viene realizando este negocio desde hace ya varios años para cubrir los gastos económicos de su hogar. Debido a que ya los gastos en su casa han bajado, por la salida de sus hijos, quieren invertir en al compra de mayor cantidad de golosinas para incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Esta actividad les ha significado a Antonio y a su esposa (juntos en la foto) mucho sacrificio y dedicación, trabajando durante todo el día, pero felizmente ambos son muy unidos y persistentes, sabiendo que juntos podrán lograr todas sus metas. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo en Microfinanzas PRISMA, y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará gran cantidad de golosinas para implementar mejor su quiosco.
texts.en:
Antonio, 56, lives with his wife and his youngest son who is 18. One of his children went to work in Argentina. Another child is living independently. He sells sweets in a small kiosk outside of their house. It is in Chancay, which is an hour and a half from Lima. They have had this business for several years to pay for household expenses. Since their household expenses have decreased with two children leaving, they want to buy more sweets to increase their earnings. This business has required a lot of sacrifice and dedication from Antonio and his wife (together in the photo). They work all day, but happily they are very united and persistent. They know that together than can achieve their goals. This is his first loan with Midrofinanzas Prisma. He promises to be very punctual with all of his payments. With the loan he will buy a large quantity of sweets to improve business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 años, vive con sus hermanas y con sus tres pequeñas hijas, las cuales son su fuente de inspiración para seguir trabajando con tanto empeño. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de gas, sus ventas han aumentado mucho por lo que está muy contenta. Rosa hace sus contratos con las empresas de gas para que llenen sus balones, y les paga un porcentaje, luego los vende a las personas que se lo solicitan, que usualmente son sus vecinos. Pero debe cuidarse de los ladrones que merodean su vecindario, ya que vive por una zona peligrosa, por lo que no puede adquirir en grandes cantidades como quisiera, es por eso que también quiere construir un almacén seguro donde guardar su balones de gas. Rosa sabe que para todo sueño se requiere de mucho esfuerzo y para el futuro quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio para convertirlo en una gran distribuidora de gas, también quiere comprar motos para realizar servicio de entrega. Rosa es una cliente antigua de Microfinanzas PRISMA, con este préstamo espera seguir progresando en su negocio y promete seguir siendo tan disciplinada como lo ha sido hasta ahora. Ahora comprará más balones de gas e irá acondicionando mejor su almacén.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, lives with her sisters and her three small daughters. Her daughters are a fountain of inspiration for her to keep working so tenaciously. She has been selling gas for five years. Her sales have increased a lot, which makes her very happy. Rosa has contracts with gas companies to fill the tanks, and she pays them a percentage. Then, she sells them to customers, usually her neighbors. But, she has to be careful of the thieves who prowl her neighborhood. She lives in a dangerous zone; because of this she cannot get as large a quantity of gas as she would like. That is why she would like to build a safe storehouse where she can keep the gas tanks. Rosa knows that every dream requires a lot of effort to attain. In the future she wants to make her business grow a lot, and she wants to become a big gas distributor. Also, she wants to buy motorcycles to start a delivery service. Rosa has been a client of Microfinanzas Prisma for a long time. With this loan she hopes to continue making progress with her business. She promises to continue being as disciplined as always. She will buy more gas tanks and fix up her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and set up a shop/storeroom

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal MANUELA RAMOS, en el Distrito D. MAZO-CRUZ, Provincia  del Collao, Departamento D. puno. Ella tien 56 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, tiene 7 hijos y ella cuenta con estudios primarios (2do. grado).
Tambièn nos comenta que trabaja hace 12 años con Manuela Ramos y es una D. las socias fundadoras D. su Banco Comunal, asi mismo nos refiere que pudo preparar mas productos (alimento) con el apoyo que obtubo D. Manuela Ramos. Inició sus préstamos con un monto D. 300.00 soles.  Está muy agradecida por la oprtunidad que brinda a las mujeres.
Por el momento ella requiere D. un prestamo D. 3000.oo soles , el cual le permitira anpliar su restaurante para poder atender en mejores condiciones a sus clientes.  Tambien refiere que conprara los productos necesarios por mayor ya que  D. esta manera tendrá mejores gananccias.
Su deseo es continuar trabajando para su vejez, también nos refiere que lo que mas le gusta D. su grupo son los encuentros deportivos y sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the community bank Manuela Ramos in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, department of Puno. She is 56 years old, married, has seven kids and completed a second-graD. education. She tells us that she has worked with Manuela Ramos for 12 years and is one of the founding members of her community bank. Consequently, she was able to prepare more products (food) with the help that she received from Manuela Ramos. She began her loans with a total of 300.00 soles ($100 USD). She is very thankful for the opportunity it brings women. For the moment, she needs a loan of 3000.00 soles ($975 USD), which will allow her to expand her restaurant to be able to serve her customers in better conditions. Also she will buy necessary products in bulk, and in this way will have better profits. Her wish is to continue working for her old age. Also, she tells us that what she likes best about her group are the sporting matches and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, noodles, meat, vegetables and others

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia, esto en la localidad de Villa los Reyes en Lima. Desde muy joven se inclinó por las actividades relacionadas con la creatividad, es así que decidió estudiar cosmetología, implementando su propio negocio, el cual se encuentra en su casa. Esto le facilita el trabajo, ya que además de atender a sus clientes, puede pasar tiempo con sus hijos, los cuales muchas veces la ayudan alcanzándole algunos materiales durante su trabajo. Felizmente su negocio es muy concurrido y nunca le falta trabajo, haciéndolo muy rentable, por lo que Celina tiene muchas esperanzas de expandirlo comprando más materiales y herramientas para su salón de belleza. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todas sus cuotas, ya que sabe que la puntualidad es muy importante si se quiere progresar y salir adelante. Con el dinero solicitado comprará materiales para expandir su salón de belleza y hacerlo más cómodo para su clientela.
texts.en:
Celina is 38 years old and she lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. They live in the Villa los Reyes neighborhood of Lima. Celina has been drawn to creativity since she was a young girl, which is why she decided to study cosmetology. She started a business in her home. This is helpful because she can attend to her clients while spending time with her children. Her children often help her by getting materials when she is working. Happily, her business is very popular and she always has work. This makes it very profitable. Therefore, Celina wants to expand. She wants to buy more materials and tools for her beauty salon. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments since she knows that punctuality is very important and she wants to progress and get ahead. With the money requested, she will buy materials to expand her beauty salon and make it more comfortable for her clientele

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para su salón

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es: La Señora Emelina S. Ríos tiene la edad de 46 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Emelina tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Doña Emelina es una pulpería y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio y con esto logro incrementar sus ventas y sobre todo el negocio y con una excelente administración. Los propósitos de Emelina son de proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio y ampliarlo y así obtener espacio para más productos. Doña Emelina solicito un financiamiento para capital de trabajo como granos básicos, ropa de adultos, golosinas y refrescos naturales. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y con los ingresos mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emelina S. Ríos, 46, is married and has a son. Emelina has a small store and sells general merchandise. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. She has increased her sales and her business through excellent administration. Emelina plans to make improvements and expand her business, which will allow her to get the space for more products. Emelina is asking for a loan for working capital such as; basic grains, adult clothing, sweets, and natural fruit drinks. Her dream is to increase her business and use the income to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos, del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz,Provincia del Collao, Deprtamento de Puno.  Tiene 22 años de edad y cuenta con estudios secundarios conccluidos, asi como tanbièn nos comenta que tiene 1 hijo y es conviviente, ella vive en su mismo distrito.
La señora Vilma trabaja con el Movimienyo Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años.  Con su primer crédito de 500.00 soles, pudo aumentar su capital para mejorar su negocio de venta de conbustibles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará conbustible para su local, asi poder tener mayores clientes lo cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
Su mayor deseo es poder poner un grifo en su distrito asi como también poder, de esta manera, darle una profesiòn a su menor hijo.

Comenta que lo que más le gusta del Banco Comunal es que son muy unidas, asi mismo la forma de trabajo..... ya que les permite de alguna manera ahorrar.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Manuela Ramos community bank, which is in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao povince, Puno department. She is 22, and she completed high school. She has a son, is in a common law marriage, and lives in the same district. Vilma has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With her first credit of 500 PEN, she increased her capital in order to improve her business of selling fuel. With this loan of 2,500 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy fuel for her business. This will help improve her income. Her biggest desire is to be able to have a gas station in her district. This would allow her to be able to give her son a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gasoline and petroleum.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca tiene 31 años, vive con sus padres en casa de ellos con su hijo pequeño. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos a sus vecinos, a personas conocidas y también en ferias comerciales los fines de semana. A inicios de su negocio tenía pocos pares de zapatos pero supo invertir sus ganancias y hoy tiene una cantidad de mercadería considerable. Blanca adquiere sus zapatos viajando a otra ciudad, luego los distribuye a sus clientes, y en ocasiones sus familiares la apoyan en la venta cuando no puede cargar los paquetes pesados. Para Blanca esta actividad es muy  satisfactoria, por las ganancias que tiene, además porque los zapatos son un tipo de mercadería que no es perecible y si no se llega a vender no se devalúa. Para el futuro, Blanca quiere tener su propio puesto de venta de zapatos para que su negocio sea más estable. Es la segunda vez que tiene préstamo con MFP, y está muy segura que en este nuevo ciclo el trabajo con su banco comunal será más satisfactorio que el anterior. El dinero que solicita será para comprar mayor cantidad de zapatos, y de esa manera tener un mayor margen de ventas.
texts.en:
Blanca is 31 years old. She and her little son live with her parents in their house. For the past 2 years, she has sold shoes to her neighbors and acquaintances, and on the weekends at local markets. When she began her business she had very few pairs of shoes to sell, but she knew to invest her earnings, and today she offers a considerably larger quantity of merchandise. Blanca acquires her shoes in other cities, and later distributes them to her customers. Occasionally her relatives help her with the sales, when she cannot carry the heavy packages. For Blanca, this activity is very satisfying, both because of the money it earns, and because shoes are not perishable, and do not lose value if they are not immediately sold. For the future, Blanca wants to have her own permanent space to sell her shoes in, so that her business could be more stable. This is the second time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she is very certain that in this new cycle her work with the communal bank will be more satisfactory than her previous experience. The money that she asks for will be used to purchase a greater quantity of shoes, enabling her to expand the profit margin she makes on her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de su mercadería

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, cultiva principalmente papa, su tarea es ardua, ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico por lo que cuenta con la ayuda de su familiares y de personas que contrata para la siembra y la cosecha. Una vez que cosecha lleva sus productos inmediatamente al mercado de la ciudad para ser vendidos y tener el fruto de su trabajo. Afortunadamente para Lucy esta época de cosecha ha dado buenos frutos, porque el clima no ha sido devastador con sus plantaciones como en años anteriores y con esa misma fe, Lucy se proyecta a seguir sembrando más papa para las próximas fechas. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y está decidida a seguir un trabajo esforzado para el bienestar de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes e insecticidas, éstos le garantizarán una buena cosecha en su próxima campaña.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 31-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children. She has been working in agriculture for 10 years, growing mainly potatoes. Her work is arduous because it requires a lot of physical strain, which is why she counts on her family members and other people that she hires for sowing and harvesting. Once she harvests her crops, she immediately takes the produce to the city market to be sold so that she can have the fruits of her labor. Fortunately for Lucy, this season has yielded good produce because the weather has not devastated her plants like it has in previous years. Lucy faithfully plans to keep growing more potatoes in the future. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is determined to keep working hard for the well-being of all members in her microfinance institute. With this loan, she will purchase fertilizer and pesticides, which will guarantee a good harvest for the upcoming season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 49  años, es viuda y vive con 2 D. sus hijos. DesD. su niñez se dedica al cultivo D. la tierra, siempre ayudó a sus padres en estas tareas, y en la actualidad sigue trabajando, pero con la ayuda D. sus hijos. Rebeca se alegra porque esta actividad mantiene unida a su familia a pesar D. que es un trabajo duro, pero es recompensado, y con las ganancias mantiene los gastos D. su familia. Para Rebeca lo más importante es la unidad familiar, y seguirá con sus planes a futuro D. impulsar, poco a poco, un negocio  más rentable. Es la segunda vez que Rebeca tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete una vez más, a trabajar para que las relaciones interpersonales D. su grupo sean armoniosas y solidarias. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra D. sacos D. abono para la preparación D. sus tierras D. cultivo en la próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a 49-year-old widow who lives with two of her children. She has been working in agriculture ever since childhood. She always used to help her parents in farming, and she is still in that business today, but she now has the help of her children. Rebeca is happy because this business keeps her family united. Despite the fact that it is hard work, it has its rewards; with her earnings, she is able to cover the family expenses. For Rebeca, the most important thing is family unity, and she will continue with her plans to promote, little by little, a more lucrative business. This is the second time that Rebeca requests a loan from MFP, and she is committed to once again work hard so that her group can have harmonious and supportive interpersonal relationships.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía se dedica a las labores agrícolas desde hace más de 20 años, ya que nació en una familia que realiza estas labores, y se las enseñaron para que en la actualidad aplique sus conocimientos y ella misma administre su negocio. Principalmente siembra papa, pero  adicionalmente también realiza bordado de fustanes, para Rosalía trabajar es más que una satisfacción, pues le permite ser independiente económicamente y ser un pilar más en el sostenimiento de su hogar, junto a su esposo e hijos. Para más adelante Rosalía quiere producir mayor cantidad de papa y de esa manera tener más ingresos. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y tiene muchos deseos de continuar trabajando en el banco comunal que integra. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más abono para sus cultivos, además de tela y materiales para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Rosalía has been working in agriculture for more than 20 years because she was born to a family that is in that business, and they taught her how apply her farming skills and manage her own business herself. She mainly grows potatoes, but she also embroiders traditional Peruvian clothing for a living. For Rosalía, working is more than satisfying as it allows her to be both financially independent and another pillar in supporting her household, alongside her husband and children. In the future, Rosalía would like to grow more potatoes so that she can increase her income. This is the second time that she requests a loan from MFP, and she wishes to continue working with this microfinance institute. With this loan, she will purchase more fertilizer for her crops, as well as fabric and other materials for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and embroidery materials

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres. Desde hace más de 5 años trabaja en las duras tareas del campo de manera independiente, cada día está abocada en el cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo, y paralelamente a ello se dedica al bordado de fustanes obteniendo ganancias extras. Para Rosmery trabajar es un placer, y disfruta de su trabajo, aunque al final del día termine agotada. Además estas actividades sostienen la economía de los suyos, es por eso que está pensando para el futuro, intensificar sus actividades, sembrando mayor cantidad de papa y también producir más bordados. Esta es la segunda vez que Rosmery tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes de su grupo que promueve la unidad y las buenas relaciones en su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de más sacos de abono y también de hilos de colores que necesita para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 21-year-old woman who lives with her parents. She has been working independently in the arduous field of agriculture for over 5 years. Everyday, she is focused on working her crop fields. Additionally, she embroiders typical Peruvian clothing to supplement her income. For Rosmery, working is a pleasure. She enjoys her job even though she is worn out at the end of the day. Furthermore, these jobs help her support her family, which is why she is planning to work even harder in the future by growing more potatoes and embroidering more articles of clothing. This is the second time that Rosmery requests a loan from MFP. She is one of the members in her group who promotes unity and good relationships in her microfinance institute. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase more sacks of fertilizer and different colored thread that she needs for her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and embroidery materials

loans.name: Tilovathon

texts.ru: У Тиловатхон 3 детей, замужем, ей 39 лет. муж работает на заработках в России. Тиловатхон нигде не работает и занимается предпринимательством. За счет бизнеса покрываются разные расходы семьи, так как основную часть расходов берет на себя ее муж. Тиловатхон знала о программе микрокредитования МикроИнвест и решила подать заявку на займ для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Tilovathon has 3 children, she is marred and is 39 years old; her husband is working in Russia. Tilovathon does not have a job and is an entrepreneur. The business covers various family expenses as her husband covers the main portion of expenditures. Tilovathon knew about the microcredit program MicroInvest and decided to apply for a loan to grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Nargisa

texts.ru: Наргиса продает детскую одежду и обувь на центральном рынке города Исфары. Ей 29 лет, 2 детей. Муж тоже работает, а по выходным дням помогает Наргисе в ее торговле. Для закупа товара Наргиса раз в неделю ездит на оптовый рынок, а затем в течении недели продает. Наргиса собирается добавить в ассортимент товаров новые модели одежды и поэтому подала заявку на займ в КИВА.
texts.en:
Nargisa sells children’s clothing and shoes at the central market in Isfara. She is 29 years old and has 2 children. Her husband also works and on the weekends helps Nargisa with her sales. In order to purchase products Nargisa travels twice a week to the wholesale market and then sells them throughout the week. Nargisa plans to add new clothing designs to her product assortment and this is why she has applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Ilhomchon

texts.ru: Илхомчон занимается куплей продажей скота на местных рынках. Ему 33 года, имеет 2 детей. Его жена нигде не работает и сидит дома. Илхомчон закупает скот на рынке и если получиться перепродать его то продает. А если не получается то приводит его домой и там неделю за ним смотрит его жена. Затем на следующем рынке он продает скот и получает прибыль. Сейчас цены на скот оптимальные и он собирается немного расширить свой бизнес и подал заявку на займ КИВА.
texts.en:
Ilhomchon purchases and sells livestock at local markets. He is 33 years old and has 2 children. His wife does not have a job and stays at home. Ilhomchon purchases livestock at the market and if he is able to resell it he sells it. If he is not able to resell it he brings it home and there his wife watches after it for a week. Then at the next market he sells the livestock and earns a profit. Right now livestock prices are optimal and he plans to expand his business a little bit and has applied for a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Ms. Evelyn F. is 49-years of age, married and has been an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). Her husband is a laborer and she has a food vending business.  In order to generate more income, she is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP for the expansion of her business. She dreams of having retirement savings and wants to build a concrete house someday.

loans.use: To expand a food vending business

loans.name: Ahmadali

texts.ru: Эргашев Ахмадали-мужчина 34 лет. У него жена ребенок. Ахмадали  кредитуется в нашей организации второй год.  Так как весной сезон закупа скота, Абдумалик хочет на полученный заем купить овец и перепродать  по выгодной ему цене.   Он работает колхозником в дехканском хозяйстве и арендует землю и сезонно он занимается посевом картофеля.  Также он закупает скот у пастухов. Скот у него покупают его клиенты мясники.
texts.en:
Ahmadali E. is a 34 year old man. He has a wife and child. Ahmadali has been a borrower of our organization for the second year. Because spring is the season for purchasing livestock, Ahmadali would like to use his loan to purchase sheep and to resell them at a profitable for him price. He works as a collective farmer on a farm and rents land and plants potatoes in season. He also purchases livestock from shepherds. His customers, butchers, purchase his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Radjab

texts.en:
M. Radjab is 48 years old and married. He and his wife have two children, both of whom are still young and attending school. They are farmers who own a plot of land in their village to grow different kinds of crops like wheat, potato, onion and other vegetables. They have been in this business since 2004. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labor and to expand the business, Radjab would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Маматова Матлюба- женщина  33 лет. Занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Также занимается переработкой пряжи. Скот является для нее источником дохода. Муж Матлюбы уехал в Российскую Федерацию на заработки из за финансового кризиса хочет приехать обратно так как попал под сокращение. Поэтому Матлюба вынуждена одна работать сама пока и поможет ей заняться откормом скота. Матлюба очень благодарна Микроинвесту и имеет 2 года стаж сотрудничества с нами она очень рада.
texts.en:
Matluba M. is a 33 year old woman. She fattens and resells livestock. She also processes yarn. The livestock is a source of income for her. Matluba’s husband went to the Russian Federation for work and would like to return due to the financial crisis because he has been laid off. This is why Matluba is forced to work by herself until her husband returns and will help her to fatten livestock. Matluba is very grateful to MicroInvest and has 2 years of experience working with us; she is very happy.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into a concrete fact in Khairullo’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his three children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him. 

Khairullo works in agricultural activities and has some cattle. He cultivates wheat and onion and other vegetables subject to season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk. They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their three children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields. To do this, Khairullo is requesting a loan of $ 650 USD to buy the seeds and mineral fertilizers. Let’s support Khairullo in his continuous efforts to provide for the wellbeing of his family. 
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Burhoniddin

texts.en:
T. Burhoniddin is 55 years old. He is married with three children. He sells cattle and also provides transportation service. As a rule, he purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them for higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 20 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills make his business successful to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.

Burhoniddin has a large and friendly family who are always trying to help each other. Today knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Burhoniddin is planning to enlarge his stock and purchase cattle. With this purpose, he requests $800. You could become an important part in the Burhoniddin family's life and he deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.ru: Хабибуллоев Абдумуталлиб-мужчина 20 лет. Абдумуталиб с юности помогал отцу ухаживать за домашнем скотом. Абдумуталлиб узнал о нашей программе кредитования и решил кредитоваться. Он занимается откормом и продажей скота со своим дядей который является мясником который имеет мясной ларек в джамоате Костакоз Б.Гафуровского района. На полученный займ он хочет построит коровник и купить оптом жмых с Зафарабадского района.
texts.en:
Abdumutalib H. is a 20 year old man. Abdumutalib has been helping his father to take care of livestock since his youth. Abdumutalib found out about our credit program and decided to become a borrower. He fattens and sells livestock with his uncle who is a butcher and has a meat shop in Kostakoz village in the Gafurov region. He would like to use the loan to build a cow shed and to purchase oil cake in wholesale quantity from the Zafarabadsk region.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build cow shed

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Хабибуллоев Олимчон-мужчина 27 лет. Женат. Олимчон занимается откормом и купле продажей скота. Ему помогает отец. У него дома дойная корова. Жена помогает, мужу продавая молоко соседям и на рынке.  Мать Абдумалика  занимается переработкой молока, из молока она делает разные молочные изделия, и продает это на рынке Фаровон Б.Гафуровского района. На полученный займ он хочет купит сена для коровы и еще одного среднего бычка. Олимчон впервые узнал о нас по телевидению и решил попробовать он очень доволен условиями кредитования.
texts.en:
Olim H. is a 27 year old man. He is married. Olim fattens and purchases and sells livestock. His father helps him. He has a dairy cow at home. The wife helps her husband to sell milk to neighbors and at the market. Olim’s mother processes milk, makes dairy products from milk and sells them at the Farovon B market in the Gafurov region. He would like to use the loan to purchase hay for the cow and one more medium bull. Olim first found out about us on television and decided to try us out, he is very happy with the credit terms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hay and a bull

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Турдиматов Зафарджон – мужчина 27 лет. Женат отец 2-х детей. Зафарджон занимается купле продажей скота. Скот он закупает и чабанов по оптовой цене и продает мясникам. Также Зафарджону в этом деле помогает старший брат у них совместный бизнес. В дополнительно занимается посевом гороха. Получив займ он хочет расширится и увеличит свой оборот. Таким образом Зафарджон содержит свою семью и ему очень нравятся своя работа.
texts.en:
Zafarjon T. is a 27 year old man. He is married and is a father of two children. Zafarjon buys and sells cattle. He buys the cattle at wholesale price and resells to the butchers. Zafardjon gets help from his older brother, this is their mutual business. He additionally also sows peas. He wants to use this loan to expand business and increase circulation of goods. This business helps Zafarjon to support his family and he likes his work very much.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Мамадалиева Гульбахор- женщина 27 лет. Мать 2-х детей. Занимается купле-продажей скота Муж Гульбахора находится в Казахстане на заработках. Она сама ведет домашнее хозяйство. Она также является колхозницей. Ей помогает в этом бизнесе младший брат мужа. У Гульбахора дома есть дойная корова который приносит доход семейному бюджету. Гульбахор узнала о нашей программе и ей понравилась решила кредитоваться в нашей организации.
texts.en:
Gulbahor M. is 27 years old and is a mother of 2 children. She is in the business of selling livestock. Her husband works in Kazakhstan. So she manages the household on her own. Gulbahor also has a small farm and gets help running it from her brother in-law. She keeps a dairy cow to sell milk to bring in extra income for the family. Gulbahor learnt about the loan program and is very interested in participating and getting credit to buy more livestock so as to later sell it.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Nishongul

texts.ru: Турсунова Нишонгуль- женщина 49 лет. Мать 5-х детей. Нишонгуль занимается, со своей семьей переработкой пряжи вязанием шерстяных носков Ей помогают невестка и дочери. Нишонгуль реализует свой товар в городке Адрасмане, джамоате Мархамате и в городе  Худжанде. У нее имеют надежные клиенты, у которых всегда большой спрос. Нишонгуль хочет закупить оптом пряжу на полученный займ.
texts.en:
Nishongul T. is 49 years old and has 5 children. She knits wool socks for sale, working together with her family. She gets help from her daughters and her daughter in-law. Nishongul sells her stock in the towns of Adrasman, Marchamat and Hudzhande. She has a solid client base with a large demand. Nishongul would like to use the loan to buy wholesale knitting wool.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale knitting wool

loans.name: Amir

texts.ru: Мирмуллоев Амир- мужчина 30 лет. Женат отец 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. Скот он закупает и соседней Киргизской республики. У Амира 7 лет опыт работы в этой сфере. Амир также по специальности плотник и работает по заказу. Из за того, что Амир хочет купить корм решил взять займы у нас. Ему нравятся наши условия. Свой скот он реализует мясникам рынка Костакоз Б. Гафуровского района
texts.en:
Amir M. is 30 years old, married with 4 children. His business is buying livestock to feed and fatten up and then selling it. He buys the animals in the neighboring Kyrgyz republic. He sells them to butchers in the Kostakoz marketplace, in the Greater Gafur region. He has been doing this for 7 years. Amir is also a carpenter and works taking private orders. Amir likes the loan terms the organization offers and is requesting a loan to buy animal feed.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Rahimchon

texts.ru: Сулаймонов Рахимчон-мужчина 25 лет. Женат одного ребенка. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Рахимчон также дополнительно ремонтирует легковые автомобили у своего дяди в автосервисе. У Рахимчона дома 2 средних бычка . Рахимчон хочет на полученный займ купит сена и жмых  продать когда они подрастут. Когда Рахимчон на работе жена и мать.
texts.en:
Rahimchon Suleymonov is a 25-year-old man. He is married and has one child. He raises and sells cattle. Rahimchon additionally repairs passenger cars for his uncle's service station. At home, Rahimchon has two medium-sized head of cattle. With the loan he has received, Rahimchon wants to purchase hay and cottonseed oilcake to sell once they are grown. When Rahimchon is at work, wife and mother ...

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Домуллочонов Фуркат-мужчина 27 лет. Фуркат занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Сомониен 32 микрорайона города Худжанда. Фуркат закупает товар из оптового рынка « Гули Сурх» города Истаравшана. Фуркат дополнительно вечером работает  таксистом. Он решил увеличит товарооборот поэтому решил открыть вторую точку на рынке «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда.
texts.en:
Furkat D. is a 27-year-old man. He sells children's clothing at the Somonien market in the 32nd district of the city of Khujand. Furkat purchases his good from the Guli Surkh wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Furkat additionally work evenings as a taxi driver. He decided to increase his turnover, so resolved to open a second sales outlet at the Panchshanbe market, also in Khujand.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana P., 27, is married with children.  She has 1 year of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to the villagers and public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 140 Samoan Tala (WST) (~ 50 USD/week).  SPBD loans are Ioana’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase oven, cooking gas, bag corn, frying pan etc for popcorn business.

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en: Apaula A., 45, is married and has 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the public and villagers 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 270 Samoan Tala (~ 95 USD).  SPBD loans are Apaula’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan towards buying tools for her business and fees related to her childrens' schooling.

loans.use: Purchase kines, chemicals, school fees, school uniforms.

loans.name: Huriniso

texts.ru: Омонлаханова Хуринисо-женщина 34 лет. Замужем имеет 2-х детей. Хуринисо занимается продажей пряжи и носков. Она сама имеет дома домашний скот. Она занимается откормом скота. Хуринисо также занимается дома переработкой и вязанием шерстенных носков и разных вещей. Хуринисо реализует аштском  районе рынках Оппон, Ошоба , Мархамат и Булок. Хуринисо хочет купить скот на полученный  займ частично пряжу и получит прибыль. Она имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере общий стаж 10 лет.
texts.en:
Huriniso A. is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has two children. Huriniso sells yarn and socks, and at home she raises livestock. Huriniso additionally works out of her home knitting wool socks and other items that she sells at the Asht regional markets: Oppon, Oshoba, Marhamat and Bulok. Huriniso wants to purchase cattle and yarn with the loan she received and to make a profit. She has considerable experience in these endeavors, ten years of experience overall.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle and yarn

loans.name: Nemosina

texts.en: Nemosina E., 45, is married with 5 children. She has 2 years of experience in the Samoan cocoa business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 415 Samoan Tala (~ 150 USD/week).  SPBD loans are Nemosina’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for home improvement and school needs.

loans.use: Purchase school uniforms, furniture and pay school fees.

loans.name: Legogo

texts.en: Legogo E., 21, is married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village and public 4 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 390 Tala (about US $123).  SPBD loans are Legogo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She use her loan for home improvement and school needs.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia L., 32, is married with 5 children.  She has 7 years of experience in the taro plantation business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about US $126).  SPBD loans are Telesia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: Farming supplies and home improvement

loans.name: Toalua

texts.en: Toalua M., 44, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (about US $113).  SPBD loans are Toalua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan for school needs and home improvement.

loans.use: School fees and home improvement

loans.name: Tootoo

texts.en: Tootoo , 50, is married with 5 children.  She has 5 year(s) of experience in the bakery  business. She sells to the villagers/public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala .  SPBD loans are Tootoo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase bag of flour, sugar, frying pan, whipping cream, cooking oil and plastic bags

loans.name: Noa

texts.en: Noa V., 27, is married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala.  SPBD loans are Noa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy business needs and for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase timber, roof, nails, paints etc.

loans.name: Vaifanua
