loans.use: Seeds, fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami S., 57 ans est mariée avec 09 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi. Ami s’active dans l’aviculture et la restauration. Elle veut acheter des poussins à élever et acheter du pain, du lait, du café et autres pour préparer et vendre le petit déjeuner. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ami S., age 57, is married and has nine children to support. She has been been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. Ami is active in poultry farming and restaurant business. She wants to buy chicks to raise and to buy bread, milk, coffee, and other times to make and sell breakfast. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Poultry farming and to sell breakfast foods

loans.name: Mirzorahim

texts.en:
Mirzorahim is a businessman from the Pyandj district, where he lives with his wife and six children. He sells mainly flour and also ice cream and soft drinks in the market. Mirzorahim can boast of high sales because his merchandise is regularly restocked and characterized by good quality.

Presently, he is making about $500 each month. Mirzorahim is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base.

Mirzorahim is applying for a loan of $3,000 to restock his merchandise for the busy spring season and hopefully generate additional profit. This will be his first loan with IMON international and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour to increase the stock of goods for selling

loans.name: Marame

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Marame M. sollicite un crédit pour acheter des poussins, 18 sacs d’aliments, et les vaccins.  Elle compte en même temps réhabiliter le poulailler, avec le prêt.  Elle exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Parallèlement, elle est aussi facilitatrice à Tostan, une ONG qui aide la société Sénégalaise.  Elle a déjà reçu deux crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et elle les a bien remboursés.   Elle a 30 ans et habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.   Elle est célibataire, et avec les revenus de son entreprise, se prend elle-même en charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Marame M. is requesting a loan to buy chicks, 18 sacks of feed, and vaccines. At the same time, she intends to refurbish her chicken coop with this loan. She has been in this business for three years. Concurrently, she is also a facilitator at Tostan, an NGO that helps Senegalese society. Ms. M. has had two loans from IMCEC, and she has repaid them. She is 30 years old and lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She is unmarried and supports herself with the revenues from her enterprise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Saiburkhon

texts.en:
S. Saiburkhon is 50 years old and married with three children.

Nine years ago, Saiburkhon decided to start his own business selling carpets. He began his own business with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to increase the range of his carpets, he now needs a loan of $3000 which he will use to purchase more inventory. He commits to repay this amount within 12 months. Be a part of this business and of Saiburkhon's family by supporting his growing business. They greatly appreciate it!

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Mouhamadou Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Mouhamadou Moustapha N. a demandé un crédit pour construire son terrain.  Il veut acheter du ciment, du fer, du béton, et du sable.  Il a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et il a bien respecté ses engagements.  Il travail comme professeur de la langue Arabe au lycée de Khombole, un village de Sénégal.   Monsieur N. est âgé de 32 ans et il habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal. Il est marié.
texts.en:
Mr. Mouhamadou Moustapha N. has asked for a loan to build on his plot of land. He wants to buy some cement, iron, concrete, and sand. He has already benefited from a loan from IMCEC, and he indeed honored his commitments. He works as a teacher of the Arabic language at the high school of Khombole, a village in Senegal. Mr. N. is 32 years old and lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, iron, concrete, and sand for construction on his land

loans.name: Faizali

texts.en:
T. Faizali is a talented entrepreneur with a successful business selling teenager’s clothing and shoes at a busy market in Pyandj district, Tajikistan. He is not married and lives with his parents.

Faizali started his business three years ago out of a desire to earn a living and meet people’s clothing needs. He sells clothes that are both popular and affordable, which helps to ensure a strong demand for his products. Faizali is a serious business-owner who wants his business to be the best it can be while continuing to grow and be profitable. One of his main goals for the future is to have his own family and to build his own house.

Faizali has requested a loan of $3000 to purchase new inventory. The change of seasons makes this a busy time of year for business-owners like Faizali. This loan will help him keep a good supply of inventory on hand so he can meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Odina

texts.en:
A. Odina is 28 years old. He is married with two children. Odina is dedicated to his agricultural business. Having little knowledge in the beginning, he had to learn a lot about farming. As of now, he has acquired a fair amount of experience in agriculture. Currently, Odina is very happy about his two children, who are the motivation for his desire to grow his business.

He approached IMON International to obtain a loan to buy more ingredients: seeds and fertilizer to sow for a good harvest and to take care of his children and his home.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a farmer. He lives with his family, including his wife, three school-age children and his parents. His wife helps him with caring for their land. In the past they have had problems in harvesting, having to sell their crop in advance and seeing reduced earnings. But Akbar gained a lot of experience in his business and now his crop is one of the most demanded at the market.

He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta F., 60 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois de Pout Diack depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson fumé et l’élevage de chèvres. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Binta F., age 60, is married and has five children to support. She has been been a member of the village lending group of Pout Diack for six and a half years. She is active in selling smoked fish and raising goats. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell smoked fish and to raise goats

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been selling fruits and vegetables for fifteen years. Ali doesn’t own a shop; he sells his fruits and vegetables from his van which means he is a mobile salesman. He is 33-years old and lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Ali does his work well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding a cheap van. Ali decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his business. Ali has requested a loan of $1000 US from A. Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his van. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his business van

loans.name: Ibra

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibra D. dit Bamba est un jeune homme célibataire qui a commencé  à vendre des poissons.  Pourtant, depuis un an, il a ouvert une boutique sur fonds personnel.  Avec une capitale de 800,000 CFA ($1,600) son activité consiste à vendre des denrées alimentaires.  Actuellement, il a un capitale de 3,000,000 CFA ($6,000).  Avec ce crédit, il va acheter un frigo et divers autres choses pour renforcer son commerce.  Il est célibataire et âgé de 29 ans.  Il habite à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibra D., called "Bamba", is a young unmarried man who has started to sell fish. However, a year ago, he opened a shop with his own funds. With 800,000 francs CFA in capital, his business involves selling groceries. Currently, his capital amounts to 3,000,000 francs. With this loan, he's going to buy a refrigerator and various other things to bolster his business. He is 29 years old and lives in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Sénégal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and various other items

loans.name: Radjab

texts.en:
M. Radjab is 42 years old and married with three children. Radjab has been a farmer for the last four years. Farming is a passion with him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed-crop farming. He says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce he creates on his farm has a ready market.

His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing his whole land; this is because he used up all his proceeds from the last harvest to pay his children's school fees and so was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant his whole land.

Radjab is requesting for a loan of 3000 Somoni to be able to purchase the resources needed to plough the whole farm for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted fertilizer stock and seeds.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Abed El Hassan

texts.en:
Abed El Hassan is a 46 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a mason for nineteen years.

He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Abed El Hassan is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people in his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Hussein decided on running his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Virgilita

texts.en:
Virgilita L. is a rice farmer. She is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She has been into farming for 18 years already. In addition to rice, she has pigs. She thinks that hog-raising is a profitable business. She dreams that someday she will see all her children become professionals in their fields.

She is requesting a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her family increase the yield of their farm.


CEVI is reaching out to farmers like Virgilita to sustain and grow their livelihood. CEVI provides not just credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Abed El Latif

texts.en:
Abed El Latif is a 23-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Abed El Latif has owned a mobile phone shop for two years. Hussein decided on this business because of his experience in the field. When he first opened the shop, he did not face any difficulties. Abed El Latif is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region.

His previous loan helped him improve his business. He has requested another loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase additional merchandise for his shop. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his mobile phone shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working in agriculture for ten years. Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. Ali decided on starting his own business because he wanted to be independent, but he did not have the startup capital.

This is Ali's fourth loan request. The previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. He has always repaid his loans on time. This time, he is asking for a loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. Ali has plans for improving his business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Maï Astou

texts.fr: La dame Maï Astou S. est âgée de 52 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce de mil, d’arachide et de haricot. Les revenus générés vont lui permettre d’assurer de meilleurs conditions de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maï Astou S., 52, sells millet, peanuts, and dried beans. The revenue generated by this little business will allow her to ensure better living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling millet, peanuts, and dried beans

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 36-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working as a mason for ten years. Ali is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from the region. Ali decided on starting his own business because of his experience and because he wanted to be independent. Although he really did not have the startup capital when he first started his business.

This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. He is asking for a loan of 1660 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for his work. He plans on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Fatou Gueye

texts.fr: Madame Fatou Gueye C. sollicite un crédit pour acheter des marchandises de quincaillerie qui viennent de Dubai.  Elle va aussi acheter des habits de Dubai pour diversifier son activité.  Elle a une cantine qui se trouve au marché central de Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.   Elle a déjà reçu et bien remboursé quatre crédits depuis 2004.  Elle a 50 ans et elle est mariée.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou Gueye C. is requesting a loan to buy hardware items which come from Dubai. She is also going to buy clothing from Dubai to diversify her business. She has a little shop at the central market of Thiès, a town situated 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. She has already received and correctly reimbursed 4 loans since 2004. She is 50 years of age and married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware and clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 31-year old engaged man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon. Bassam has been working as a car painter and repairer for eight years. He has requested a loan of $3000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work. Bassam does his work well and he is trustworthy. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started, he had to face competition. In the future, he plans to expand his business by purchasing a paint oven for his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad has been working in agriculture for eight years. He also does recycling. Fouad is a 39-year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. He has requested a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Fouad does his work well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capital. Fouad decided on this business because he wanted to work independently. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi has been working as a blacksmith for 25 years. He is a 54-year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Ghazi does his work well. His clients can be anybody from his region or surrounding regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capital and he had to face competition. Ghazi decided on this business because he wanted to work independently and use his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hassan has been selling aluminum for a year. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase aluminum for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. Hassan is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as from surrounding regions. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Hassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum.

loans.name: Diagne

texts.fr: Diagne S. est une jeune femme de 24 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle veut ce prêt pour financer son activité de vente d’arachide, de mil et de haricots. Elle compte ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce de mil, arachide et haricot

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 24-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hassan has owned a barbershop for eight years. He requested a loan of 1330 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and a washbasin. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. 
Hassan is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of new haircuts. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Hassan decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new seat and a washbasin.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 47-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Imad has been working in agriculture for fifteen years. He requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan. 
Imad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Imad decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Aissatou Dite Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aissatou Dite Fatou N. a commencé le commerce il y a quatre ans.  Son activité consiste à vendre des crèmes et du thiouray (l’insence).  Elle veut se lancer aussi dans le commerce de poissons secs, d’huile de palme, et du miel.  Avec ce crédit elle va acheter ses nouveaux produits et diversifier son commerce.  Elle a l’âge de 39 ans et elle est mariée.  Elle habite à Thiès avec son mari et ses enfants, et avec les revenus de son entreprise elle paye les dépenses de la famille.  
Madame N. sollicite un produit spécial de l’IMCEC.  Le produit s’appelle Kiva Program de Développement de l’Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF), et il sert à aider les parents des enfants pauvres qui sont dans le projet de Christian Children’s Fund, un partenaire de l’IMCEC.  Les clients profitent d’un taux d’intérêt diminué.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou (called Fatou) N. started out in business 4 years ago. She sells cremes and incense. She would like to expand into selling dried fish, palm oil, and honey. With this loan she intends to buy these new products and diversify her business. Mrs. N. is 39 and married. She lives in Thiès wih her husband and children, and with the income from her business, she pays family expenses.

Mrs. N. is requesting a special service from IMCEC. This service is called Kiva Development Program for Children and Families (in French: PDEF) and it serves to help the parents of poor children who are members of the Christian Children's Fund project, a partner of IMCEC. These clients are able to take advantage of a lower interest rate.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of dried fish, palm oil and honey for re-sale

loans.name: Kashozi Bahingi Twetungure Group

texts.en:
Jeska is a hardworking 32-year old widow. She has one daughter of her own, who is now 16, and two orphans that she provides for.

Jeska has been in the business of selling used clothing for 13 years, but her business has undergone many changes during that period. Jeska started as a secondhand clothes hawker, with capital of 72,000 USH, in 1994 after the death of her husband. By 1995, her capital had increased to 90,000 USH with additional assets of two goats. She bought one of these goats at 8,000 USH and the other at 15,000 USH. In 1996, with her increased capital--it had reached 150,000 USH by then--she shifted her business operations to a market called Kizinda along the Mbarare. After that change, she acquired a third goat at 25,000 USH.

These days Jeska is able to earn 144,000 USH profit per month. Jeska says that she is successful in her business because she is very honest and because she is able to be very convincing when communicating with her clients. She hopes that this style of business will allow her to become a wholesale supplier of used clothing. She says the major challenges to her business include transporting her goods to different markets--she tries to sell in three different markets each week. There is also the risk of thieves on route to the markets and just generally reaching strategic selling points.

Jeska has accomplished a lot with her family as well as her business. In 1997, she was able to send her only child to Birungi Nursery School. After completing a few years there, her daughter went to a government-aided school called Kashozi Boarding Primary School. In 2007, her daughter joined Kashenyi Crane High School, a private school for secondary education. Jeska hopes that her daughter will be able to continue all the way up to university level.

Today Jeska is requesting a loan of 200,000 USH. This loan will primarily be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Khodor has been working as a mason for six years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Khodor has requested a loan.   
Khodor is special in his work because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Ali decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal has owned a bakery for ten years. Jamal is a 43-year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He does saj and mankoucheh. A saj is a metal oven where you make the saj bread. Saj is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make markouk (flat round bread) and doughy confections or mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of day but somehow it tastes better in the morning. 

Jamal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for his bakery. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Jamal does his work well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capital. Jamal decided on this business to use his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D., 47 ans  est membre de banc villageois de Mbousnack depuis 7 ans. Son activité est  la vente de céréales. Elle veut acheter du mil, des arachides et du niébé pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.  Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Amy D., age 47, has been a member of the village lending group of Mbousnack for seven years. Her business involves selling grains. She wants to buy millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas to boost her commerce. Her revenues enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas

loans.name: Wissam

Wissam is a 34-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Wissam has owned cattle for fifteen years. He produces milk and cheese. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to increase the number of his cattle by purchasing goats. This is the first time that Wissam has requested a loan. 
His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capitA.. JamA. decided on doing his business because of his experience since he took over his father’s business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. 
In the picture, Wissam is shown with a donkey. He uses the donkey like in the old time. The donkey is here to help him in his transportation when he goes to far away field and he can't take his truck.  Sometimes he also uses it to carry his stuff.

loans.use: To increase the number of his cattle.

loans.name: Khare

texts.fr: Madame Khare N. est une femme mariée qui est âgée de 33 ans, elle habite au quartier Hersent de Thiès. Elle fait le commerce depuis des années. Son activité  consiste à vendre  des tissus, habits pour bébé et divers autres marchandises. Elle est à son deuxième  prêt et a bien remboursé son premier crédit. Avec ce prêt elle envisage d’acheter des tissus pour les revendre a ses clients habituels, et compte réaliser ainsi un bénéfice de 50 000CFA ($100) avec lequel elle peut rembourser les intérêts de son prêt  et le reste le réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Khare N. is a married women who is 33 years old. She lives in the Hersent district of Thiès. She has been working in commerce for years. Her business involves selling fabrics, clothing for babies, and various other merchandise. She is on her second loan and has repaid her first one. With her current loan, she envisions buying fabrics to resell to her usual customers. Thus, she plans to realize a profit of 50,000 francs CFA with which she can make loan interest payments and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics to sell

loans.name: Vali

texts.ru: Холиков Вали-мужчина 46 лет.Женат,имеет 4-х детей.Занимается откормом и купля-продажей скота с юности,помогая родителям.Вали имеет просторный коровник и мечтает создать свою ферму.Узнав о нашей организации он решил кредитоваться у нас.На полученный кредит Вали купил телёнка.
texts.en:
Vali H. is a 46-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He has raised and traded in cattle since his youth, assisting his parents. Vali has a spacious barn and dreams of starting his own farm. Once he found out about MicroInvest, he decided to take out a loan. With the loan he received, Vali purchased a calf.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and trading cattle
